choices: Brandon Page - The college kid back home for the summer
Emily Woodward - The young businesswoman in a cut-throat world.
More Characters!
1.content:
Choose Your Character -

Brandon Page - A young 20 something spending the summer away from college (where he is studying engineering) back in his small hometown of Smallton. (I know, real original) He's currently crashing in his old bedroom in his childhood home. His mother Ashley Page (mid-to-late 40's) and his father Tanner Page, (late 40's, early 50's) are hard-working and getting ready to enjoy their upcoming retirement. His older sister, Sarah Page, (mid 20's) currently runs her small computer company out of room of the bedrooms of the house, preparing to buy the house when the parents retire.


Slightly overweight with dark hair, Brandon likes movies, alternative/indie music, books, building things, and other things. Loud, brash, but a nice guy, Brandon is your average Joe.


Emily Woodward - The young no-nonsense go-getter in the workforce, whose dedicated herself to becoming a career woman. Her golden blonde hair only covers the fire that burns inside of her to show that she can make it and run with the big boys in IntraTech Incorporated, one of the biggest companies in the world that does... things. Businessny things.

Emily likes staying active, and having drinks with her girlfriends, her main drive in life is business. She enjoys a good book, or watching something classy, but still her drive is business. She fit, blonde, very pretty, but she dosen't let her good looks mean that she won't be taken seriously. She's more than just a pretty face.

More Characters - Sure why not. Create your own, but leave a space for more choices!
1.title: Chose Your Character!

choices: He heads home. He's late for dinner with his folks.
Family dinner can wait. Let's try this puppy out! (Go about town)
Heads over to his friend's place. His friends have got to see this thing!
11.content:
For Brandon Page, it was a good day. The sun was out, the birds were singing, it was a beautiful day. It was a good, perfect beautiful day.

As Brandon drove back to his home where he was staying for the summer, with his parents, he wondered if life could get any better.
What Brandon should have been wondering is if life could have gotten any weirder, and the answer to that, is about to be a resounding yes.

Brandon Page was twenty two, finishing up college going for his degree in engineering. He loved it, building things, designing things, watching them take shape and stability. It gave him a thrill he couldn't even describe.

As he stopped at the stop sign, flicking his turn signal to left, to head home like he's done a dozen times before during this summer back in his home town of Smallton, he noticed a large sign hanging from the stop sign:

GARAGE SALE. THE STRANGE AND MYSTERIOUS! TURN RIGHT.

"Ah, what the hell" Brandon thought to himself, turning the turn signal to the right instead of left, and executing the turn.
He drove down the road a little bit, music blaring on the radio, as he saw the sign that read "GARAGE SALE. HERE!".

He turned into the driveway, and was surprised to see a large number of people parked in front of what appeared to be a large plantation style house, which was odd since no houses like that existed in Smallton to his knowledge. Parking his car, he got out and surveyed the scene, with dozens of long wooden tables laid out of the fresh green yard of the house, scattered with bizarre looking objects.

Brandon moved amongst the crowd, looking at some of the strange objects on the table before him: Odd sinsister looking dummies, a monkey 's paw, odd books with titles like "Easy Spells 4 You", "Life Changing Spells" amongst other things. A large wooden box with no seems with what appeared to be Hebrew written on it, a map to a mysterious "Lost Island" in the middle of the pacific, a small hand mirror with the words "True Beauty Is Within" engraved on it.

This wasn't mystical. It was all junk.

As Brandon looked over the items, he was approached by a tall, gaunt, pale man, wearing a long black trench coat, a large black fedora, long black pants, and slick black shoes. Underneath the black trench coat, Brandon could see a thin black T-Shirt.

"Greetings. Welcome to my Garage Sale. I am Yaral. I have just moved here and am selling my things. Would you like to purchase my things?" Yaral said, his speaking manner was off, almost like someone was learning to speak it for the first time, slow and methodical.

"Uh, hi. I'm Brandon. Nice to meet you. I didn't know anyone lived down this way. I've lived in Smallton almost my whole life, and usually it's just a long forest path down here." Brandon said, looking over the stuff.

"I have just moved here, including my house. I have purchased this land and now I am selling my things to pay for it. Would you like to purchase my things?" Yaral said again in his strange manner.

"Well, what have you got?" Brandon says, looking back over the strange objects.

"I have things for the darkest corners of the Earth, where man and woman alike fear to step foot. Places where magics and monster still thrive in your - - - I mean our - - world. " Yaral said. Brandon noticed that ever since he had started talking to Yaral, Yaral hadn't blinked.

"Uh-huh. Well, I'll just look around some more" Brandon said. He poured over the tables while Yaral seemed to be watching him. On the table he saw a camera that supposedly saw the future, a "wishing stone", and some strange coin with two pregnant people on the front of it.

Flip Me Brandon a strange voice seemed to command Brandon.

Brandon picked up the coin, looked at it, gave it a flip, and looked at some random passerby at the garage sale.

Buy Me Brandon a strange voice told him.

"Meh" Brandon said putting the coin back on the table, and continued to look. Moments later, he was bumped into by someone who ran past him, holding their mouth, looking like they were about to be sick.

"Wonder what's there problem?" Brandon asked looking at the person who just ran past, before picking up some strange round amulet.
"Ah, an excellent choice." Yaral said to Brandon.
"What is it?" Brandon asked looking at the amulet. It was round with six round stones dotting along the edges of the amulet. Below each stone were the numbers 1 through 9. In the middle of the stones was a giant "X" that looked like it could be pressed. The top stone was odd. Half of it was colored blue, the other half was colored pink, and had the number 8 light up under the stone.
"This was supposedly a device that when used allowed a person to transfer a pregnancy from one person to another." Yaral explained.

"From one person to another? You mean from one woman to another." Brandon said, correcting Yaral's mistake.
"No. From one person to another, male or female." Yaral corrected Brandon's corrected.
"Oh come on." Brandon said, disbelief in his voice.
"You doubt this item? This item has a long history. Supposedly it was old when the world was young, it was used by those who possessed it to ease the burden of child-bearing. A husband could carry the child for his wife, or a mother for her daughter. It could be used to take a pregnancy away from a tavern wench who was bearing a royal heir and transfer it to another woman. Supposedly when the pregnancy is transferred, whomever it is transferred into, that child becomes there, in blood and in spirt. " Yaral explained.

"How does it work?" Brandon asked, his curiosity peaked. He's never heard of anything like this.
"I do not know. When I found it, it hadn't been used in ages. But as you see here, it looks like there are two children waiting for a new home" Yaral said, pointing at the pink/blue stone with his overly long, thin, boney finger.
"How is that even possible?" Brandon asked looking at the stone.
"They say once a pregnancy is taken from one, it awaits here in these stones, perfectly safe, waiting to be put into someone." Yaral said.
"Some said it's magic from a time where magic still ruled this world, other says it's technology that fell from the stars" Yaral finished.
"This thing is weird" Brandon said.
"This weird thing can be yours for just five dollars." Yaral said.
"Five bucks?" Brandon thought about it.

What would he even use this thing for? There's no possible way it could work. It's just some odd looking necklace with a bizarre story this guy cooked up. Still, Brandon was a lover of the strange and unusual, and it was only five bucks. He spent more money on worst things. I mean, it's just a necklace, there's no way that it could work...

"Ah, what the hell. Here" Brandon said, pulling out five dollars from his wallet and handing it to Yaral.
"Excellent choice young sir. I'm sure it will serve you well. Now before you go, take this" Yaral said, reaching into his pocket, pulling out a small thick book about the size of a paperback novel.

"What's this?" Brandon asked, grabbing the small hefty book.
"The instruction manual. I would be sure to read it over" Yaral said before walking off to other parts of the yard sale.

Brandon was standing there, mystical necklace in one hand, a small paperback novel of instruction in the other. He wondered what he just got himself into.
11.title: Garage Sale!

choices: Thoroughly read the instructions. Better safe than sorry!
Oh man, so many words. Let's just skim it!
111.content:
Brandon stood at the garage sale, wondering what to do next, when his watched beeped at him, reminding him that it was now 5 PM, and that he was in fact, going to be late for dinner with his family.
"Oh man, I'm going to be late for Spaghetti Night!" Brandon said, hurrying back to his car. He through the novel sized instruction booklet and the amulet in the passenger seat, put on his seatbelt, turned the key and drove off towards home.

Brandon didn't seem to notice that as he left the garage sale, the path behind him seemed to shift back to the wooded path that he talked about, the signs of a garage sale almost nowhere to be seen.

Ten to fifteen minutes later, he pulled into the driveway of his home in his small neighborhood where he grew up. It hadn't changed much since he was a kid, only that the houses had new owners with small children running around. He noticed that both that his father and mother were home, (his mother being home early wasn't surprising. She always got home first to cook), as he saw their cars in the driveway.

He noticed his older sister Sarah's car was also parked nearby, her car littered with logo's of Page Software, the small computer software company that his sister ran out of the rooms of the house. It was going surprisingly well for her, and when her parents retired in two years, his older sister Sarah was going to purchase the house and turn it into a complete home office, in order to continue save some money in a bad economy then renting out an office space.

Getting out of his car, and taking his newly purchased amulet and instruction manual with him, he headed inside. Once inside, he was hit with the delicious aroma of his Mom's world famous (at least according to Brandon) Spaghetti.
"Mmm" Brandon said, his mouth practically watering at the smell.
"Oh hello honey. How was your day?" His mother Ashley asked, preparing the dinner. Ashley Page was 46, and she was starting to show it. Her golden blonde hair was starting to grey a little, she was starting to get tired more easily, her looks began to fade. Still, she was one of the kindest nicest people that many would ever meet, and she was a good mother, balancing the act of being a mother and a teacher at the local High School for more than twenty years.

"It was fine. Did some odd jobs around town for extra cash" Brandon said heading up to his room.
"Don't mess around up there for too long! Dinner will be ready soon!" Ashley said, shouting up after her son.

Heading up to his room, he saw his father coming out of the master bedroom, getting changed over from his job at the office.
"Heya Brandon, how's it going son?" Tanner asked his son.
"Good Dad. How as the office?" Brandon asked.
"Fine, we're still busting our humps for the big account, but I'm confident we'll get it. I have a big presentation tomorrow." Tanner said.
Tanner Page was 50, but never let age slow him down. He's physically fit for a man his age, which is impressive considering how often he's sitting around the office.
"Where's Sarah?" Brandon asked.
"She's in her office. I wouldn't disturb her. Sounds like she had a rough day." Tanner said, heading downstairs to help his wife cook dinner.

Brandon snuck past his sister's office and into his room, which was just the way he left it when he went to college. His stack of movies rested in the corner, next to his bookshelf. His models and legos which got him interested in engineering lay strung about his room, on shelves and on tables. His laptop lay resting on his desk, some plans he drew up for something tucked neatly behind the screen saver.

Throwing the amulet and book on his bed, he kicked off his shoes and screwed around for a little bit on his computer, checking email messages, chatting with friends, and playing a game. Eventually, his eyes went back to the amulet.

Picking it up off the bed, he looked at it, wondering what the hell he was going to do with it. He finger traced each stone, stoping lastly at the one that supposedly held a twin pregnancy waiting to be transferred.

"Why the hell did I buy this?" He asked himself, suddenly wanting his five dollars back.
He threw the amulet back on his bed and picked up the instruction manual. Brandon loved books, but as he started glossing over this small novel, it wasn't written like a book, it was written like stereo instructions.

Brandon decided to...
111.title: Heading Home!

choices: His mother Ashley.
His sister Sarah.
His father Tanner?!
1112.content:
His eyes glazed over trying to read this instruction manual, which was simply titled:
"The Preg-Transferer User's Handbook - A Safe and Practical Guide For Pregnancy Transference and Trouble Shooting - Third Edition Revised"

Brandon skimmed through the novel sized instruction manual a few pages at a time, trying to get the jest of this crazy nonsense.

"Thank you for using The Preg-Transferer. Please ensure that any pregnancy transferred between one party and the next is thourghly agreed to before using said device. Creators of the Preg-Transferer are not held responsible for any child support payments or other force of legal action caused by proper misuse or agreeing contract by person or persons using The Preg-Transferer. If properly used and maintained The Preg-Transferer will be your go to device for all matters maternity and paternity related. Please consult a physician before transferring a pregnancy into a male or female to ensure proper health of new child-bearer and child. The makers of Preg-Transferer do not make paternity clothes, any men who agree to use Preg-Transferer as way to ease the burden of a female agree to - - - "

And it just went on like that for pages.

"This is so freaking boring!" Brandon says skimming the book so more. "Isn't there a way that this thing just tells you how to use it?"

Turning some more pages, he sees a page called "Proper Usage Of The Preg-Transferer" and begins to skim it.

Muttering to himself, he gets the idea that all he needs to do is wear the amulet, point at someone, and think about it, and the person will either have a pregnancy transferred out of them or into them depending on the person's current "state". All pregnancies that are stored in the stone will be perfectly safe and healthy until transferred into a new person.

Once a pregnancy is transferred into a person, the person and persons around will always believe the person to have been pregnant, but reality will not reflect this. If a pregnancy is transferred into a male, a healthy temporary uterus is transferred into the male as well ensuring a happy healthy pregnancy.

If at anytime the user wants to undo a pregnancy, or set everything back the way it supposed to be, all the user has to do is press the giant "X" in the center of the amulet, and all pregnancies revert back to normal.

"What a load of crock" Brandon says reading over the instructions.

There were hundreds of more pages, each dedicated to troubleshooting and what to do in each situation. Brandon threw the book aside, picked up the amulet, looking at it.

"Eh. What the hell. It's not like it's going to work" Brandon said putting it on. As he put it on, he felt a low hum that seemed to rattle the fillings in his teeth.

"Kids! Dinner!" His mother yelled from down stairs.
Not bothering to take off the amulet, he headed downstairs to eat.

His sister Sarah was waiting for him at the table. She was a lot like her mother, long pretty blonde hair, a beautiful face, a killer body (or at least that what her mother kept telling her). Women wanted to be her, and men wanted to get with her.

She sat at the table, typing something out of her tablet computer, as her mother served the bowls of piping hot spaghetti.
"Hey dork, what's up?" His sister said playfully, not actually meaning the name dork behind her words.
"Nothing much." Brandon replied taking his seat.
"Nice necklace. Where'd you get that thing?" His sister asked.
"Garage sale not far from here. Supposedly it has some kind of powers or something." Brandon said.
"The only power that thing has is chasing women away, and good knows you don't need any extra help with that. Hope you kept the receipt." Sarah said with a smile.

"Thanks sis" Brandon said.
"Alright, eat up!" His mother said, putting the last bowls on the table.

As Brandon watched his family move around the kitchen, he got an idea. Why not test this thing out here? It's not like it's going to work, so why not just mess around.

Looking at his mother Ashley, his father Tanner, and his sister Sarah, Brandon decided to use the amulet on.....

(Pfft, it's not like it was going to work anyways)
1112.title: This. Is. Boring. Let's Try This Thing Out!

choices: After Ashley eats, Brandon takes her shopping
Brandon uses the amulet
11121.content:
Brandon decided to use it on his mother. Hell, even if this thing DOES work, at least she's gone through it before. he thought. While his mother was facing the stove, Brandon pointed to her, and thought about her being pregnant.

His sister noticed what he was doing, and pointed it out. "What the hell are you doing, weirdo?" she said, her eyebrows raised. Brandon remained silent, as the amulet began to glow.

PING!

The oven went off, and his mother began to slowly back away. "Ugh. I'm getting way too old for this!" she said. She opened the stove and attempted to bend over but she just couldn't. Brandon, sweetie, do your mother a favor and get the bread out."

Brandon got up from the table and approached his mother, who's appearance had changed. She now had a stomach the size of a woman over nine months pregnant, and had bigger breasts. She began to rub her newly-exposed stomach. Brandon retrieved the bread from the hot stove. "Thank you so much, dear. Your brother and sister have really been giving me difficulty lately." "No problem." he replied. He brought the bread to the table and took a seat, while his mother waddled towards it.

"You know, honey, you should really get some new clothes soon. You're nearly nine months pregnant with twins for Christ's sake" his father said. "I know, I know. Maybe tomorrow." They continued to eat (Ashley ate the most, obviously), and soon finished. Brandon went to use the restroom, and when he finished, he found his mother on the couch eating pickles and ice cream whilst watching TV. In between bites, she rubbed her twin-filled belly.

Brandon walked to his room, and decided to use the computer whilst listening to the local Alt Rock station. Hours had passed, and it was nearly midnight. "...and that was Ready to Start by Arcade Fire. We've got some Daft Punk and The Strokes coming your way so be sure to stick around." the DJ said. Brandon turned off the radio as his mom opened the door, her belly bared to him.

"Hey, Brandon. Do you think you could take me to the mall tomorrow? Your sister and father are both working, and I can't drive with this belly in the way." "Uh-Yeah, sure, mom." "Thanks, sweetie." Her mother approached him. "I know it's difficult for you to adjust with having to have new siblings soon, but it means so much to me that you help out so much." she continued, kissing his head. "Um, mom...do you mind it I felt?" he said. "What, of course!" she said. Brandon slowly drew his hand to his mother's large stomach, feeling around her popped-out belly button. He could feel movement inside, which slightly amazed him. "Okay, get some sleep, dear." she said as she exited the room.

Brandon fell into his bed, his hand around the amulet as he fell asleep.
--------------------------------------------
The Next Day

Brandon rose from his bed and walked towards the kitchen. His father had already left for work, and his sister was sitting at the table eating. He opened the pantry and grabbed the half-empty box of cereal, placing it on the table. Grabbing a bowl and some milk, he then turned back to the table, and saw his mother waddle down the hallway. She was dressed in pajamas, but the button-down shirt was two small, as she could only get the top two buttons buttoned.

As Ashley began to prepare a breakfast for herself, her two children ate breakfast at the table.
11121.title: His mother Ashley.

choices: The Maternity Store
The Food Court
111211.content:
Brandon's mother finished her large breakfast, and waddled back to her bedroom to get dressed. "I'm so glad that you're able to take her places now, Brandon. I was getting tired of having to lug her around to everywhere. Now I can finally continue my work." said his sister, Sarah. "Well, I'm just trying to help out. She is pregnant with twins, after all." "Ugh, seeing Mom so big at her age makes me NEVER want to be pregnant." she scoffed. "Wow..."was all Brandon could say.

"Alright, Brandon. Ready to go?" his mother said wearing yoga pants and an athletic shirt that was too small to contain her pregnant belly. "Yeah...sure. What are you wearing, Mom?" he said. "Oh, I forgot to mention, I have a prenatal yoga class in 20 minutes, but it's at the mall, thankfully, so it's not out of the way." "Alright.." Brandon grabbed the car keys and exited the house with his mother.

Approaching the car, Brandon absentmindedly slid his finger to the third circle on the mysterious amulet, which was still around his neck. He sat in the driver's seat, as his mother was adjusting the passenger's seat to accommodate her pregnancy. Brandon began to adjust the mirrors, giving it full attention. "So, Mom, what's it like to be pregnant?" he asked, gesturing to her swollen stomach. Before she could reply, a sound similar to a balloon inflating could be heard, grabbing Brandon's attention.

He glanced at Ashley, and saw her pregnant belly slowly expand. She seemed oblivious to the fact, and by the time that it had stopped growing, she looked well overdue with twins. "Well, it's difficult at my age, especially with triplets, but I'm really loving it!" she said, rubbing her belly. Triplets..., he thought, before driving to the mall.

Brandon pulled into the mall's parking lot, and quickly exited the car to help his mother get out. After a few tries, he heaved her up and entered the mall. "So, at this yoga thing, do I have to, like, help you or anything?" he asked. "No, sweetie. It's just a few stretches to help us stay in shape. This isn't Lamaze class or anything like that where you need a partner. I just needed a ride, and I decided to give Sarah a break. Speaking of which, I can't wait until Sarah finds someone to have children with!" she said, excitedly. Well, I think you'll be a little disappointed, Mom. he thought.

Brandon was lead to a store with a sign reading 'Mamaste: Prenatal Exercise for Mother and Child'. Inside, the room was filled with pregnant women of all shapes and sizes, but none bigger than his mother, who was talking to a woman with blond pixie-cut hair and blue eyes. She appeared to be six or seven months pregnant.

"Brandon, come here! I'd like you to meet Janice, the class instructor." Ashley said. "Hey, Brandon it's nice to meet you! Your mom talks about you a lot but I've only met Sarah." Brandon noticed that his mother had left to talk to other women in the group. "So are you excited to be a big brother? I think it's pretty amazing that your mother is able to carry triplets at her age!" "Yeah, it's pretty amazing...I don't really know how I feel about being an older brother, though...How far along are you?" he finished, changing the subject. "I'm almost seven months!" she said, giving her belly a rub. "I guess your husband must be pretty excited, then..." he said. "Oh, I don't have a husband. My boyfriend ditched me after I gave him the news, so I guess I'm going to raise my little girl on my own...Anyways, I should probably start class." she said, turning away from Brandon.

Brandon grabbed a seat as Janice began class. After nearly 10 minutes of watching the women do exercises, which oddly turned him on, Brandon dozed off, waking up to his mother approaching him. "All done?" he asked. "Yes. Did you get bored?" "A little bit, yeah." he replied, stifling a yawn. "Where to next?"
111211.title: Yoga for Four, Please

choices: His mother, back from the changing rooms.
The instructor from just a little while ago.
1112111.content:
"Alright Brandon, sorry to put you through that... let us just go to the maternity store then we can go home. I am getting a little hungry after all that and a nice home cooked meal sounds great.", His mother smiled and gently rubbed her belly. Brandon agreed and got up, helping his mother to waddle through the mall and to the maternity store. Though to Brandon's surprise the store was packed, or it seemed that way with how big and pregnant all the customers were inside. You couldn't go two feet without bumping into someone or being bumped into. You would figure a store like this would provide its customers more space to move.
"Oh! Let me just go try a few of these on, they look so cute!" Brandon's mom then took a handful of outfits and headed to the changing room in the store. While waiting, Brandon started to wander around the store. Starting to not pay attention as he was getting bored again. Someone bumped into him and knocked him over, the amulet taking a bit of a hit during the fall.
"Oh! I am so sorry!", a hand reached out to help him up... it was...
1112111.title: The Maternity Store

choices: Now Brandon was pregnant too!
Now someone else was even more pregnant!
11121112.content:
Janice smiled, using one hand to pull Brandon up while resting the other on her belly. "I almost didn't see you there!" She giggled.

What Janice didn't realize was that she had knocked Brandon over onto the amulet, the amulet that had gone off when he'd sat back up.
11121112.title: The instructor from just a little while ago.

choices: start coming to my class tomorrow?"
come get some food with me? I'm really hungry."
111211121.content:
PING!

Brandon rubbed his swollen tummy while a woman who had been pregnant only moments ago was now wearing a maternity shirt that hung loosely on her, left the store quickly.

"Did I hurt your babies?" Janice asked nervously, placing a hand on Brandon's exposed belly. His shirt barely covered half of his baby bump. She bit her lip, waiting for a reply.

Brandon smiled. "No, I think the twins are alright. But thanks for asking!" He patted his belly confidently. His thoughts were a little hazy though, he was trying to remember why he was here.

"It's so adorable that you're helping your mother pick out some clothes, shame they don't have a men's section though." Janice frowned a little.

Brandon shrugged. "It's alright, I do wish I had some bigger clothes though." He rubbed the exposed part of his belly and blushed a little. "Then it would be less obvious how fat I've gotten!" The two of them laughed a little and Janice assured him he wasn't fat.

"Hey though, that reminds me," Janice started to say "Why don't you...
111211121.title: Now Brandon was pregnant too!

choices: He became more pregnant to the max of six babies.
Ashley became more pregnant to the max of six babies.
1112111211.content:
"Why don't you start coming to my class tomorrow?" Brandon thought for a moment and reply.

"Why not. It time to join your class. I was scared to say it."

"Why?" Janice asked.

"I will be the only guy there that is pregnant and I didn't want to be a perve or anything?"

"True."

"Who knows. Mybe I continue to keep growing with the babies in me and never give birth."

"Wow. You like being pregnant?"

"At first I was scare then my mom became pregnant, they help me out and they were suprise that I was pregnant. Couple of days age I saw a video on youtube called world wildlife fund unborn where this woman found out she became pregnant and the baby or babies refused to come out. She return to her job as a waitress and the baby keep getting bigger and bigger. Then I had a dream that I was that woman but my pregnancy was the size of a car and my family was enevy. You think I'm a pregnant freak."

"No I don't. Now I'm a little turn on now. After class mybe we have a private moment at my house." She kiss Brandon on the lips and waddle away.

"Brandon there you are. I was worried that your went into labour." Ashley waddle out of the maternity store with bags in her hands.

"I'm fine mom. Janice want me to come to yoga and I want too."

"About time too. The girls in the class was betting if you won't do it. I got some clothes for both of us and how the twins doing?"

"There fine mom. I catch up to the car for a few okay?"

"Bathroom again?" Brandon nodded. Ashley waddle and he look at the maternity store then he notice that the amulet wasn't broken or the empty balls were there. He pointed at the maternity store and the balls was full. Brandon thought was the balls were there before, he waddle to the car and a group of woman who were pregnant walk out the store with weight of the world was gone.

He got in the car and started to drive back home. Ashley turn on the radio when a huge bump shake the car up and down and the amulet was button was push. then he notice....
1112111211.title: start coming to my class tomorrow?"

choices: Suddenly the malfunctioning amulet goes off!
Something else.
1112111212.content:
"Hey that reminds me!" Janice started to say. "Why don't you come get some food with me? I'm really hungry." She ran a hand along the curve of her belly as she said this.

"You want me to come with you?" Brandon asked, a little surprised.

"Of course!" Janice said, happily grabbing his hand and pulling him to the food court excitedly. "If two pregnant people can't satisfy their cravings in a food court, then where can they?" She giggled, inhaling all the smells of food around them.

Several minutes later, Janice was sitting down with a tray of Chinese food, while Brandon had a pretzel with a lemonade. Unfortunately the only table they could find was a small, half booth, in the back corner. "Guess nobody wants to give up their seat to the pregnant people...." She grumbled.

Brandon didn't say much, instead he just blushed because of the fact that his belly and Janice's belly were touching each other while squished in the booth.
1112111212.title: come get some food with me? I'm really hung...

choices: go to the maternity store
go somewhere else
1112112.content:
“I should go to the maternity store and get some clothes that actually fit but…” began Ashley before her belly gave a groan, “I’m starving, these unborn siblings of yours are causing me no end of hunger.”

Brandon and his mother made their way to the food court; Ashley drew a lot of stares, it was more correct to say her belly drew a lot of stares. It wasn’t just the size or her age or the clothes she was wearing, each of these would attracted quite a few stares by themselves, it was all of these things together that seem to draw everyone’s gaze. Whilst it was uncommon to see a woman Ashley’s age pregnant it was just seeing one as pregnant as her, the clothes she was wearing only seem to increase the attention, as the athletic shirt was already too small before she gained the third child. Brandon felt slightly embarrassed about all the stares his mother seem to be attracting with her gravitational mass, but soldiered on. “I there anything you particular you feel like?” asked Brandon.
“As it so happens I am craving a burger, but don’t know if that will be filling enough.”
“You don’t?!”
“No, I’ll guess I see how a feel when I order.”

Brandon ended up getting a burger with fries, whilst his mother got two and a large chocolate desert, “I thought I would have a light meal,” said Ashley jokingly after seeing Brandon surprised glance at her meal. Despite the fact that she was eating more than twice as much as her son Ashley finished her food about the same time as Brandon and might of finished before him if it wasn’t for the fact she had to use her belly as a table as said belly was preventing from using the table, this in turn meant she had steady the food with one hand so that an errant kick from an unborn child didn’t send it falling to the ground.
Ashley gave a short but distinct burp after finishing the last of her meal, “That hit the spot.” She went to get up, Brandon rushed over to help and after what felt like more effort than earlier that morning got his mother to her feet. “Thank you sweetie, I don’t know if I’ll will be able to get back into shape after these little guys come out,” said Brandon’s mother wiping her face with a napkin with one hand whilst settle her belly with the other, “the amount they have made me eat has ruined my figure, I swear my backside has doubled in size since I have become pregnant,” she slapped her rear to emphasize the point. “Well time to get those clothes now, though that would probably be a lot of money for some clothes I’m only going to wear for a couple a weeks and never again, it not like the expenditures are going to down soon,” she said now caressing her globular stomach, “and I doubt I can give them to some else to use, I doubt I will ever meet someone as big as I am now,” she said with a laugh.
1112112.title: The Food Court

choices: They go to a doctor's check-up
They go back home and Ashley tries her new outfits on again
11121121.content:
"Well, let's go!" Ashley said enthusiastically, reaching out to her son to help heave her up. Brandon walked around and put his mother's arm over his shoulder, helping her stand up with him. It was no easy task, as anyone could see from looking at her. Ashley's belly was the size of a ripe watermelon and her clothes couldn't even begin to cover its size. As Brandon helped his gravid mother up, he couldn't help but think that her recent meal had made her even heavier.

"Okay?" Brandon asked as he got his mother up on her own two feet. Ashley let out a long sigh and bent back, her belly jutting out a extra inches in front of her.

"Great, thank you dear," Ashley smiled, wrapping her hands around her belly. "Standing up also woke up the little ones inside me, so I'm getting some nice kicking that way! Now, onto the maternity store. I can't be walking around with my belly hanging out all the time, can I?"

Hopefully not... Brandon thought, accompanying his mother to the next store. Eyes were all over her as she walked, and plenty of people were snapping pictures of his mother with their phones and cameras. He felt weird about this, but he wasn't too surprised. His own mother had one of the biggest pregnant bellies he'd ever seen and was waddling around with it out. It was, of course, rude for people to take pictures, but it was certainly a rare sight. Plus, it was his own mother. He didn't like the idea of people gawking over her.

Inside the maternity clothing store, things weren't too different. Even pregnant women who looked full term were giving Ashley plenty of attention. Ashley looked around for some clothes that would fit, not having much luck.

"I look like I'm 13 months pregnant..." Ashley chirped to herself as she compared a rack of "37-41 week pregnant" clothes to her own immense frame. "I need to find a clerk."

The clerk, a small, cute girl with short, brown hair and a big hair clip, had been curiously watching Ashley from around a rack of clothes when she heard the big mama-to-be talking to herself. "I-I can help you, ma'am."

Ashley beamed and turned to face the clerk, her entire belly now dead-center with the petite woman. Brandon saw that the look on the clerk's face was as surprised as his when he first saw his mother pregnant.

"W-well, we do have some special multiples outfits, but we usually just keep those in the back. I can help you find something," she said back, face starting to blush. Ashley smiled and got closer to the clerk, her belly only inches away now.

"Great, show me what you've got," Ashley said. Brandon followed his mother to another corner of the store, where the clerk grabbed some outfits off the racks. She guided Ashley to the changing room and paused.

"I can help you with these, unless you-" The clerk began before Ashley cut her off.

"No, it's alright. My son can come in and help too," she smiled at Brandon. Brandon turned pale as his mother beckoned him to follow her into the changing room. Inside, she flipped off the flimsy shirt she was wearing, as well as her sweatpants, to reveal her bare, pregnant body. Save for her bra and underwear, of course.

"Try this first," the small woman said, a deep blush starting across her face as she handed Ashely the first outfit. Thank you thank you thank you for this job, she silently prayed.

Ashely pulled the outfit over her body, taking another pair of expanded maternity jeans from the clerk. Surprisingly, it ended up covering her belly pretty well, although it was incredibly tight. Her belly button was clearly visible. There were some frills on the front that accentuated the curve.

"This is nice," Ashley said. "What else do you have?" The clerk began to happily hand her outfit after outfit, now taking more initiative with helping Ashley put the clothes on, including running her hands down her belly.

"I hope you don't mind," the clerk said as she first rested her fingertips against the round, tight, pregnant skin.

"Of course not!" Ashely grinned. "I love to let people feel my big ol' tummy." The clerk looked like she was almost going to pass out.

After plenty of changes, Ashley decided on a few choice outfits. "I don't expect to be spending that much time outside, so this is probably all I need now," Ashley said. "These babies aught to be coming soon."

"Well, please feel free to come back whenever," the clerk said, happily packaging Ashley's new clothes. "Even if it's not for c-clothes, you can just visit!"

Ashley laughed. "Well...thank you! You're so helpful." She leaned over and gave the small woman a hug. With her belly and breasts, Ashley almost crushed the petite clerk, but she looked like she was in heaven.

Brandon couldn't help but notice all of what happened nervously. He moved his hand around his neck, wiping away beads of sweat. As he did, he stroked the chain of the necklace. As he did, a massive pregnant woman who was walking by felt her belly as it suddenly shrunk down and Ashley's doubled in size.

"Well, I might be coming back," she said, running her hands over her ballooning belly. "Now that I think about it, these outfits might not be able to handle the belly of someone pregnant with five babies." Ashely giggled again and thanked the clerk as she and Brandon headed out.

"Five babies, mom?" Brandon said, checking to see if he heard her right. Ashley smiled sweetly at her son and caressed her belly.

"Yes, I know, I can hardly believe it myself somedays, but it's true...thank you so much for your help lately, by the way," Ashley said, planing a little kiss on her son's cheek. "I really appreciate it."

"N-no problem," Brandon said, a little stunned by his mother's sudden show of affection. She had never been like this before the, well, the sudden pregnancy. Just what was in store for him now?
11121121.title: go to the maternity store

choices: Later that day
The next day
111211212.content:
“Time to go home,” said Ashley, “I’m sure Sarah would love to see them.” Brandon remembered his sister’s comment from earlier that day and thought more accurately that Sarah couldn’t care less about the new maternity clothes and probably would resent the idea of having to watch Ashley force her distended body into them.
The clerk watched them leave until Ashley was out of sight, (which took awhile) “KAITE,” exclaimed her boss, “don’t just stand there and help customers.”
“She was a nice girl,” said Ashley as she and her son made their way back to the car, Ashley attracting more stare then before. Brandon gave a vague noise of agreement, he knew the look in clerk’s eyes when she saw Ashley’s belly. “I didn’t even ask her what her name was, what she must think of me.” Brandon had a pretty good idea of what the clerk thought.

They arrived at the car, “Brandon I think the passenger seat is broken, “said Ashley it has slid forward. Brandon went and looked at the seat, indeed it was too far forward for his mother to sit in, it was quite far back a woman pregnant with triplets could triplets could sit there but Ashley was…well bigger than a woman with triplets. Brandon slid the seat as far back as it could go and helped his extremely gravid mother in, even with the seat set back as it could Ashley’s belly still was jammed up against the dash board. “Maybe I should sit in the back,” said Ashley, she went to get up but she was wedged in there so tightly that after another couple of minutes of struggling Ashley said, “maybe it would be better just to go home and try and get I will try and get out then.”

The ride home was uneventful, getting Ashley out of the car and to her feet on the other hand was quite difficult, in the end Brandon had to go and get Sarah from inside, who obviously didn’t like being called away from her work to help get their very pregnant mother get out of a tight spot. They managed to get Ashley out, to her feet and into the living room. Sarah was just leaving to go to her room when Ashley said, “wait don’t you want to see me in my new clothes?”
Sarah gave a loud sigh, “I’ve got a lot of work a need to do, but if you want my opinion, I think those clothes are way too small for you,” she reached into one of the bags and withdrew another piece of clothing, “even without you putting this one I can tell it is much too small,” said Sarah tossing the clothing aside which hit Brandon in the face, who stumbled back his hand brushing against the amulet, through two undefined holes in the piece of clothing (which Brandon was severely hoping wasn’t an under garment) he could see his mother and sister, there was a strange sound, like one of a balloon deflating and inflating. When Brandon had remove the piece of clothing (which turned out to be a shirt) Sarah was now the one pregnant with quintuplets, her shirt too busy containing her breast to even try covering her belly, her hips and backside also had increased to match the rest of her gravid body. Ashley was still stand where she was before wearing the maternity clothes, though she had to hold the pants up to prevent them falling down.

“See they’re too big for you and way too small for me,” said Sarah holding a tank top up against her swollen body, “I honestly don’t know why I couldn’t have gone and got them instead of you, I mean I am the one having the babies.”
“I don’t want you to strain yourself sweetie,” said Ashley going over to her daughter and rubbing Sarah’s belly with one hand whilst holding up the pants with the other, “you are carrying half the family inside you.” This was an understatement, Brandon did some quick maths and realized that Sarah and her unborn children together outnumbered the rest of the family two to one. “Beside I was already near there as needed to go to the gym to get rid of this rear,” said Ashley, this was true whilst the pregnancy in its entirety had been past to her daughter the amount of food that Ashley had consumed in the past day would have a longer lasting effect on her figure. “You can’t complain,” snapped Sarah angrily, “I can’t sit down too quickly in even my largest pants or I risk tearing them, tomorrow ‘I’ will go and get some clothes that fit, hopefully I can get the money back from these clothes before I’m accused of stretching them out.”
“And how are you planning on getting there?” said Ashley raising an eyebrow.
“Brandon will drive me.”
“What?” said Brandon.
“You heard me,” said Sarah turning around (this took quite a bit of time and revealed a white pantie clad backside visible through a tear in the jeans she was wearing) and leaving for her room this time via the kitchen.

After Sarah had climbed the stair which creaked nosily under the immense weight of her and her unborn children, Ashley turn to her son and said, “Best if you help her get there, she is having five after all and is rather emotional what with the father leaving.”
“What was his name again?” asked Brandon.
“She never said, besides if you don’t help her she will end up trying to go the place by herself and that’s not good for her this far along with so many. I’m sorry you have to spend your holidays rushing around after us instead of relaxing or spending times with your friends” said Ashley, she turned to go, “I should put some clothes that fit on now, oh and if that nice young clerk is there tomorrow say hi to her from me and see if you can find out her name.”
111211212.title: They go back home and Ashley tries her new outf...

choices: Read it, What's the worse that could happen?
Don't read it, it's only lousy occult junk that doesn't really work
1112112121.content:
Brandon made his way up to his room a few minutes later, he passed Sarah’s room on the way to which the door was open. He only intended to glance into Sarah’s bedroom as he made his way past but he found himself staring at the sight that met his eyes. Sarah’s room was part bedroom part home office, from which she ran her software company, since it had an ensuite she only had to leave the room to get supplies from the basement (the other room in the house used for her business) and to have meals by looks of it though she was trying to achieve the latter without leaving as well. No one was really aware, Sarah had been pregnant for less than a quarter of an hour and already her room bore the hallmarks of its recently enlarged inhabitant. Food packets, both full and empty, were strewn around the room whilst the floor was littered with items that had fallen on to it or more likely knocked on to it and unable to be picked up. In the middle of all this sat Sarah who had wedged herself into her office chair, which must have been no easy feat, on her gargantuan belly rested a computer keyboard upon which her hands moved across as she worked, occasionally one hand would reach into a nearby packet transport some of its contents to Sarah’s mouth before going back to the keyboard. Brandon stood, there staring at his heavily gravid sister, ‘why?’ he thought ‘why out of all the women that I know the one that gets pregnant with quintuplets is her?’ a moment later Sarah, some how noticing she was being watched, turn to see Brandon looking at her.
“What are you staring at, dork?” she said, even though she had said similar things to him before it sounded different to how she had said it before she was pregnant (which in reality was less than hour ago but to the blurry memory of everybody was several months ago). Before she was pregnant the half insults sounded joking and playful but now she sound irritated and as though she really meant them.
“What oh nothing,” said Brandon and continued to his room.

He threw himself on to the bed and laid there staring at the ceiling, after a while he found that something was jabbing into his back. Brandon fished around a bit and pulled out the manual for the amulet, ‘if the thing really worked then it would allow him to transfer Sarah’s pregnancy to some else’. He flicked through the pages idly wondering if he should read the instructions properly.
1112112121.title: Later that day

choices: reality wasn't rewritten
reader's choice
11121121212.content:
"Oh, this thing is just a gimmick," Brandon said, rolling his eyes and tossing the amulet onto his bed-side bureau. "Definitely not worth five bucks."

Laying down in bed, Brandon let out a long yawn and decided to call it a day. He got up and walked to the bathroom, brushed his teeth, had a long pee, and stretched back in his room. For some reason, he felt exhausted, even though all he did was help his mom shop for clothes for Sarah at the mall. With the level of stress he felt like he was under, it was like his mom had been the pregnant one instead...

When he felt sufficiently limber, Brandon took off his shirt and shorts and tossed them into his hamper. His shorts were thrown a little low and knocked the amulet off of the bureau and right onto the heavy "manual" that came with it. There was an audible *crunch* as it hit and Brandon picked it up with concern. Just looking it over, he couldn't see any obvious damage. Then, the four bluish gems on the sides of the amulet (it was eight when he first bought it. Odd...) almost appeared to flicker, then fade in and out.

"I must just be exhausted," Brandon thought, putting the amulet back on his bureau and crawling into bed. It felt like hours passed before he could actually get to sleep, errant thoughts of the day and pregnancy running through his head. As he felt his body start to relax, there was a light knock at the door and he heard it slowly push open.

"Brandon?" Sarah's voice asked. Jack sat up and blinked a few times, reaching over to his lamp. Flicking it on, he squinted to adjust to the sudden light to see his sister standing before him, in a non-maternity tank top that revealed pretty much all of her quintuplet belly and a pair of short athletic shorts. "You're awake, I guess?"

"Um...yeah. I couldn't really get to sleep," Brandon said, scooting up in his bed. "What's up?"

"I'm having really bad Braxton-Hicks contractions," she said, rubbing her belly. Brandon could tell she was starting to blush. "Do you think you could...*sigh* help rub my belly to make the pain go away?"

Brandon felt his heart flutter. "O-of course," he said. Sarah took a few ungraceful steps to his bed and sat down, legs spread, belly prominent. "Just like this?" He began rubbing both hands side to side around her gigantic belly.

"Yeah, that feels much better," she said softly, resting her hands on her thighs. "Th-thanks for this. Mom and Dad are both asleep so-"

"No, it's okay," Brandon said, rubbing her belly much more gently. He couldn't believe how big she was! And to think she'd been carrying this many babies for almost nine months now. "What do the contractions feel like?"

"Ugh, like my skin just gets incredibly tight, stretched to its absolute limit," she complained, taking a deep breath as another contraction made its rounds. Sarah looked down at her massive dome of a belly. "It's a miracle I don't have stretch marks yet."

Brandon's face turned red as he continued to look over his sister's huge belly, seeing how it was indeed smooth and soft, but as he rubbed he could feel the tightness of her full womb. Sarah saw his blushing but decided not to try and figure out what it could mean. Instead, she looked around his room before her eyes caught his manual.

"Pregnancy Transfer?" she said, reaching in the direction of the book. Brandon looked over and handed the heavy manual to her. "What's this all about?"

"I dunno, it came with this weird thing from a garage sale," Brandon said, handing her the amulet. "It's dumb but at least this amulet looks kind of neat."

"You have such weird taste," Sarah said, shaking her head. As she took the amulet from his hand, it sparked and shocked her a bit. "Yeouch," she hissed, dropping it onto the bed. "I think I caught a sharp edge or something." Sarah turned her attention back to the book, flipping through the pages. "Huh, this is really detailed. It's written as if this 'pregnancy transfer' thing really worked. Man, some of this illustrations have pregnant women as big as I am..."

"Really?" Brandon asked. Maybe he should have given it a look after all.

"Yeah, you don't secretly have a thing for pregnant chicks, do you bro?"

"Uh-I-uh...uh," Brandon started to stammer. Sarah flashed him a little smile.

"Relax, I'm just teasing you. You can be a goof sometime but you're over all a good kid," she sighed. Flipping through a few more pages, Sarah tossed the book back onto the floor where it made a heavy *bang.* "But man, I wish this was real. I'm planning to give my babies up for adoption when they're born, but it would be nice to not have to carry them at all."

The door opened and Brandon and Sarah's mom walked in, awakened by the sound of the manual hitting the floor. "Are you both okay in here?"

"Yeah, we're fine Mom," Sarah said sarcastically, picking up the amulet again. Her fingers traced its shape as it started to spark again.

"Well, try not to be too noisy at night. I need a lot of sleep with these little ones," Ashley said, rubbing her now-enormous pregnant belly. "It's hard to get five babies to keep quiet."

"Okay Mom," Sarah said with another eye roll, patting her own flat, baby-less tummy. "Geez, I guess that's another reason to wish pregnancy transfer was real: so if I ever get pregnant, especially that pregnant, I could get out of it as soon as possible." Sarah chuckled and got off of Brandon's bed. "Thanks for letting me chat, bro. Like I said, you aren't so bad."

Brandon just blinked and didn't respond. Because while the amulet's magic or alien technology was intended to re-write reality to make everyone believe the pregnancy transfer occurred naturally, since it was damaged, it didn't quite work out. For Brandon:
11121121212.title: Don't read it

111211212121.content:
Brandon had a strange feeling that something was not right, as though what he was seeing was the after shot of a spot-the-difference puzzle, he looked around to see what was different. His computer, movies, models and Legos were all still there, which were really the only important things, there didn’t seem to be anything extra, there might have been an extra unwashed sock on the floor somewhere.Everyone seemed to be wearing the correct clothes, well Sarah’s tank top was stretched out and all but the very top buttons of Ashley’s pajamas were undone as her enormous belly prevented otherwise, other than that nothing seem to be glaringly obvious.
But no matter how much he told himself otherwise Brandon couldn’t shake the feeling that something was not quite right. Both his sister and mother had left, Sarah ducking back into her room whilst Ashley waddled noisily back to hers and Tanner’s room. Even though his parents’ room was at the other side of the house Brandon could clearly hear his mother’s progress until she got into bed.

‘Why?’ he thought ‘why out of all the women that I know the one that gets pregnant with quintuplets is her?’ Brandon picked up the manual and flicked through the pages to see if Sarah was telling the truth, if there were pictures of women as big as…her? Brandon was quite sure that was what his sister had said, but why? There were pictures of women as big as her, which was to say not pregnant at all, quite often with the word ‘before’ or ‘after’ written underneath it. It was the picture of the women next to these with the corresponding word underneath them which would be cause for comment as many of them were as big as Brandon’s and Sarah’s mother currently was, their bellies immensely distended with what could of only be multiple babies.

Brandon put the book on his bedside table next to the amulet. Maybe he just misheard what Sarah said, he was tired after all. Deciding to go to sleep, Brandon hoping things would be clearer in the morning.
111211212121.title: Ghosts of Reality

As Sarah was about to walk into her room, she noticed something gleaming in the reflection, turning around she saw a little metal object with 8 red gems, it was just outside Brandon's bedroom. She tippy toe'd back to his bedroom whilst Amander waddled slowly to her room. Picking the item up behind Brandons closed door, she looked over to her mum who was just entering her room. Rubbing off some of the dust on the new amulet, she thought to herself, " man, having 5 baby's must be a huge tole, I can't even trying to imagine having 2-"

PING,

" 2 is enough, but having triplets, that just one too far." Sarah looked down At her belly, thank god Brandon rubbed it earlier, cause those two were nicely off to sleep. Speaking of sleep, it was time she got some. Sarah waddled tiredly over to her bedroom, opening the door she placed the amulet between her EE cup breasts. Meanwhile in Brandon's dream,

Brandon was in a big city, something between the looks of Chicago, and Sydney, but in the near future, he walked pass a bunch of guys when he saw 3 women heavily pregnant, they looked over due with twins, and what's more is that they were outside a bar, drinking margaritas! He continued walking and buss stopped infront of him, and a sea of pregnant women came out. H crossed the street only to bump into his friend, Riley. " Riley! " Brandon panicked, " why is everyone pregnant?"
" pregnant? What is pregnant?" Riley replied quizzically.

But don't be a pervert about it!" Riley walked away, leaving Brandon in a mess, he walked pass a gym where women with bellies the size of beach balls were cycling and working out. A billboard on top said ' embrace who you are, support your curves', as his eyes were gazed upon the sexy model on the billboard he bumped into a small pregnant woman in business attire. He accidently knocked the sheets from her hand, " oh I'm so sorry" he said helping the somewhat blonde petite woman( if you excluded the size of her breasts and belly) out. " I'm so sorry he said handing her the papers, looking at her woman's clothes he saw the logo on the blazer, it looked just like the one for Jessica's business but said PregTech, the way of the future!

Brandon woke up in a flush, he was both worried and excited. He came down stairs and saw his breakfast made, his father was just getting ready for work and his mother was just drinking a glass of orange juice whilst rubbing her triplet belly. "Hey son!" Said Tanner " what's on the ropes for today? Gunna take care of your sister?"

After some thought, Brandon said
1112112121212.title: Dream Sequenceui

choices: Brandon and Sarah go to the food court
Brandon and Sarah just sit by the mall's fountain
11121121212121.content:
"Yeah, I should probably take Sarah to pick up some maternity clothes," Brandon said. "Mom only got clothes for herself when we went down there before." Brandon was right that Sarah needed some clothes to cover up her pregnant form. Even with the reality change, Sarah was too focused on her work and too annoyed with her pregnancy to bother buying any clothes that met the needs of her present condition. But, Brandon also wanted to show his sister that he cared about her. He felt bad when Sarah treated him badly and was happy when he could make her feel better with last night's belly rub.

Sarah walked down the stairs slowly, one hand under her belly. As she walked, there was another big belly pushing against her head and upper back. "Sorry dear," Ashley said with a chuckle. "It's hard to maneuver this thing around." Brandon and Sarah's mother rubbed her belly and beamed as Sarah only rolled her eyes and scowled. It was bad enough being pregnant at the same time as her mother, but did Ashley have to carry her pregnancy so much better than Sarah? I mean, she was twice her age and carrying more babies than her! She should be the one who's grumpy and exhausted!

"Here, we made you some breakfast," Tanner said, sliding a big plate toward Sarah, who sat down with a huff.
"Just because I'm pregnant doesn't mean I have to start pigging out," Sarah said with an angry tone, gesturing at the huge meal on her plate. Despite her initial protest, Sarah ate with apparent gusto. Brandon watched on in awe, slowly drinking the last of his orange juice.
"So, your brother tells me you two are making a trip to the mall," Tanner smiled, washing off the dishes. "It's nice to see the two of you finally bonding."
"What are you talking about?" Sarah said, turning to Brandon.
"Oh, I just told Dad that...since I took Mom to get maternity clothes yesterday, maybe I should do the same for you today."
Sarah sighed heavily. "I can take care of myself," she said, before looking away and mumbling, "b-but, some more comfortable clothes would be nice...thank you."

"Oh, a trip to the mall?" Ashley said, coming back down from the staircase. "Mind if I tag along? Some friends of mine said there's a little boutique opening there. It's not maternity things, but I wouldn't mind looking around."
"S-sure," Brandon said, nervous about another day at the mall with his heavily pregnant mother. He cocked his head slightly as Ashley turned and walked. Her belly looked...smaller to him. And, come to think of it, so did Sarah's. He shook his head. No, he was just imagining things. His mom was pregnant with triplets and Sarah was pregnant with twins. Everything was the way it should be.

The drive over to the mall was as uncomfortable as Brandon expected. Ashley talked about how much she enjoyed her new maternity clothes and how much Sarah would like hers, and how she remembered being pregnant with both of them, and how much they've both grown up. The whole time, Sarah looked out the window, occasionally looking down at her belly, and her hands never left her glowing bump. At the mall itself, the family got a fair amount of stares, possibly more than when Ashley was last there because now there were two huge pregnant women walking around together.

Walking into the maternity clothing store, the Page family was met by the same clerk as yesterday, Katie. "Welcome t-" she started, her jaw dropping as Ashley and Sarah inside. "Oh, y-you're back."
Ashley grinned. "Yes, but nothing for me this time," she motioned to Sarah's exposed belly. Sarah pulled her shirt over her belly tightly and blushed brightly.
"Mom..." Sarah complained quietly.
"W-well, let's see what we can get you," Katie said, shaking nervously, walking Sarah over to a long rack of clothes. As Sarah and Ashley looked through the selection, Katie walked over to Brandon. "So...the woman from last time is your mom, right?"
"Right," Brandon said, blushing a little himself. This clerk was pretty cute. "And the other one's my sister."
"Two big pregnant women in the same house...lucky you," Katie mumbled, stroking her chin.
"What?"
"Nothing!" Katie said quickly, walking over to Sarah as she held up one outfit. "This one is perfect for 'professional' moms-to-be. What do you think?"
"This could be good..." Sarah said, looking it over. "But I should probably...get a few more outfits, right?" Ashley smiled, giving her daughter a little hug.

After some browsing, Sarah settled on some new clothes that she could tolerate and was checking them out. As she reached into her purse, Ashley waved her hands. "No no no, this is going to be my present for you. You wouldn't let me buy you any baby supplies and you won't have a baby shower. Let me do this for you."
Katie smiled a little. "You are the most interesting family to come here that I've ever seen." Ashley smiled back at her.
"And you are so nice. You know what: you have to have dinner at our house. I insist. You've been so nice to us, we should do the same for you."
"O-oh, I don't know about-"
Brandon cleared his throat. "I-I think that would be a good idea," he said. Ashley, Sarah, and Katie all turned to him. Ashley had a big smile, Sarah gave him a perplexed look, and Katie just looked shocked, her face bright red. "I mean, you know, whatever," he mumbled.
"A-alright, I'll do it," Katie said, laughing nervously. "Um, heeeere's my number and email," she said, writing out her contact info on one of the store's business cards.
"Great, see you tonight!" Ashely said with a smile, waddling out of the store.
"T-tonight?" Katie whimpered as the three of them left.

"Well, I'm going to go see my friends now," Ashley said, stretching her back out, jutting her huge belly. "What about both of you?"
11121121212121.title: Sure, we need to go to shops for her maternity ...

choices: His mother
Someone else
111211212121211.content:
Ashely received her answer from her daughter’s burgeoning middle which gave a loud groan on cue causing its owner to blush. Ashely gave a smile, “I know the feeling,” she said giving a chuckle whilst leaning forward to pat Sarah’s belly. Due to the angle and the size of her own belly this was not possible, when this became apparent to her Ashely settled by giving her own belly a brief pat before saying, “well I know where to meet you guys when I’m done.”

Brandon tried not to watch his mother’s swollen figure sway as she waddled away and instead turned his attention to Sarah, which wasn’t much better. “Do you want to go get something to eat?” Sarah, whose face was still slightly pink, was silent for a moment before saying, “…yes.”
They started making their way to the food court, “anything in particular?” asked Brandon.
“Well I do feel like chicken,” replied Sarah.
“Like a craving?”
Sarah’s face went red again, partly from embarrassment and this time from anger, “I never said that, don’t ever ask that me that again.”
Clearly Sarah didn’t like to be thought as a pregnant woman, despite the physical evidence, maybe she didn’t like the idea of being a mother as she felt it meant the end of her career or youth, thought Brandon, or maybe it was just a mood swing he added as an afterthought. He didn’t say any of this of course, partly as he didn’t want to upset his sister even more and he didn’t want to have a burger two days in a row.

They ordered there food and sat down at one of the uncomfortable table and chairs arrangement that seem to in every food court. Unlike that morning, where she had eaten the food presented to her with great gusto, Sarah ate her purchased food with furtive looks around her like a cat, to see if anyone was watching her, this behavior probably attracted more attention than her being pregnant with twins. Despite finishing her meal Sarah was still hungry, as could be told by the occasional groan made by her belly and the way she squirm around as though having an internal battle with herself. The outcome of the battle became apparent when she got up without a word and went over to the counter again, she came back again a couple minutes later with another meal, same as the first, still not saying anything but giving Brandon a stern look warning him not to comment before consuming this meal in the same furtive fashion. She did this one more time and after consuming this third coarse did Sarah seem to be satisfied as she lead back and started stroking her belly. Brandon who still not said anything since ordering looked around and saw…
111211212121211.title: Brandon and Sarah go to the food court

choices: Dashed up to his room
Was asked to help someone out with something
1112112121212111.content:
Brandon saw his mother and whilst she was some way away it was easy to identify her even from this distance by her size, at least the size of her belly. Brandon thought about waving to her, the bags that she was carrying showed that she had finished her shopping at the boutique (and had not surprisingly bought something, even if they did have anything her current size to buy it would be too big for her in a couple of months) and was now looking for them, but Brandon somehow felt embarrassed to acknowledge to the world that forty something lady who was immensely pregnant with triplets was his mother. It was strange because she would see him (or more likely Sarah) and come over any way, not to mention they were all we leaving the mall together anyway, but at least he could be sullen and show the world that he was not happy with the state of affairs. He looked away from his mother and at another place so he could not see his sister either, ‘why’ he thought to himself, ‘out of all the woman I know why do they have to be the ones to becomes pregnant with multiples.’

Ashley arrived about two minute later, “There you two are,” she said sitting down heavily in a vacant chair. Neither of her children (including the ones inside her) said anything, Sarah was still rubbing her stomach absentmindedly and Brandon was getting a head start on being sullen. “I suspect you two want to go home?” Still no verbal answer but Brandon did give a vague nod to show that it was what he wanted. “Oh I bought a really fetching …” began Ashley reaching into one of the bags from the boutique, but she was cut off by both Brandon and Sarah hurriedly saying, “No!”
Whilst Ashley hadn’t actually said what kind of things she had bought from the boutique both Brandon and Sarah knew whatever it was that they didn’t want to see it, especially in public.
“Let’s go home then,” said their mother resignedly, but they had not gone a few steps after getting up when a loud rumble emitted from Ashley’s swollen middle, “Sorry, I haven’t had any lunch yet would you two mind waiting whilst I got something to eat?” She posed it as a question but the tone of her voice made it clear that she had already made up her mind; Brandon made an effort never the less.
“Can’t you just get something at home?” but his mother had already started waddling over to the burger outlet that she went to yesterday saying, “I just have a craving for a burger…or two.”
With a sigh Brandon and Sarah made their way back to the table they recently vacated, Brandon remembered there once was a time when his mother would make him go home for food instead of getting junk food at the mall, ‘how times have changed’ he thought to himself.

Ashley ended up coming back with three meals, one of which she proffered to Sarah, “I got one for you too?”
“Mom I’m not hungry,” whined Sarah.
“Are you sure? You’re eating for three now.”
“I had a lot to eat before.”
“If you say so, more for me, I’m just looking out for the health of both my daughter and my grandchildren,” said Ashley unwrapping the first of her burgers, “at least some of my children are accepting the food I give them,” she said in a loving yet immature voice to her stomach. Brandon endured another quarter of an hour whilst his mother devoured more food than he had ever eaten in one sitting. He was at least grateful of the fact that Ashley wasted no time and ate a fast as possible, though it did attract some stares.
After finishing the last drink Ashely gave a belch, like yesterday, to signify the end of her meal. Brandon without waiting for conformation stood up, with Sarah following suit after a fashion. Seeing that her all of her children that weren’t currently occupying her womb wanted to go home Ashely went to get up.
“Oof, sorry to ask again but can you help me up Brandon,” she said placing her hands on her belly, “mommy’s a bit heavy.” Brandon gave a sigh and for the second day in a row had to help his mother, swollen with babies and food, up in public, he definitely was not taking any member of his family shopping tomorrow.

The drive back was much the same as the drive over, though Brandon had felt the worst for the day was over, both he and Sarah were silent whilst their mother gabbled on about the boutique the importance of eating enough whilst pregnant (which was directed at Sarah) and the upcoming dinner that evening. The only thing Sarah or Brandon said was another insistent ‘No!’ as Ashley tried to show them what she had bought at the boutique again.

When they got home Brandon…
1112112121212111.title: His mother

choices: Louise coming over with an ice pack and a first aid kit
Erin in a bikini and supporting his headache with an ice pack
11121121212121112.content:
Brandon went straight to the kitchen and poured himself a glass of water. With all this pregnant talk, he was getting stressed out. Something about pregnant women was starting to get to him. Was he feeling something different? Like his panicking feeling was changing...

Sarah collapsed onto the lounge. She was exhausted from shopping she realised she didn't have enough to eat. " Stupid mum" she annoyingly whined. Her stomach growlings intensified. She looked around. Damn! She thought, nothing in the room, she looked down and saw the amulet in her cleavage, it's red rubies glistening again. "Heh, thank god I am only having twins, if I had one mor-"

PING!

" Quads can be such a belly full!" The amulet she was wearing appeared to have twice the power as Brandon's, though no one noticed a thing because it changed reality.

With a great feet of strength she brought herself up. Slowly she waddled into the kitchen, past Brandon and up to the cupboard. After grabbing a jumbo sized packet of corn chips, a box of donuts and a roll of cookie dough she waddled back to the lounge. She looked down and saw a note. " Brandon, it says here you need to help with Louise's pool, remember, say nothing about her condition, she doesn't like people knowing about her being 50 and pregnant". Sarah told Brandon as she carefully got back into the couch. Sigh Brandon grabbed his swimming trunks and made his way down the street.

Louise Parker owned a mansion near the end of the street. Her husband was known for owning the biggest book company in America, Books, books and books. Brandon worked in one of their stores for a while until a mysterious event happened and they moved to a different city. They had 4 kids, however with 2 moved out that left Brody, their hyperactive 5 year old boy and Erin.

Oh god Erin. She was a stunning red head with unbelievable curves. She had a fondness for books and literature but unbeknownst to am and pa she was also a sly vixen. She could charm a muscular body building giant into a lovable scamp in 5 minutes. Alas that wasn't the way she was with Brandon. They had been friends for a couple of years now. And things were going smoothly. However he did know her weaknesses. She loves spicy foods and fears slimy and creepy crawl insects.

As Louise opened her door Brandon tried not to look at the large belly she was bearing. After exchanging hellos, she lead him to pools maintenance equipment. " thank you soo much for all this, we haven't swam in days!" Louise said rubbing her large middle. " I would try to find a way to fix it but, you know". She stood there and put a cap over her red hair. Brandon manuvered rough the pipes and bars, trying to figure out the cause." muuum" a familiar voice called from inside. Stepping outside, Erin walked down stairs, her red hair flowing and her large DD cups bouncing in her stripped bra. Brandon saw the problem, it was a loose power coupling. Connecting the power, the pools pump started again. Realising Erin was in a bikini, he went straight up and banged his head on the bar above his head. He was knocked out stone cold. "ERIN! Come here quick!" Louise worryingly cried out as she struggles to pull Brandon out.

When Brandon woke up, he saw
11121121212121112.title: Was asked to help someone out with something

choices: Lay on his bed until he felt better
Fell asleep
111211212121211121.content:
Brandon opened his eyes and saw above him, with some bliss, the maternal mound of Mrs Parker, she was peering down at him with a look of concern (which was not easy given the obstruction of her belly) and clutching an ice pack in and holding a first aid kit in the other, she breathed out a sigh of relief when she saw he was conscious. “Are you alright?”
Brandon made a mammalian noise before saying, “I think so, what happened?”
“You hit your head on a pipe,” said Louise Parker as Brandon pulled himself to his feet with the aid of said pipe, he felt light head as stood up, the world spun around him. Mrs Parker reached out to steady him as he staggered, as she did her hand brushed the amulet-
PING
“Are you ok Brandon?” asked a now non-pregnant Mrs Parker.
“Yeah, I think I just need a lie down, How long was I out?” he asked vaguely, something about Mrs Parker was…different not necessarily wrong just…different, Brandon put it down the bump on the head.
“Just a few minutes, I was just about to get Erin to call an ambulance, I’m sorry for making you doing that, but Erin doesn’t like going near the pool maintenance pipes as they are normally covered in spiders, Pauls away on business, Brody is to young and I…I…must not of known how to.” This last part was said hesitantly as though she was telling herself why. Realising she may have of needlessly put one of their neighbours at risk Louise decided to change the topic, “that’s really nice necklace you got there the light shines on it makes it look like some of the jewels are glowing.”

Mrs Parker escorted Brandon all the way back to his parent’s place where the door was open by his mother, when she saw it was him she said, “oh baby are you ok?”
She tried to clasp him to her but her belly got in the way of this, “I’m ok,” said Brandon stepping aside to avoid being knock over again, “just need a bit of a lie down.”
“After Erin came and told me what happened I suspected the worst…” Ashely trailed off.
“I’m sorry to have put him in danger,” said Mrs Parker.
“Well he safe now,” said Ashley giving Louise a cold look, “come inside Brandon.”
Brandon followed the voice of command until he found that his mother’s frame was blocking the door way, upon noticing this Ashley took a few steps to let her son in before closing the door, quite firmly, in Mrs Parker’s face who gave a faint “goodbye,” before heading off home.

When the door was closed Ashley said to her son, “Whilst you are here please don’t visit the Parker family,” Brandon was still to lightheaded to argue. “I’m sorry to ask you to help me for tonight after what happen but what with these guys,” she place a hand on her swollen middle, “along with Sarah soon to have four of her own and your father not getting back from work until six, I will need your help for getting dinner ready.” Brandon blinked, something in that last sentence seemed wrong, ‘Sarah was having four?’ he thought it was two. Obviously he needed that lie down, “I need more of lie down,” he said, “I will try and help when I am feeling better,” he said heading over to the stairs.
Ashley gave a nod but said, “Please try, I don’t want that nice young clerk to think we’re are slobs or anything bad like that when she comes here tonight.”

Brandon…
111211212121211121.title: Louise coming over with an ice pack and a first...
