If Sarah wasn't carrying 20 full-grown babies in her womb, there'd have been a bounce in her step as she entered her house. Finally, an investor! Sarah burned through what little money she had left putting together her latest round of inventions. But now, PregTech would be up and running with what Sarah hoped would be its flagship products: her gear for expectant women like herself.

Although, another thought had been passing through Sarah's mind. Initially, her inventions for pregnant women were built around comfort and mobility: the robo-spine, the massager, etc. But since she discovered the power of the amulet, Sarah had developed her own devices for personal use: a machine to regulate her own pregnancy, even giving her the power to add or subtract fetuses at will. A sensor that allowed her to locate other pregnant women in the area. And most recently, a way to convert her womb into pure energy, which would not only make her pregnant permanently, but allowed for unlimited potential in the area of energy and health.

Sarah gulped as she rubbed her belly slowly, her cheeks turning a bit red. When she initially learned she was pregnant, Sarah hated everything about it. Having a big belly, being sore and swollen, feeling kicking, knowing one day she'd have to raise all these children by herself. And worst of all, she was experiencing the miracle of life alongside her mother. But since Sarah learned her pregnancy was the result of some kind of magical amulet, she viewed her condition...differently. Making other women round with child gave her a guilty delight and she felt a camaraderie with other pregnant women.

If she could truly mass-produce her latest inventions and given women the ability to make themselves as pregnant as they want to be, as well as choose whether they even want to give birth or not, Sarah knew that could create a very different world. And not one she necessarily disliked.

As Sarah waddled up the stairs and put her sample inventions back on her bed, she heard some low noises coming from down the hall. They were quiet, but Sarah's senses were heightened as a result of her first brush with Antonio's pregnancy-energy device. Sarah crept as best she could to the end of the hall, her heavy, maternal body making the floor creek. Sarah got closer to the source: her mother's bedroom door, and didn't hear any interruptions.

I haven't been spotted, Sarah thought as she gently pushed the door open. But all that moaning...did Mom and Katie hook up again? Why are those two the only pregnant women getting busy while I'm still-

Sarah's train of thought halted abruptly when she saw who was in bed with Ashley. Brandon was spooning her mother's gargantuan pregnant belly, kissing Ashley between her enormous breasts. Ashley made the occasional moan and coo as she stroked Brandon's hair and back, her thighs rubbing together under the sheets.

Her cellphone buzzing alerted Sarah and she hurried back to her room as quickly as she could, her own large belly bumping against the wall and banister as she moved. Brandon brought his head up, his attention too distracted to tell if there was a noise at all.

"Don't worry, sweetie," Ashley said, putting her hand against Brandon's cheek and kissing him, immediately putting Brandon's curiosity to rest. Still, Ashley opened one eye and looked at her door. So you know, she thought with a sigh. Well, if Sarah didn't know already, she knows now: this household has changed.

Back in her room, Sarah put her phone to her ear. "What?"

"Jeez, you sound as angry as me," Janice scoffed on the other end. "Look, there's a march of pregnant women starting from the prison to city hall. Did you get the investor?"

"Of course," Sarah said, one hand on her wide hip. "I built PregTech when it was nothing!"

"Good, then if we're going to really take off, it needs to be now. Because you know what's halfway between the prison and city hall, don't you?"

Sarah nodded. "The mall."

"So meet me there. And see if you can pull Katie away from her spray-tan bimbo," Janice growled, hanging up her phone. "So you're on our side?"

"Of course," Maritza nodded, toweling Janice off as she stood in the pool's locker room, pregnant and naked. "It's not just the pregnant women in the prison. Through word-of-mouth, nearly every woman with an occupied belly knows about you three."

"Perfect," Janice smiled. She didn't need Joel anymore. When PregTech starts selling to this abundantly fertile city, she'd have enough money to support her babies and a legion of men ten times sexier than the lanky geek to care for her. Still, Janice thought, looking down at her glistening belly, I will miss being pregnant...if only there was a way to make this last longer.

---

"Are you sure?" Kim said, walking slowly behind Katie, who was pulling the possessed preggo with one arm.

"Yes, I'm sure," Katie said, her grin seemingly plastered on. "It'll be much easier to talk and r-rub each other's bellies if we go back to my apartment. Plus, I've got lots of clothing there you can try on."

"I would like to try and fit in more," Kim said, looking down at her half-naked body. Well, thanks to Kim's belly size, maybe five-sixth naked. When Lania possessed Kim, she was clad only in her bra and underwear, which would be enough to catch people's attention alone. Kim was always an incredibly sexy woman, with luscious breasts, an even bigger ass, and smooth bronze skin, not to mention a supermodel face. But add in her nine-baby belly and Katie was in heaven.

She's hot, she's pregnant, she's naive, and she loves belly-rubbing, Katie thought, cackling to herself. This amulet is the best good-luck charm a pregnancy-loving girl could ask for.

"Katie?" Kim said, getting Katie's attention back. "May I ask you a question?"

"S-sure," Katie gulped, turning back to her current idol. "Anything, Kim."

"When we go back to your place, are we going to...have sex?" Katie nearly fell over when she heard that. Lania was still getting used to life in the physical world and could read expressions and body language well now.

"W-would you like to?" Katie said.

"I think so," Kim nodded. "I've already done my work, so I'm just here to experience things for myself." Kim got close to Katie, giving her a savory, if not novice, kiss on the lips. "Let's have sex."

Katie's hands were trembling as she pulled her phone out of her pocket, feeling its buzzing out of synch with her own shivers. "Y-y-yes?"

"Katie, finally," Sarah sighed, hurrying out the door. "We need to get to the mall, quick. The marketing opportunity of a lifetime for PregTech is about to happen."

"What do you mean?" Katie said as Kim studied the small woman.

"I got an investor and a mob of pregnant women, all of whom love us and PregTech, are heading past the mall soon. If we want this company to take off, we need to do this."

Two sides of Katie's mind combatted one another. On one hand, she wanted to have sex with Kim so, so, so much. But the greed from her amulet kept pushing her and pushing her to go. And the more pregnant Katie got, the more influence her amulet had.

Finally, she was persuaded with one simple argument: If you get rich off of PregTech, you'll have pregnant women all over the world at your beck and call.

"I'm sorry, Kim," Katie sighed. "I've got to go. Work."

"I understand," Kim nodded. "I hope to see you again before the day is over. And may I suggest something?"

"Sure," Katie nodded. Kim took Katie's phone and stuck it between the pregnant entrepreneur's breasts.

"Easier access," Kim smiled, giving Katie another kiss before walking away. Katie stood stunned, not the least of all because of how great Kim's ass looked.

"Ashley, you've got competition," she muttered to herself, unaware of the hooks Kim already had in Ashley's husband.

Sarah waved down the next bus she saw, panting and sighing as she tried to get money out of her pants. Her pregnancy was growing faster than she could buy fitting clothes, so her pockets were incredibly tight.

"No charge, ma'am," the bus driver said. Sarah looked up and saw a very pregnant woman behind the wheel, a knowing smile on her lips.

"Thank you," Sarah nodded, pushing her incredible maternal bulk down the tiny hall, squeezing into a seat by herself. Her head was still rocked with confusion and envy over what she saw in her mother's bed.

Why did Ashley get to have so many relationships when Sarah was just as good-looking and just as pregnant?

What did Brandon see in Ashley and not Sarah?

Why wasn't Sarah the one being comforted and held, like Brandon used to do by rubbing her belly at night.

Then it hit Sarah as she brought her hand to her lips, shocked by her realization.

"Oh my God," she said quietly. "I'm jealous of Ashley. I want to have sex with Brandon."

"It doesn't look good," Erin agreed as Antonio turned back around in his chair. He'd just turned on the local news, showing the pregnant protest heading toward City Hall. "And they're all by the mall right now?"

"That's right," Antonio croaked, coughing into his handkerchief. "And pregnant women were, at one time, the main staple of this mall. And our plan for future development."

Erin had always wondered why there were so many stores catering to pregnant women in the mall. "But these protests shouldn't mean all that business is going away. Just tell them you're on the side of 'pregnant rights' and they'll keep coming to your mall. And isn't Catalina Corazon your spokeswoman? She's probably the biggest pregnant celebrity in the world right now."

"Unfortunately, Ms. Corazon has...decoupled from us," Antonio said. "We want you to replace her as a spokeswoman. Specifically, a pregnant spokeswoman."

Erin looked down at her large belly and stroked it slowly. She was certainly one of the larger women in the city as far as belly size, but did one winning golf game really turn her into that much of a celebrity. "I'm not sure if I'm the right person. And besides, all you have to do is use your wealth to promote pro-pregnant political groups."

"Popular support for pregnant women is being taken by our competitors," Antonio said, coughing loudly again. "They call themselves PregTech and they'll take all our business if I'm not careful. I'm operating with low funds at the moment too, thanks to the police nosing around."

"PregTech? Never heard of it," Erin said, taking a fourth plate of food from Wendy. "Thank you. Anyway, like I was saying. I don't think you need to be too worried."

"You don't know my situation," Antonio said, trying to keep his composure as the disease ate away at him. "That damn inventor bitch, Sarah Page, is on our heels right now."

"Did you say Page?" Erin said, her voice dropping as she glared at Antonio. "And her brother is Brandon Page?"

Antonio turned over a few documents on his desk. "Yes, that's right."

"I'll take the job," Erin said, standing up abruptly before struggling to get her footing, thanks to her belly swaying back and forth. She headed for the door and Antonio stood up, his head spinning with dizzyness as he did.

"W-where are you going?" he asked, gripping the table for support.

"To go save your mall," Erin replied without looking back. As soon as she left the room, Antonio fainted, knocking over his chair loudly.

"Mr. Greene!" Wendy yelled, rushing in. "Mr. Greene!"

----

"There," Erin said, pointing to the group of pregnant women still headed for City Hall. "Stop in front of them. Then run."

"Run? Why?" said the young man from the movie theater, selected by Erin to drive one of the mall's carts out to the protest.

"Because you're not pregnant and they're so worked up, who knows what they might do?" Erin said, stepping out and waddling toward the women. As she got closer, she removed her shirt to not let anything obscure her massive pregnant belly. Many of the women in the crowd had naked bellies as well, so she fit right in. "Ladies! Please, may I have your attention?"

Most women kept walking, but a few stopped and looked at Erin. "What are you doing, my fellow pregnant sister?" one mom-to-be asked, both hands wrapped around her belly.

"This protest is not what we should be doing," Erin said. "City Hall won't listen to us. They don't understand. But there's one thing they do understand: money." More of the women stopped as Erin's speech started to come together. "We should be supporting the one place that's had our interests at heart since we first knew we had something growing in our tummies."

"Are you with that PregTech tricksters?" a Middle-Eastern woman with sextuplets asked, pressing her hands into her back to support her maternal weight as she waddled.

"No, they're just what you called them: pregnant women trying to make a buck off of all of you beautiful, strong mothers," Erin said. "No, I'm talking about the mall."

"The mall?" the women said in shock. But then they started to think about it. The place was always crawling with fellow pregnant women.

"Spas, gyms, clothing, accessories, and most importantly, the biggest food court for miles," Erin said. "If we continue to support the mall, there will be a powerful business in the area that has pregnant women's interests at heart. The city will have to listen to us."

The women were now all listening to Erin and some were nodding along while stroking their pregnant stomachs, but others weren't convinced. "There's going to need to be a lot more renovation done at the mall if that's going to work. And more types of businesses we'll all want if you really want to be preg-friendly."

"She has the money," Barbara smiled as she to the front of the protest, belly proudly out and shimmering with oil. "Good to see you again, Erin."

"Who are you?" another woman in the crowd, a black woman with triplets, asked.

"We are all part of the local country club," Louisa said, waddling up to the front as well, joined by the other Book Club women. "And we're part of the wealthiest family in the entire city. We will all be sinking our money into making sure the mall becomes a place for pregnant women, by pregnant women."

"I had the same thought," Louisa replied with a grin.

"That's why I recognized her," someone yelled from the back of the mob. "She's that young pregnant woman who won the country club's golf tournament! She shows us that pregnant women can do anything another person can do."

"And we can do one thing they can't," Erin smiled, turning to the side and stroking her curves. "We can create life." The protesters started to cheer, not with anger, but with joy as Erin looked over the swath of new mall customers. Her amulet glowed and her belly grew once again, leaving Erin pregnant with 12 babies while a few protesters had slightly smaller bellies. "Now, let's go the mall!"

"Is everyone alright?" Sarah asked as the pregnant women, knocked unconscious by the energy beam's orgasmic side-effects. As they got back up and touched their surging bellies, they smiled at one another.

The crowd cheered again as Katie waddled close to Sarah. "We'd better get them to our headquarters soon. They're all worked up now and who knows what will happen? They don't have your robo-spines yet but they're mobile enough to cause trouble."

"Right, let's go to PregTech now!" Sarah yelled out. "At the mall!"

"No, no, don't do that!" Sarah said, but it was too late. The swarm of angry, big-bellied women was now headed for the mall: the one place trying to take Sarah's business away.

"Now what?" Janice groaned as the mob left.

Sarah grit her teeth and started stroking her belly as she thought. Why did everyone listen to Katie when she first talked to them? she asked herself, envy still dwelling within her thanks to her amulet.

The women started to grumble and got closer, their bellies pressing and rubbing together. Erin ducked out of the standoff and saw Sarah, Katie, Janice, and Catalina hurry over, with Sarah in the lead thanks to her spine. "Ah, you must be Sarah Page. All Pages have ridiculous bellies, after all. It's all they can think about."

"Erin?" Sarah said as she stopped near the standoff. "You organized this protest? That seems so...unlike you?"

"No, I'm with the mall," Erin grinned. "And we're here to stop PregTech."

Their amulets glowed as they came into close proximity and the women in the standoff felt their bellies expand and knock each other off-balance. This only worsened relations between both sides.

"Look, I'm no fan of the mall, but we can't have this kind of confrontation," Sarah said. "Please, tell your side to go in peace and we'll do the same."

"You can't get what you want, Page," Erin fumed. "Like your idiot brother thought he could."

Sarah didn't know where to begin but turned to her team. "Okay, Katie, you did a good job last time. Try to move them, will you?"

"Hmm?"

"Katie? Tell them to leave?"

"Right, good," Katie nodded. She had a drooling smile plastered on as she watched thousands of pregnant bellies of all shapes and colors rubbing and pressing against one another.

"Great," Sarah said, rolling her eyes. "Janice, you got anything?"

"Yeah, I'll rip their bellies right off for fucking with us," Janice growled, starting to march toward the standoff. Sarah put her belly in the way and placed a hand on Janice's shoulder.

"Maybe you're a little too worked up right now," Sarah sighed. "And they don't listen to me too much...what do we do?"

"A-hem," Catalina said, one hand on her hip, the other on her belly. "You forgot one."

"I thought you said you wouldn't join us?" Sarah said.

"Not if I'm going to be out of the spotlight. I want to be PregTech's face, its spokeswoman, its persona," Catalina grinned.

Katie snapped out of her daze for a moment as her greed flared up. "I don't know if we can afford you, quite yet."

"I don't need much," Catalina smiled. "My hate for the mall and...its owner are enough to drive me."

"You're hired," Sarah nodded, getting out of the way for Catalina to waddle with more poise than Sarah thought was possible for a woman as pregnant as the jumbo-sized movie star.

"Everyone!" Catalina yelled, immediately getting the attention of both sides of the pregnant flank. People gasped and cheered, on Erin's side and on Sarah's.

"Catalina!" women clapped. "You're an inspiration to pregnant women everywhere!"

"Yes, yes, I'm very good," Catalina nodded, waving with one hand in small gestures. "You all want to be like me but you know you never will. Please, quiet down."

"Are you going to tell them how great the mall is?" Barbara shouted with a smile.

"The mall is horrible," Catalina said with sly smile. "And it's run by fools. If you want to be like Agent Foxila Moore in 'Bump With Vengeance' or the first pregnant superhero in a feature film, 'Captain Fecundity,' then you'll support PregTech."

The PregTech supporters cheered and anyone not already showing their bare belly tore off their clothes. "What do we do now, Catalina?"

"We go home," Catalina said proudly, hands on her hips. "Relax, get pampered, and wait for PregTech to tell us how all their amazing products and services can help us."

Convinced by the pregnant film star, the line started to break down as a wave of bellies left the mall's parking lot and dispersed.

"What do we do now, honey?" Louisa asked Erin, who was chewing her lip and rubbing her belly. Erin's mind raced. She wanted to crush Sarah to get back at Brandon and this new mall gig sounded pretty sweet. And speaking of sweets, she had a craving for an ice cream sundae.

"Ladies!" Erin grinned, raising one hand. "We atta-"

"Erin!" Wendy panted, running through a wall of big, firm bellies to get to the newest mall employee. "Wait, I have some important news."

"What is it?" Erin sighed, lowering her arm.

"Antonio is...incapable of running the mall any longer," Wendy said. "He's been sick for years and it's become too much for him."

"I see," Erin sighed, continuing to rub her belly. He wasn't someone she'd loose sleep over. In fact, he seemed like a slimy guy from the beginning: the kind of rich creep she always tried to avoid at the country club.

"And, in accordance with his wishes," Wendy gulped, "you are now in charge of the mall's operations, especially its marketing toward pregnant women."

Erin's jaw dropped. "You...there's no one else? Someone who's worked for the mall for longer than an hour?"

Antonio told Wendy very little as his breathing became erratic when she found him. But one thing was clear: amulet. He needed the next executive to have an amulet. Wendy called Rebecca first, but of course, she just said it sounded boring and hung up.

"Antonio wants you," Wendy said. "What's our first order of business?"

"Let's convene a big lunch meeting," Erin smiled, her belly growling. "Mom, you and the rest of the book club are my main team now."

"We have plenty of ideas, don't worry," Louisa grinned.

"And everyone else!" Erin bellowed. "Please, show your support for pregnant rights and shop! Shop at the newly titled PreggoMall!"

---

Miles away, in a tiny apartment paid for by a nursing student, Grace was moaning loudly while Joel was desperately trying to catch his breath.

"Y-you've got a lot of energy," Joel wheezed as Grace's huge belly slammed against him again and again. "You don't want to slow down?"

"No, I want to go all night!" Grace giggled, peering past her nine-baby belly. "When I woke up and saw you there in the street, I was already horny. Now I've got endless energy inside me!"

Joel didn't know Grace wasn't talking metaphorically. As the target of Sarah's laser, she was able to ride anyone for hours and Joel was, to her, just fine.

Joel, on the other hand, was having noticeably less fun. F-first Catalina, now her, Joel groaned. I-I think I'm developing a fear of pregnant women.
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.title: The mall and PregTech finally clash!

1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
The protest: epilogue

Half and hour ago

Kim walked through the empty streets, it seemed like everyone was at the protest. Her powers were of no use at the protest, the levels of chaotic power were off the charts. The streets, were dead quiet. She heard a bird chirping as it hung out in a tree, enjoying the sunset. Off to the distance, Lania saw an asian woman threatening a random stranger.

" look, if I have to ask you again, you will have to go straight back to the dentist" Rebecca threatened the poor individual.

"I swear I don't know who the person in the picture is. " the guy screamed, he was in horrendous pain, a single movement from Rebecca could spell dislocated shoulder.

"What's going on here?" Lania Called out from across the street. She didn't have much time left in Kim's body, maybe she could do one last deed of good will.

"Get lost slut, I'm trying to get info" Rebecca said, rubbing the mans face into dirt.

"Now, hold on, wouldn't there be an easier way of doing this?" Lania said, her grasp starting to slip on kim.

"please... He-lp meeee..." The poor man cried out.

" here lets, just, can you let go?" Lania said struggling to remove the assassins hand from the short gangly Indian man.

" buzz off" she said pushing her off her. Lania was expecting resistance. She slipped, falling and hitting her head on a pole. Lania flew out of Kim's body, the sudden blow to the head caused her to fall out. Rebecca continued to interrogate the man whilst Kim lay cold. After a minute or two, Kim came to.

"YOU ARE A GEEK, SURELY YOU HAVE SEEN SOME GUY CALLED BRANDON PAGE" Rebecca yelled. Kim was too disoriented to recognise her surroundings.

"Eerrrrrr where, where am I? What happened?" Kim barely said, her head was spinning. Rebecca realised the poor skinny man didn't actually know anything and let him go. Looking at kim she decided to help her up.

"Sorry about that, are you okay?" Rebecca said as they both go up together. Their bellies rubbed together as they stood up. Rebecca could feel the energy still swimming inside her body, it was over stimulating her, she needed to calm it down. She pulled up her top to reveal her belly. Rubbing her tanned belly, she cooed as she calmed down. Looking at Kim's belly she couldn't believe how someone could be hat pregnant.

PING!

Rebecca's belly inflated with more energy. It grew to the point where it rivalled Kim's. "I think I need to collect myself, do you know where he nearest cafe is?" Kim asked the stranger.

"Two blocks that way" Rebecca said trying to pull down her shirt. Angrily she pulled down fiercely and tore the bottom front. Singing she threw the torn bottom half away.

"Cool, thanks" Kim said as she turned to leave. She stopped then turned back "do you want to come with?"

"Um sure, I have had enough of work today anyway" Rebecca said as they walked towards the cafe near the mall.


-----

Tanner sat in the jail, the foul smell of other people's sweat stunk up the air, a foul smell that would make a skunk puke. He had hit one hell of a low, and there was no way of escaping it. The jail doors opened and a very pregnant officer threw in a bulky looking nerd. "So, it looks like the world is now run by pregazonian women" the nerd said, sitting on the other bed.

" haha, good one" Tanner chuckled, his mind temporarily escaping the world he was currently in. " I'm Tanner, and you are?"

"In trouble, my boss owns the mall and I have failed my past couple of assignments. Chances are I am not getting out for a while. Oh, right, I'm Bill." Bill said as he lay on his bed.

"You know it's funny, pregnant women have to deal with carrying a child, sore backs, swollen feet, morning sickness and some really disgusting things, yet they all managed to band together and almost take this town by hostage" Tanner said to his new friend. " how did they manage to come into control of such power?"

Power... Lingered in Bills head, he was loyal to Antonio. But Antonio was fixated on power and himself. "So, Tanner, what did you do before coming to this happy Chappy place?"

The lights dimmed as Tanner started his monologue. "Well, I used to run a powerful technology company. We had the highest business in the east coast, I would bring my daughter in some days to check out the factory line. I guess that's what started her love of inventing. I was also laundering money at the time, so long story short, I get caught and thrown in here. You?"

"Me? Haha, I came to this town after my fearless leader dominated a town in China, ever wonder why China has such a booming population?" Bill asked laughhing

"No, should I?" Tanner asked quizzically. "What did your boss knock up all of China?"

"No, geez. Well, kind of, I mean, he didn't do it himself" Bill said, turning to face Tanner. He really shouldn't talk about the amulets, but this was some business man, what would do with the amulets? "Okay I don't normally do this, but seeing as how we are going to be here a while, it will be good to have another mind on this. So my boss goes to small towns around the world and uses artefacts to gain incredible wealth."

"What, with magic?" Tanner said sarcastically waving his hands in the air.

"Well, no, let's call it enhanced science. He goes to cities, makes as many people pregnant and then leaves, with fortunes of people's money. Sometimes the towns collapse under the stress of it all." Bill said trying to gain the attention of his new room mate.

"I'm sorry I'm not buying it" tanner said, going over to the desk.

"Okay Mister Business, how do you explain the incredible amount of pregnancies. Currently 87% of the lady populous is pregnant, that means roughly one or two hundred women are not pregnant, not including the elderly and those under 17." Bill stated. Tanner looked back at him, he did have a point.

"Baby boom?" He tried to say back.

"Are you kidding me? Not at this rate! Forty Six percent of this town is pregnant. I think we are about to say goodbye to Smallton." Bill said laughing " if there isn't a city increase, we are going to see daily riots and a place run by local militia. I would say I'm currently in an okay spot. I should have been leaving tomorrow, but it looks like I am here."

"Okay fine, tell me, what's causing this babysplosion?" Tanner said grumpily.

"Okay, sit down cause you won't believe this. There are these series of amulets that are behind it all. The can increase or decrease the amount of fetuses in a woman's belly." Bill breathed out and then in again " When it affects a woman's belly, time is rewritten and they have no recollection of what happened. The only exception is if they already knew about the amulet in the first place and what they can do"

"Okay, so is there any way to reverse everything? A big reset button?" Tanner asked trying to get more from fellow prisoner.

"Uh, uh, uh, if I told you that, You may find the master amulet and destroy all my hard work" Bill said laughing.

Tanner slumped back into his bed, astounded. Maybe there was a way to reverse Everything, to bring life back to the way it was, before he cheated, before he laundered money, before all those stupid mistakes...
------

On the other side of town in the mayors office, Hank Brower stood looking out at the town he governed. Today had been a big mess after enforcing the pregnancy act. He could be facing expulsion from office for what he has done. He heard a knock at he door, " come in" he said brushing some crumbs from his greying moustache.

In came his drop dead gorgeous secretary Frank. "The forms for a revised pregnancy act are here." Frank said placing the pieces of paper down. " I have to say this is a close one, what will you do to stop the vultures from coming in?"

"Well, my young apprentice, you see the community have already played their card, now before we see the council tribunal, I have to play this one. The pregnant ladies of Smallton will be given a luxurious amount of benefits to go with them following the new laws." Hank said, looking over the papers. " to top it all off, we are going to change the name of the town, hold on, we were given city status this morning."

"No way, what are we going to call Smallton?" Frank said, rubbing his shiny chiseled dimple chin.

Hank picked up his short list of names. "We are going with the name from one of the fertility gods, Freyjaton. What do you think?"
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.title: What has Kim/Lania been doing while the protest...

1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
The mall was bustling with pregnant women. First gree floors were packed with bare pregnant bellies. Women laughed as their bellies squished against each other. Erin and her book club had them eating out of their hands. Wendy squeezed past the fleshy labyrinth to get to erin. "Erin, can I grab you for a second? " she said as she got to the now famous pregnant woman.

The two said their goodbyes and made their way to Antonio Greene's head quaters. All the pregnancy artifacts had left the room but his paintings remained. Wendy went to the desk made of rich mahogany and rubbed her slight bump. "You know, I always wondered how in a town of pregnant women, you remained, well untouched."Erin said looking at the gorgeous woman. " I mean I know you are a secretary but wow..."

"Well actually that's what I wanted to talk to you about." Wendy said, brushing her hands through her short black hair. " what do you know about that piece of jewellery that is around you neck?"

"I found it after I had sex with bra- Brent." Erin said, watching her words. She didn't want them knowing about her having sex with the enemy.

"Well that is actually a magic device that can create and transfer pregnancies" Wendy said as she brought up her tablet. "They were found ages ago by a crew that had Antonio as their campaign leader, some guy called Schultz as archeologist a British professor lady and some others. Apparently it was in some European tragedy."

"You're kidding" Erin said, looking at the gems in her amulet.

"Nope, I'm serious. they took it to Australia to test it, Antonio got greed and after one false move he caused a baby boom. Before any disasters could occur they tried to shipped it away from Antonio to China. After China's incredible growth Antonio tracked it down and took what he found to America, which leads us to the past few days."

"Okay so why are you telling me all this?" Erin said as she sat on the couch. She was so glad she was just wearing her skirt and bra, the t shirt was getting too tight.

"Okay so, we need you to follow on with what Antonio has made." Wendy said, bringing up a screen.

"Antonio has made a business and a plan at will give us an unlimited amount of money, resources and other needs." Wendy continued to show the new CEO what they do whilst Erin chowed down on some snacks.

"Basically his plan is to take the amulets from town to town, build up their populations to the point where they are bustling, then pulls in millions of dollars in revenue. We even have a team of scientists making inventions in a lab underneath.p the mall. Sadly over the past few days, a terrible sickness has struck him, which I believe is caused by this." She showed Erin security footage of Antonio pulling a gem from Catalinas amulet. Even the recordings were starting to be affected by the time rewriting, Catalina looked heavily pregnant.

"So, where is that gem?" Erin said pointing At the screen.

"We have no idea, our chief scientist Bill apparently was handling it whilst taking care of two intruders. After an unfortunate event he ended up losing the gem and a prototype weapon was destroyed."

"Okay, Wendy I'll do this, first we need to grab Bill, then we need a way to locate amulets and that gem. Who else do we have on our team?" Erin asked, planning her next few moves. She stroked her belly calmly, she didn't want to distrust the little ones inside.

"Well we have a large variety of people working around the mall but we do have someone that works with us called Rebecca, this 30 year old assassin." Wendy said going through the employees on her tablet. " She was fantastic at what she does, atłeast until she became incredibly useless and lazy."

"Okay, tomorrow morning I'm going to see what I can do to whip her into shape. But first I have some personal issues I need to take care of, if you excuse me." Erin said as she waddled out. Thinking for a second, she turned around, " wait, did you mention lab?"

----

Mara finally headed out of the theatre after the two massive films showed. " you know what, I know it was a long wait, but it was great to see what happened in Heads 'n Tails." She said to herself.

She walked through the mall booming with pregnant women. Everywhere she turned there was a pregnant woman with her top off. It was the biggest amount of pregnant women she had ever seen. Almost all of them were only wearing bras! Except for an asian woman and a woman with a fake tan. She walked up to the two but was bumped over by a large pregnant woman. "What the hell do you think you are doing?" The woman yelled in a polish accent.

"I'm sorry I didn't see your, your" Mara said, picking up her glasses. Putting them on she was confronted with an incredible pale white orb. "Whoa"

"What was that? Are you mocking my size?" She proudly yelled louder. " I am a proud pregnant polish model and you are a no body!" Grant was busy eating a hot dog a floor lower when he heard the commotion. Looking up he saw Mara cowering as more pregnant woman started abusing her. Swallowing a bite he dashed for the poor girl.

"She thinks she's better cause she isn't pregnant" another woman chimed in. The amount of hormones in that floor was enough to collapse the mall. Kim stood with Rebecca away from the abusers. For once felt somewhat wasn't sexual, pity. Slowly she waddled through the large crowd to the woman.

"Stop it, stop it everyone!" Kim shouted, " this is a woman, just like the rest of you. Just give her a chance to explain herself." The women quieted down and started to breathe, rubbing their huge bellies. The polish woman looked at Mara with disgust. " hi, I just wanted to say sorRRYYYYYyyy" in mid sentence Mara was grabbed by Grant and they bolted for the emergency exit. "Well I tried" Kim said as she and Rebecca went to the cinemas.

"Are you okay?" Grant said as they left the mall.

"Oh thank you" Mara cried out hugging him. Tears rolled down her eyes, she had never been through an experience like that before. They held each other in the light of street lights.
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.title: Wasn't Mara at the cinemas?

choices: The book club start their "tryouts" for their "club"
How is Joel handling grace right now?
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
An hour later

Sarah, Katie, Janice and Catalina walked into a massive warehouse. "Welcome to 145 Trigger Street. We used this place for one of the scenes in 'Athena, Modern day Warrior Princess'." Catalina said as they walked around the empty place. "After we shot it I bought the place so I could rent it out to companies, it looks like I bought it at the right time."

"You can say that again, man this place is incredible!" Katie said looking around whilst rubbing her huge middle.

"Yeah, you know what, for a rich lady, you are all right" Janice said, realising this is the first compliment she gave in a while. "But if you think about crossing us, we will be on you like white on rice."

"What's her problem?" Catalina asked Sarah "doesn't she know who she is talking to?"

"Don't worry, she is just an angry woman, it's surprising she is a yoga teacher" sarah said as she leaned against a beam. Her phone started to buzz. " hey, i have to take care of this, could you make sure nothing happens to 'the energy alternator'?"

"Sure, trust me, no one will take it. " Catalina said as sarah left. Catalina was pissed about earlier. She wanted Joel so bad, she had never had anyone like him before. She almost had him during the protest, but had to choose a new business over a night with him. Even though a large percentage of the crowd had been struck by the beam, Catalina didn't get touched by it.

As Sarah left them Catalina walked up to the other two members of Pregtech. "Hey, so you two are completely filled with energy right now huh?" She said, trying her best to not look like she was asking for anything.

"Yeah, there are so many things I can do that I haven't been able to do whilst pregnant. Don't you miss drinking?" Katie asked the very pregnant celebrity.

"Oh, so much, it's been hell being lethargic. You know, I didn't get struck when that beam was used during the protest." Catalina said seeing a mark on Janice's belly. " I think you have something on your belly Janice"

"Here I'll get it" Katie said, a bit too eagerly. She rolled onto her massive belly, grabbing her handbag she got water and tissues. Dousing the tissue she rubbed Janice's belly. Janice cooed as the cold wet tissue touched her belly. She had been in the muggy heat all day, from the sweaty jail cell which she cooled off from in the gym pool. Then there was the protest in the bleeding heat. She didn't notice that Katie had wiped the mark clean off, she was just enjoying Katie rub her massive belly.

Jeez these guys are kinda weird, Catalina thought to herself. "Maybe you guys should test the alternator once more, Sarah can't be the only one to use it"

"I, mmmm, oh yeah sure" Janice said, as Catalina carried the esky sized machine over. "Thanks, Katie, I think, it's done" Janice had to hold herself back, she was on the brink of losing control. Katie stepped out of the way as Jancie fired the machine at Catalina.

Catalina gasped as the beam struck her. Her belly felt like a reactor filled to the brink with nothing but pleasure. Her legs started to wobble as she collapsed to the ground. She came heavily as she moaned out loud, her orgasm echoing through the warehouse. In five minutes she was going to be on the hunt for Joel.

-----

Sarah waddle outside, her belly squeezing through the small side door. Looking at her phone she was getting a call from brandon. Envy burned inside her as she remembered that her mum had taken away her chance to be with him. Burying it all deep down she answered the phone. " hey Brandon, how's things bro?"

"Hey Sarah, I have to talk to you, do you think we could meet up? Do you remember the bar we went to celebrate Joel's 21st? I'll see you there in 20 minutes" brandon said on the other side of the line.

"Sure, see you then" Sarah said hanging up. In the dark alleyway she stood wondering how the hell she would get there in 20 minutes. That's when she heard a crunch. Spinning around she knocked over a trash can with her belly. Another loud crunch came from the shadows. "Hold it" called the person, a gun came out held by a delicate white hand.

"Please don't shoot, I have no money" Sarah cried out. The armed assailant laughed and another CRUNCH came out.

" please, that's not what I want. I'm just here for the energy bill" said the shadowy figure mockingly. Sarah started to feel different. Looking down she saw her belly shrinking by the second. All those month, her energy, her children, all gone. She tried to scream out in terror but nothing came out.

As her belly became almost flat(she had a lot to eat over the past few days) she looked up to see the shadow figured persons belly expand out into the light. "Oh my god, I can see how this energy is the best!" The woman said.

"How can you do this, you monster!" Sarah said, I her now chubby figure. She started to cry out loud, she couldn't use her amulet, it was connected to her invention.

" you know what else is hilarious about this?" The woman said, rubbing her massive belly.

"What?" Sarah said, wiping the tears from her face.

"You will never remember a thing." The woman said coming out of the shadows. Sarah stared straight at the woman, an intimidating mask on her face. The masks gaze shined a bright light at her head, making her forget she ever had an amulet let alone how to use it, that she was ever pregnant, and she had any feelings for brandon.

She was there, on her knees, unsure of what happened. All she remembered was that she had walked out to talk to brandon. She walked back to see what everyone else was doing. Walking in she saw the three pregnant business women talking about their business.

"Okay, I have to go, can you guys lock up for me?" Catalina asked, throwing Katie the keys. Katie would have caught them if she weren't shocked to see Sarah's body. "Sarah what happened?!" She yelled.

"What? Oh I bumped into a trash can, but I have no idea why I'm in my bra only, do you have a spare shirt?" Sarah said trying to wipe a smudge mark from her belly.

"Why aren't you shocked?" Katie asked Janice quizzically.

"What? Just because she is the only woman not pregnant doesn't mean we should hassle her about it, the public would be on her back already" Janice said as she picked up the keys. "So, let's meet up here tomorrow, get some gear in, okay? Catch you all later"
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.title: What's Pregtech up to?

choices: Sarah and Brandon meet and talk
Katie's night out
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
The newly titled PreggoMall was growing quieter as the evening approached. The many pregnant women who now increased their efforts to shop at the mall went home to their husbands, boyfriends, wives, girlfriends, or went to an empty bed. There was new pride in being pregnant and the women showed off their new maternity outfits, hastily redesigned to show off one's curves and bare belly rather than conceal them. And for many of these women, this was the first night they had sex while pregnant.

But not every pregnant woman had left the PreggoMall. In a newly renovated room in the basement, tiki torches borrowed from home decor shops dimly lit the lines of hugely pregnant Book Club women, standing with their arms crossed, smiling at the dozen or so pregnant women from the city gathered there.

"When do we start the audition?" one of the women asked quietly.

"As soon as the leader of the mall returns," Barbara smiled, her hands tracing her swollen middle slowly, enjoying the feeling of kicks coming from children her husband did not put inside her. "Until then, get comfortable. Our audition will not be easy."

Louisa turned and smiled as a door in the back opened and swung shut. "Here she is now."

"Ladies," Erin cooed as her steps thundered forward. The dozen women gathered quivered as they saw Erin come toward them. Or rather, her belly. Erin was pregnant with over 30 fully-grown fetuses and her belly didn't show a single sign of stretching or distress. Instead, it glimmered with more vigor than ever before. Louisa and Barbara moved aside to let Erin get to the small throne they made for her, easing in as her belly stuck out several feet. She, like the other book club women, only had on a bikini, with her amulet cozied between her breasts, fresh from stealing Sarah's pregnancy.

"This is everyone brave enough to want to join the mall's inner circle," Barbara said, pacing in front of the lines of women, her hands tracing their bellies. "Should we have them introduce themselves or get started?"

"I only want to know the names of whoever will join us," Erin said, smiling as one of the book club women placed a large bowl of pasta on her colossal belly. When Erin robbed Sarah of her pregnancy and her amulet, she also took Sarah's energy from the conversion laser and her robo-spine, allowing her to move around normally, despite her incredible maternal size. "You will all compete for one open spot on PreggoMall's Board of Directors."

The women all nodded, rubbing their bellies eagerly. They were chosen from the largest pregnant women in the mall and they all wanted the prestige and the money that came with the position Erin and her cohorts held. They each stripped down to their underwear as Louisa dragged over a large inflatable pool filled with thick oil.

"The greatest pregnant tradition: oily wrestling," Erin grinned, rubbing her belly as she ate meal after meal. "Once the mall is rebuilt in our image, we will have a place for true pregnant mud wrestling, but this will suffice for now. The rules are simple: if you are knocked out of the pool, you lose."

One after the other, pregnant women got into the pool and were soon rubbing their bellies and breasts together, dripping with shimmering oil as they tried to knock each other out. Bras and underwear slipped off easily and no brawl ended without both women becoming naked. Erin grinned as she watched, seeing pregnant women vying for attention and prestige.

That's right Brandon, Erin smirked. Pregnant women can take care of themselves. We are strong and we don't need you.

"They're all doing so well," Louisa smiled. "It's a shame only one can join us."

"Maybe we should make it an annual event," Erin laughed. "Then they can all practice in the mall's mud pit year-round."

By the end, the competition was between two women: the polish model and an Indian woman with an unbelievably swollen belly. Both paced around the rim of the pool, eyeing one another, wondering when to pounce.

"Sorry I'm late or whatever," Rebecca sighed as she interrupted the tryout, noisily waddling into the room. Close behind her was Kim, still hugely pregnant and wondering where she was and why she was still in her bra and underwear.

"You must be Rebecca Quo," Erin sighed. "I'm in charge of the mall now. Antonio is gone."

"Cool," Rebecca shrugged. "Or not, I don't know. I'm just reporting back."

"And who is she?" Erin said, pointing to Kim.

Rebecca looked over and sighed. "Damn, I knew I forgot something. This is a secret meeting, isn't it? No outsiders allowed."

"What exactly is all this?" Kim smirked, waddling forward, her arms crossed against her breasts. "I know the town is controlled by preggos now, but still, this looks so weird."

"It's fine, we've already got more than enough spines to sell tomorrow," Sarah said. "So, what did you want to talk about?" Brandon let out a long sigh and Sarah cut him off. "I think I can guess, actually."

"Go ahead," Brandon said.

"You learned you were adopted," Sarah said, rolling her eyes around, pretending to think hard. "And...you had sex with my pregnant mother."

"Not so loud!" Brandon whispered frantically. "You...you knew about that, huh?"

"I saw you two lying in bed together," Sarah said. "And I put two and two together."

Brandon turned bright red. "I...I can't even imagine what you think of me."

Sarah shrugged. "I'm not mad, honestly. I always thought you were a weird goof, but if you can make Ashley happy, that's fine with me."

"But...I was her son for so long," Brandon said.

"The heart wants what it wants," Sarah shrugged, drinking again. "And I had a feeling you liked pregnant women, so at least someone is pleasuring her besides Katie."

"Katie?" Brandon said, shocked. "From the maternity clothing store?"

"Mmhmm," Sarah smiled. "You and her have very similar taste in women." Sarah shuddered a bit. "Geez, just thinking of Mom so pregnant gives me the heebie-jeebies. I can't imagine ever being pregnant with one baby, let alone the 25 she's carrying now."

Then I won't shatter your illusions, Brandon thought as he drank some more. "Did you know you and I aren't...you know, blood-related?"

"I only learned recently too," Sarah said. "It makes sense, actually. Mom and I are such brilliant, strong women and you're such a fuck-up and a weirdo."

"True," Brandon laughed as he drank some more. "So if Ashley and I continue to...spend time together, you're okay with that?"

"What am I, envious?" Sarah chuckled. "No, trust me, there's no an envious cell in my body." Thanks to Erin, she was telling the truth. "Just, you know, treat her well."

Brandon nodded. "I really have to now. Tanner's been arrested."

"Arrested? For what?" Sarah said, sounding more surprised than she actually was.

"Some sort of financial fraud. I convinced Ashley not to bail him out after all the shit he's done to her," Brandon said, his tone getting darker as he finished off his beer and immediately ordered another. Sarah joined him in a second round.

"Glad there's one woman here who can drink," the bartender scoffed. "The whole city has a baby on the way and we need women to bring in customers."

Sarah leaned forward. "You know, I'm starting a company called PregTech and I have an invention that can make women drink alcohol with zero harm to her babies."

"Yeah? Well hurry it up then," the bartender said. "Not that pregnant women bring in a lot of horny guys at happy hour, but it would be nice to at least have some more customers."

"Maybe you wouldn't mind investing in PregTech," Sarah smiled. "We're opening tomorrow on Trigger Street."

"Maybe I will," the bartender smiled, giving them their beers and heading off to talk with other customers.

"Isn't it...weird?" Brandon said. "You being the only non-pregnant woman in town?" He wanted to see if he could jostle her memories.

"I'm fine with it," Sarah laughed, drinking more. "And I can think of a few women who aren't, can't you?"

All Brandon could think of was Mara and he still didn't understand that, since he didn't know about her infertility. "I guess so..." He took another sip. "It's nice to talk like this with you, you know?"

"I guess so," Sarah shrugged. Brandon's heart sank a little. The nightly belly rubs he was giving his adopted sister really brought them together and now that it was gone, they were apart again. "By the way, your ex-girlfriend is running the mall now."

"She's what?" Brandon said, shocked.

"Yep, and she's colossal," Sarah laughed. "Even bigger than Mom, can you believe it? No wonder you had the hots for her."

Brandon's cheeks turned red but he also started to piece things together. If the mall was opposed to PregTech and Erin was now huge while Sarah was barren, Erin must have used the transfer to take Sarah's babies.

"Say...did you ever have a necklace like this?" Brandon asked, holding his up.

"That ugly thing? No way," Sarah laughed. "But...the other PregTech women had one. And I think I left one with my energy conversion laser."

"Your what?" Brandon blinked.

"Never mind. Anyway, I'm not sure whose was on the laser, but Catalina Corazon used it last. I'd ask her," Sarah shrugged, turning to her beer.

Then that's who I have to go see, Brandon sighed. Get the amulet from Catalina, steal Sarah's babies back from Erin, and give it all back to Sarah.

Brandon knew he had some more responsibility now, after talking to Lania. These amulets were dangerous but he'd struck a bit of a balance. But with Sarah losing hers, that balance was gone. He needed to restore things before he could fix this whole situation.

"Where does Catalina live?" Brandon asked.

"Already you're going to fuck other pregnant women?" Sarah said, glaring at Brandon. "What about Ashley?"

"No, you don't understand. I-" Brandon said, but Sarah had already slapped him.

"I'm starting to know why Erin doesn't hang out with you anymore," Sarah said, gulping the rest of her beer and walking out. Brandon sighed and hung his head.

Okay Brandon, he said to himself. Who else knows where Catalina lives?

"There's only one man I need to like my belly," Ashley said quietly with a smile as she continued her waddle. "I sure wish I had one of Sarah's new inventions for pregnant walking...then again, Brandon said he found my strained waddle sexy."

"Wow, you look amazing!" a woman with a 14-baby belly and dark skin cooed as she hurried up to Ashley, rubbing her belly against hers. "I have such a big crush on middle-aged preggos. Mind if I take a few pictures of you?"

"Go right ahead," Ashley smiled, striking a few sultry poses on the sidewalk as her amulet burned against her bosom. "I'm glad you like what you see."

"So where do you shop?" the woman asked as she rubbed her own belly eagerly.

"What do you mean?" Ashley said with confusion.

"C'mon, you know. PreggoMall or PregTech?"

Ashley paused, stroking her chin. "I-I don't know what PreggoMall is, but my daughter is one of the creators of PregTech, so-"

"She is?" the woman said with shock and glee. She pressed up against Ashley and gave her belly a long, sensual rub. "Listen, since we're such good friends, think you could get me on the waiting list for one of those robo-spines?"

"I think I have to leave that up to Sarah," Ashley gulped. "Sorry, she doesn't want me meddling in her business."

The woman sighed. "Fine. You're a good mother. That's what makes you so sexy."

Ashley shook her head in confusion as the woman with the camera waddled away. "What is going on in this town since I was home?" Making her way to the grocery store, Ashley saw aisles and aisles of big-bellied women getting lots of food, clearly letting their cravings get the better of them. Ashley kept being distracted by all the sexy women she spotted and knew, in this new pregnancy-centric city, she could probably get more than a few phone numbers out of her trip, but chose to focus on her shopping list. Besides, she had Brandon to take care of.

As Ashley filled up her basket and waddled around, she was stopped in an aisle by a familiar tan belly. "You!"

"Hello again," Kim grinned, her hands running up and down the sides of her massive belly while her other hand held a basket filled with luxury foods. "How could I forget you? The reason Tanner ran to me for sex?"

Ashley gripped her fists in anger and pointed at Kim's belly. "Are those his?"

"Maybe," Kim sighed, patting her swollen middle. "All of these bellies popped up so quickly in this town, it's hard to say. But it makes sense, doesn't it? After all, you swelled up nice and large and so did I."

"I know where my babies came from," Ashley said, placing her hand firmly against her round belly. "We made them together and they grew inside me. And it doesn't bother you at all that while I was swelling and straining to create new sons and daughters for him, he was having sex with you?"

"No," Kim cackled. "Not that I need him as a sugar daddy anymore anyway. I got a great new job that you'd be very interested to know about."

"You? A job?" Ashley smirked, looking Kim up and down. "You don't seem like a girl who gathered many useful skills in your lifetime."

"This belly is the only skill I need," Kim purred. "I'm on the board of directors at PreggoMall and I've been learning a lot about our company. Seems our competitor is your daughter. And my boss is your son's ex-girlfriend."

Ashley turned pale. "What do you mean 'ex-girlfriend?'"

"Never heard of her? She's named Erin and her belly would give yours a run for its money," Kim cackled, pressing her stomach against Ashley's. "But the way I hear it, both PreggoMall and PregTech have ways to make pregnant women larger. Maybe I'll try and eclipse you someday. I want to give birth to more of Tanner's children than you. Just for fun."

"You're horrible," Ashley growled, which only made Kim laugh more.

"See you around, big mama," Kim said, waddling away from Ashley. "And be careful. Being pregnant at your age is no walk in the park from what I hear. Make sure your knees don't get too sore."

Ashley grunted and her breasts squeezed against the sides of her amulet.

PING

Kim's belly swelled forward and knocked over another woman's cart. "Watch where you're going!" Kim groaned, patting her colossal belly. "I'm an important person in this city, you know."

Sarah woke up on her stomach for the first time in days as her cellphone's alarm buzzed over and over. She groaned and reached over to hit the snooze button. Grabbing her phone, Sarah pulled it into her cocoon of blankets and saw that she had a voice message from Dr. Schultz.

"Great, now what?" Sarah grumbled as she called the foreign investor back and brought her phone to her ear. "Hello, doctor?"

"Ms. Page!" Dr. Schultz said with glee on the other end. "I wanted to call to say congratulations are in order! I made the right choice investing with you and PregTech."

Sarah rubbed her eyes, not realizing just how much she'd been drinking last night until it was hitting her now. "Could you be a little more specific, doctor?"

"The roll-out of PregTech is a huge success. What else would I be talking about?" Dr. Schultz said. "When I read about the protest outside of your city's mall with your main board getting in a confrontation with other pregnant women, I was worried I'd made the wrong choice. After all, with the amulet loose in this city, all pregnancies can become very dangerous. But you are in great business so far."

"Right," Sarah said, trying to think. Katie, in her sudden burst of business wisdom (thanks to her greed amulet), must have set everything up while Sarah was off...doing other stuff. "So my inventions are selling?"

"A little too well, it sounds like. There's a large backorder," Dr. Schultz said. "But your partners have already put many of the city's pregnant population to help build your inventions and giving them jobs in the process. Between you and the revitalized mall, this city's economy is going to grow right along side its baby boom."

"What is the mall doing?" Sarah said, not realizing just how serious the other side of the protest was.

"They have all kinds of new pregnancy-oriented shops open and room for activities meant for pregnant women. In fact, they're almost exactly matching what you and PregTech are doing," Dr. Schultz said, putting down his newspaper on the other end of the phone. "Did you do something to piss off any of these PreggoMall people?"

"Indirectly," Sarah sighed, thinking about Erin's frenzy at the protest. "But they can't do everything I do. I've got inventions on the way that they would only dream of."

"That's good, because I've got more bad news," Dr. Schultz said as he turned to his computer. "It looks like the mall is planning to unveil its own version of your robo-spine for pregnant women."

"What?" Sarah said in shock, but then remembered her attack last night. "That's right, someone stole the spine yesterday. They must have sold it to PreggoMall...or it was one of their employees who took it."

"You'd better start working on those new inventions fast then," Dr. Schultz nodded. "But good luck. Glad I at least chose to put my money into an exciting company."

When he hung up, Sarah flung herself into action despite her mild delirium from last night. As she walked downstairs, she saw Brandon and Joel still asleep on the floor, surrounded by empty beer cans and bottles. "Looks like someone had a worse night than me," Sarah sighed, wondering what her mother saw in him. She didn't care about Joel that much, but she needed Brandon to at least be alert. Sarah walked over and kicked him a few times with her foot. "Wake up."

Brandon groaned and got up, looking at Sarah confused for a few moments. Then he remembered that she had her pregnancy stolen, likely by Erin, and her current lack of a belly made sense. Even without it, Sarah was still a beautiful young woman however. "Sorry, crazy night."

"I'll bet," Sarah grumbled. "I'm going to work and I have a lot to do. And if I recall correctly, you have an internship too. So figure out a way to get all this cleaned up and get Joel out of here while also going to work because I don't want to come home to a mess."

Brandon nodded, but midway through, the memories his trip through the alcohol aisle fuzzed up became clearer. He knew he needed to restore Sarah's amulet-induced pregnancy to balance everything out. But for that, he needed her amulet, which Catalina had. "H-hey Sarah!" Brandon said, leaping to his feet. "Actually, I don't have work today. Mind if I come help you at PregTech?"

"What, so you can ogle at all the pregnant bellies in the city?" Sarah glared at him. "No thanks."

"No, honest! I want to help. It was weird learning that we're not really brother and sister and I want to try to repair any relationship we might have had. It's not like I was doing nothing at my internship either. I can be useful."

Sarah crossed her arms and thought about it. "Fine. If you step out of line, Janice will probably take care of you anyway."

"Great, just give me a minute," Brandon said, grabbing all of the bottles in one clumsy swipe. As he hurried out to the recycling bin outside, he got out his cellphone and called Clara, his boss while Tyler was in the hospital.

"Hello?" Clara sighed on the other end.

"C-Clara, it's Brandon," he trembled. It was hard getting used to the way things were originally between them. Before he took away her pregnancy, she was set on having sex with him and blackmailing Brandon against her own cheating husband. "I can't come to the internship today."

"That's fine, it's slow here anyway," Clara said. "This PregTech/PreggoMall thing has frozen the city. I'm sure glad I'm not pregnant during this chaos."

"R-right, that would be bad," Brandon gulped as he hung up and hurried back to his sister. "Okay, let's go."

"What about him?" Sarah said, pointing to Joel on the floor. Brandon groaned and wrote a quick note telling Joel where he was when he woke up and urged him to leave. "Some friend you are."

"We're all busy," Brandon shrugged as he got into Sarah's car. Not long after they left, Ashley waddled back to the house, all sweaty and panting from her walk coupled with her heavy pregnancy.

"I should try doing exercise again," Ashley panted, taking off her damp shirt and waddling around her living room. "I haven't seen Janice in a long, long time."

As she waddled and stomped around, Joel awoke and slowly got to his feet. "Hello?" he said, looking around.

"Hello again," Ashley giggled as she rubbed her massive belly and gazed at Brandon's handsome friend. "Remember me?"

Joel screamed and bolted out of the house, his experiences with Grace and Catalina giving him a severe fear of pregnancy. As he ran, he tried to think of where he wouldn't see any pregnant bellies.

"Grant! Grant and Mara!" he panted. "Grant hates pregnancy and Mara can't get pregnant." He stopped on the corner and called his bearded friend. "Grant? It's Joel...a convention? Mind if I tag along? I just...need to get out of the city for a while. Great, come pick me up at my apartment."

Brandon walked into the factory where the factory line was being set up. " how the hell are you guys working so ahead of schedule?" Brandon said as he took out his note pad.

"Please, your boss's men came to me after they heard about the protest yesterday and begged me to help them with engineering up the production line. So, here we are!" Sarah said as they walked towards the managers office. "See, they even installed cameras for free!"

They walked through the assembly line, pregnant women and men were working in unison, however they did not enjoy working side by side. There were more pregnant women than men in this town now and many men were trying their best to assert their dominance amongst he maternal movement. "Hey lady, move it, or atłeast do something useful with that belly" a sleazy worker said, with a smoke in his mouth.

"Hey! Get that disgusting thing out of your mouth and go to my office." Sarah snapped at the man. The man distinguished the cigarette on one of the machines and then walked up stairs. As Sarah walked up the stairs, brandon couldn't help but stare at Sarah's large behind. The food she had eaten over the past few days had gone straight to her butt. The two scaled the stairs up to the management level where the rest of the management team was.

Janice stood at the head of the table, giving to orders to Catalina who was making sure her make up was on correctly, she had her mirror propped up on her belly. Katie was behind a laptop, trying not to look at Janice, the matter they had an hour ago still fresh in her mind. Sarah took her seat and advised Brandon to sit up the back. "Who's he?" Catalina asked, looking at brandon like he was a spy.

"That's my, brother." Sarah said as she arranged her sheets. " Brandon? Tell them what you do"

Brandon looked around the room and just before he sat down he got back up."Oh yes, hi, I'm Brandon" he said shaking Catalinas hand. Sitting down his hangover just hit him." How do you doOOHHHH GOD!!!!" Brandon said as an incredible headache hit him. Everything went blurry.

"Good god, Brandon what are you doing?" Sarah asked her step son. "Can you hear me?"

"Sarah, I don't think that's possible" Katie said looking at Brandon, his hands holding his grabbing head. " surely you can see he is in pain."

"It's his own fault" Sarah said walking over to him, kicking his leg to make sure he was still conscious.

"Why are you guys so loud?" Brandon pleaded as he collapsed to the ground. "Ugh" was all Sarah could say as she grabbed brandon and dragged him onto the constructing factory line.

Brandon lay outside the meeting room, hearing every banging hammer, every chainsaw cutting and people calling out. The sleazy man who was smoking saw the poor hungover man and walked over. " you okay mate?" He asked, prodding the man who was moaning in pain. Sarah walked back inside and continued with her presentation, ignoring the agonising pain Brandon was going through.

"So, today we will start working on three new inventions. Pregnant Women need to be more mobile, so we need to give them the ability to drive." Sarah said flipping her white board to today's agenda. "We have to start working on constructing a biology department to help put an end to that horrible heart burn, Janice you will help me with that, you are a yoga expert aren't you?"

Janice was fixated on Brandon's noises outside, sounding more and more like two moose mating. Spinning back around she said "yeah, I'm such a yoga master, I'm so calm I can help find alternative ways to remove that heart burn. That stupid heart burn it's just like Joel, annoying, comes for whatever he wants and leaves, if I could I would crush that stupid pain like I would to that dick!" Janice angrily said, remembering the man who put her in this situation. She crushed the China cup she was holding in her hand whilst looking at Katie.

Katie spun around after seeing Janices threatening stare. Don't mention last night, not a word, was all Katie could think, she liked having sex with Janice, but she was a forceful character. "And number three?" Katie asked?

"Oh yes, Katie, Catalina, you will find and tackle a way to get PREG TECH to be the leading company in pregnancy needs here, we need a place to sell our products, so look into that too.

The man outside finally realised the pain he was going through, grabbing his noise cancelling head phones he put them on his head and brought him into Sarah's office, lying him down on the couch. "There you go. The pregnant women are too busy to think of anyone but themselves..."

Rebecca waddled into the mall, her sloth like nature had given her a wide behind. She noticed this herself and decided it was time to do something about it. This was going to affect her performance and with another pregnant woman behind the wheel of Pregomall she had to get into shape.

It wasn't just her mammoth butt that took all the fat either, her breasts were getting so globular that she couldn't zip up her tracksuit. Her cleavage bounced as her fat legs wobbled into the gym. She stopped, exhausted, not realising the energy her belly had converted a while back had now diminished. Her vision got blurry and almost collapsed, if it wasn't for a handsome man with a strong chiseled jaw.

"I'm glad I saw you come in" the strong man said. "Are you okay?"

"Low... blood sugar... I think..." Rebecca said as she pulled out a snickers bar. The man was impressed with how quickly she chowed it down.

"I'm Frank by the way. So, are you looking for our prenatal yoga? It's my first day and my class is in 20 minutes." Frank said as he passed her a glass of water. Rebecca downed that too. "Yoga may help you in your current, uh... Situation" he couldn't help but stare at Rebecca's belly as she rubbed it slowly. He made sure he wasn't caught by pretending to look at one of the gyms flyers.

" well, if you are the teacher, I guess it would be fun to try it out..." Rebecca said as her breath finally came back to her.

Clara is doing fine.

The storm hit back at midday after what seemed like a brief window of sunshine. The clouds rolled in looking like a wall of darkness. Thunder boomed and lighting lit up the dark sky. People around town made sure they were inside for this storm looked absolutely monstrous.

This wasn't the case for the mall though. The energy inside was almost electric, in some cases it was nearly literally. Erin was holding a press conference declaring she will be releasing new products every day until the end of August. The media had filled up the presentation room above the mall and everyone had a question.

"Erin, CEN national, you have lived here since it was a small town, what would you say about this Titanic population and developmental boom?" A reporter asked

"Well, my family moved here because my dad owns a mining company that works around 120 miles directly South South west from here. He did his business in a diner down the road from here and that's where it all began. Things picked up and I was born" Erin said as she looked out at the sea of faces. "Businesses boomed and higher classed people started moving here. The town has grown but there has been a major boom in the past nine months. Look, I'll just say, I look forward to the future of this town; I'm sure it will be large, prosperous and welcoming to the smart and gifted."

There was nodding in the crowd and a couple of claps as the press conference went on. "Ray Roberts, channel 8 news, with almost every woman in this city pregnant, are you not afraid that this will cause a mass displacement in city's economy and implode several of its businesses?"

"I'm afraid I am not sure what you're saying, take for instance our line of devices to help pregnant women walk and perform certain tasks." Erin stated.

" yes, that's all good and all but those babies are going to come out, is your hospital going to be able to support so much labor? No pun intended, you are a very attractive woman Ms Turner but did you notice there are only 2 day care centres in town? What happens if they can't make it to the preschool?" Ray lead further on. Erin saw one of her most fatal flaws, she hadn't realised that she would be giving birth soon, that she would have to support several young babies on her own.

"I... um, I realise that we have been focusing on so much about pregnancies and not what comes next. I can assure you we just had a business close down recently in the mall and we will be setting up a day care there too."

An attractive spanish reporter stood up. " Marita Cardona from Wolf Nightly News. Erin, why did Antonio Greene, a man who was successfully running a mall decide to leave the company and leave a woman pregnant with... atleast 30 babies due in a week or more?"

Erin's eyes became fierce, she was furious. First Clara dominates the mud pit without a foetus inside her and now this reporter thought she could ask such bitchy questions? She focused her amulet on her. Her belly grew out, fast, it was like a beach all was inflating underneath her shirt.

PING!

She stopped when her belly was holding quadruplets. "I'm sorry, I didn't quite hear the question, could you repeat the question?" Erin asked grinning at what she had made.

Rubbing her large midsection Marita repeated her question. " sorry, I should speak up. I asked you why a perfectly good CEO- oh no" Marita stopped as she felt her belly fighting against her restricting clothes. The reporter's pregnant belly burst free from the cage that was her light blue shirt. Marita was in shock, embarrassed by what had happened to her, "I'm so sorry!" She stammered out, failing to pull her shirt back around her.

Ray turned around with everyone else, looking at the poor woman. For 'some reason' he was taking all the pregnancy related reports lately, and this was meant to be a break for him. Alas he still got to see some bare belly. Realising how embarrassed she must be he texted his co anchor Jennifer Armstrong [Jenny, you wouldn't believe what happened, you remember Marita from WOLF? her shirt just tore open infront of everyon, I'm going to go help her]

[ why are you telling me this?] jennifer texted back [ you know the current report I'm doing, just get whatever details for tonight's show and leave]

[fine, I'm just gunna make sure she is okay] Ray texted as he went over to help the poor woman hide her exposed belly and breasts, maybe cop a feel of her belly as well. Climbing through the maze of people he got to her and helped cover herself with his jacket.

"Thank you, wait aren't yo-" Marita started but was cut off. Lights, screens and anything else that was connected to a power port was turned off.There was a massive black out in the mall.

"What the hell is going on?!" Erin asked Wendy furiously.

"There seems to be a power outage, don't worry the back up generator should come on." Wendy said assuringly. Sure enough the lights, cameras and everything else came back on, flickered then shut down again. "Damn it" Wendy said under her breath.

"all these cameras and the energy we have been using must of short circuited the generator, Okay people this is real, we will need to postpone this press conference, thank you. We will have people here shortly to help escort you out in safety"

----

Lania flew around town trying not to be struck by lightning. Have you ever seen a ghost struck by lightning? No? Good. She flew right around the storm, making sure it would return and stay directly in Freyaton a little longer, it could slow down some of the chaos around town. Once she controlled the wind flow that was blowing the storm clouds she flew to a safer area away from the climactic part of the storm.

The sports club

Lania flew into the mansion, curious of what happens inside. She buzzed around, and travelled up the stairs. She heard talking happening from a room so she decided to investigate. She discovered a trophy room with what seemed to be a men's club. Duncan sat smoking cigars with his most trusted members of the club, his trusted committee.

There was his right hand man Ron, the sportsman master. He owned horse stables for the equestrian events, he trained the Lacrosse teams and is a golf course designer. Charles was next, his love for Alcohol was as big as the equator he called his waist line. He ran the media conglomerate that in Freyjaton. Douglas sat next to him, Erin's father was all to happy to be apart of the cigar Sessions. He owned the mining company and is one of the biggest founders of the club. Lastly was Tyler who was the man behind the country club itself, the man that constructed the town around them.

"Let me ask you something Douglas, has Erin seen Harold lately? He has changed since getting back into lacrosse." Duncan said. The smoke was starting to get heavy in the trophy room. Lania was finding it harder and harder to find her way. She spun around, making the smoke disappear, that's when she saw Duncan starring right in her direction. "What the...?" Duncan pondered. Lania panicked and flew out the window.

She flew through the blacked out mall, everyone was freaking the hell out, but there was security there to help escort them into the car park, where they could stay and not be in the rain.

She flew out, narrowly dodged Lightning as she studied the city some more. Next up was St Paul's Hospital. Women were coming in for their monthly check ups and ultra sounds. Tons of doctors were rubbing swabs onto some enormous bellies, one of which was a nurse who was making sure she was still just pregnant with 5 babies. Grace remembered earlier this week she bumped into the man she fucked yesterday and she felt her belly surge out, sadly the hospital had been so backed up she didn't get time to get the ultrasound until today.

"And that makes nine healthy babies." The doctor said as he started to switch off the machine. Grace was mortified, she had spent her pay checks on five cribs, how the hell was she going to support a whole freaking litter?!

"Th-th-that can't be right!" Grace almost shouted as she rubbed the cream off her belly. Grace couldn't handle this, what was she going to do with her life? Single and a mom? Lania saw the poor woman in trouble so she thought she could take her mind off things. Unfortunately there was nothing she could do. Her powers were weakening and Yarals grip was becoming tighter and tighter in this city. She needed to find Brandon, if she could rest in his amulet she could regain the power she needed.
