1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
"Think of the opportunities," Catalina boomed, hands on her hips as she paced back and forth in front of the boardroom. "You all have a chance to get exclusive access to a demographic that is quickly becoming the city's biggest."

"Biggest," Katie choked quietly to herself, eyes on Catalina's round middle as the actress-turned-executive wiggled it around with each step.

"Pregnant women are the future of business here. Smallton is Freyjaton and the old way of doing things is, well, old," Catalina said, slamming her hands on the edge of the long table, letting her chest and belly hang down on display. "So what do you say?"

The boardroom was filled with the heads of the city's other industries, each looking at one another in confusion and fear. They were all men and what they viewed as the "takeover" by pregnant women made them worried for their own future. Until the mysterious PregTech reached out to them in what seemed like a life preserver thrown to a sinking ship.

But the representatives sent to them didn't get rid of their fears. To them, Katie was the largest pregnant woman any of them had seen, even among the mobs of colossal women who went through the streets in a protesting mob. Her quietness, especially given that she was supposedly the one with the most business experience in all of PregTech, also made them lose some confidence.

And of course, there was Catalina Corazon. She was already well known around Freyjaton from her role at the mall until recently, with her passionate rallies for more mall business to her costume changes to her prideful demeanor. And in such a cramped space, she was even more intimidating. Of course, since she'd worked at the mall, her amulet had made her belly even bigger, and therefore, she became more prideful.

It didn't help matters that Catalina had chosen to dress like one of her movie characters. She had on an open sports jacket with nothing underneath but black lingerie and a long blue tie that ran between her ample chest. She also forewent any pants or skirts, with a long pair of stockings covering up her legs instead. She'd also done her long brown hair up in a semi-professional bun and had a pair of glasses on for show. If any of the business leaders were familiar with the Catalina movie catalogue, they'd know she was Jane Knight, a corporate spy who tracked down the exporter who was secretly a drug dealer and had her sister, a police detective, murdered. It was the closest thing to "professional" attire she had.

"A-a few questions," one man said, getting over his fear to raise his hand. "What exactly are we looking at as far as a return?"

"A return?" Catalina cooed, leaning in farther on the table, trying to put her cleavage in his face as much as possible before her belly got in the way. "You aren't convinced?"

"Well, you say we're getting in on the ground floor, but it sounds like PregTech is just charing us a fee to recommend pregnant customers toward us," he said. "It feels like...extortion."

"Extortion?" Catalina cackled. "Then wait 'till you see the women who run PreggoMall. Those are the real criminals."

The room grumbled uncomfortably, Catalina clearly hitting the limit in her business persuasion. She continued to move around the table with a catlike gait, trying to show her ass and breasts to as many of the men as possible. The truth was, as much as she wanted PregTech to succeed so she could promote herself and get back at Antonio — if he still had anything to do with the mall — what was on her mind now was sex. Joel had stirred something inside her and if he wasn't around, she'd have to get it from someone else.

"Can you give us any kind of model? Projections?" another man said. "Anything?"

"Projections?" Catalina repeated, making her way back to the front of the room. "Of course, we...um..." She tried to look through Katie's documents and whispered to her. "Little help?"

"Hmm?" Katie said, her eyes still tracing Catalina's wonderful pregnant contours.

"Come on, Sarah said this was your thing," Catalina hissed, leaning down to try and get a better look at Katie's files. In the process, her creamy brown belly rubbed against Katie's face, only distracting the enormous mousey girl more.

C'mon Katie, focus! Focus! Everyone's counting on you! Katie yelled at herself inside her mind, trying to find something to grab onto to take her mind off of the pregnant beauty in front of her. As in responding to her wishes, Katie's amulet let out a sizeable pulse.

PING!

Catalina was nearly pushed back by the jump in Katie's pregnancy. Her belly now rivaled Ashley or Erin's in size and may have even been a little larger. And as her womb expanded, so did her greed. The chief thing on Katie's mind was now money, not Catalina, and Katie rose to her feet as quickly as she could, which was not very.

"Returns, of course," Katie smirked, hands rubbing her exposed stomach with glee. "You see, pregnant women aren't like any other customer base you know. At least, not these pregnant women. They're stubborn, excitable, and loyal. The women who support PregTech support us like an army and if we tell them to buy from you, they will. Let me give you an idea of how it'll go."

With deft and grace, Katie ran through the numbers for the gathered business leaders. It was an elegant monument to commercialization, capitalism, customer exploitation, and every dirty thing that went with it. Some of the men began to cry they were so moved.

"I think I speak for all of us when I say PregTech has a deal," one of the men said, puffing out his chest and he reached out one hand to shake Katie's. "PregTech is going to be the biggest force in the city and we want to be right there with you."

"And maybe someday, the biggest company in the country," another man cackled. Katie smiled. That sounded good to her.

And by investing in PregTech, he had done just that. In less than a week of its launch, PregTech had broken any record Dr. Schultz had seen of an upstart's investment return. Things weren't showing any sign of slowing as competition between PregTech and the mall appeared to be stimulating the creative imagination of his golden goose, Sarah, even more.

He chuckled to himself, unable to avoid the realization that the amulets were responsible for this economic boom that tied in so well with PregTech and PreggoMall's own expansions. In his own financial assessments of the city, being the shrewd businessman that he was, Dr. Schultz couldn't help but see that the mall's previous owner, Antonio Greene, was on the verge of launching a similar pregnancy-centric product-line push. It was his bad luck that he had to step down before this could all fully get off the road, though he was doubtless making some sum of money, even with Erin at the helm instead of him.

"Had I known how lucrative this could all be, I would have tracked down the amulets myself and used them years ago," Dr. Schultz laughed out loud in his office. "Maybe Mr. Greene had the same idea at one point too. A lot of good it did him, if pregnant women ended up overthrowing him. He should have had a better corporate spy."

As Louisa was going out on stage, Erin was pacing back and forth behind the scenes, her hands traveling all around her belly. Or at least as much of it as she could reach. Normally when she had to give a big speech, whether at her old work or in school, she got butterflies in her stomach as many people do. But what she felt now was not butterflies, though the near-endless fetal kicking she felt could easily be mistaken for that sensation.

No, Erin felt a very particular unease. Her mind was filled with thoughts of Ashley (not helped by the buxom bombshell now parading in lingerie with a 40-baby belly hanging out) and especially Brandon. Memories of going to previous Comic-Con and Comic-Con equivalents kept seeping into her mind and she thought about how much fun those all were. With a sniffle, she wiped away a single tear that was forming and waddled over to Wendy, who was hard at work typing on a private tablet, built to be half a decade ahead of anything on the market now.

"Wendy," Erin said, her voice trembling, "I-I can't go out there."

"What's the matter, nerves?" Wendy said, not looking up. "Put on one of those massage helmets we're going to unveil. They work, don't they? We copied PregTech's design to the T."

"No I mean...I have somewhere else I need to go," Erin said, shaking all over. "I...I'm sorry." Erin waddled away as quickly as her massive body could take her, fishing a phone out of her cleavage. "Dana, it's Erin. I need a ride. We might be gone for the whole weekend."

Dana was a private driver for Smallton Mall and stayed on as an employee when the gravid uprising took place. She was a good looking young woman with olive skin and dark hair she kept in a ponytail. Now that she worked for Erin, she was far more pleased with her treatment and her increased pay and even took on a double role as Erin's personal assistant, which she did quite well. And also she was extremely pregnant and couldn't love the experience more. Erin had never seen her even attempt to cover up her bare belly.

"Sure thing boss," Dana chirped on the other end. "Where to?"

"I'll give you the directions when we meet up," Erin said. "But we'll also need to stop by a costume shop."

Back behind the stage, Wendy let out a long breath. This wasn't how she expected the day to go but it was better than she could have hoped for. Now she was in a much better position to take control of PreggoMall if she was leading the flagship product launch. Wendy was even more averse to public speaking as Erin but she placed one hand over her small belly and sucked in a new breath.

"You can do it," Wendy told herself in a low, quiet voice. "You have part of Antonio inside you. You have his power."

Wendy nodded and walked out on stage as Louisa met her eyes. "A-a big hand for our...director of operations, Wendy..." She leaned away from the microphone and whispered. "Hey, I don't have your last name written down."

"Greene," Wendy said with a smirk. "From now on, call me Wendy Greene."

"Looks like we're about to hear from another official in the PreggoMall company about what they're offering," Marita said to the camera. "Again, I'm Marita Cardona, reporting live."

"Mmm, she's showing a lot of belly," Katie said, staring intently at the TV in the PregTech office. "Though I wish they'd focus the camera more on Ashley and that other woman."

"That's my mother and the woman who broke up their marriage," Sarah grumbled. "If you couldn't find Catalina, then you can at least be quiet." Katie clammed up and decided to ogle the women in silence.

"When do we pull the plug?" Janice said. "I can't wait to teach these cows a lesson."

"Soon," Sarah purred. "We just need to wait for the right moment."


While all that was going on, Brandon and friends waited in the massive line leading into the convention center, all dressed up in their Avengers costumes, when they finally got near the massive building's entrance. "Okay, we're finally here!" Grant said with excitement. "I've been waiting for this all year."

"When we get inside, should we stick together or all split up?" Mara asked, adjusting her Black Widow suit.

"I hope you stick with me," Grant said, giving her a kiss on the cheek.

"I guess that answers that," Joel said, rolling his eyes. "I'll split up. Brandon, you want to stick with me or walk around solo for a bit?"

"Huh?" Brandon said.

"Brandon?" Joel repeated. But Brandon was looking off to the side, distracted. He could have sworn he saw a woman in a Supergirl outfit who was...well...pregnant. Blue t-shirt and red skirt but nothing to hide a big, round belly. When he looked again, he couldn't find her in the sea of other costumed nerds. There couldn't really be pregnant women here too...could there?

"I think I'll walk around alone for a little while," Brandon said vacantly. "I-I'll text you guys."
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.title: PreggoMall start their big event

1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
Brandon quickly dodged past several con goers, trying to make it to the blonde pregnant woman that was checking out some of the merchandise at one of the stalls. As he got close he paced himself and took a look at the woman. She looked like she was supporting decatuplets, almost. But the fact she put the fort into still wearing the costume whilst in this state was impressive. Her large rear was getting a major wedgie from wearing her undies on the outside.

He stepped closer and recognised her face. It was Grace, the nurse that helped out Joel after his unfortunate brain injury. The same woman who gave him her number after the weird accident at the mall.. “Man cons are fun but the merchandise always costs an arm and a leg.” Grace said under her Breath as she flipped through DVDs.

“Having trouble? As a fellow superhero I might be able to provide some assistance.” Brandon said sliding in next to her.

“Hah, bad introduction but good costume. Wait, you look familiar. You're the guy who didn't call me after I gave you my number!” Grace said punching Brandon in the shoulder.

“Ow! Hey…” Brandon said rubbing his arm. “I'm sorry I forgot to call”

“You're a real ass face you know that?” Grace said, an angry look on her face.

As Grace continued to embarrass Brandon in front of everyone, an extremely sexy bodacious woman in a Jane costume walked confidently walk over. The costume was a bright yellow and very Victorian, but she made adjustments to show off a lot of cleavage. She threw her dark brunette wig over one side as she swayed her hips. It was Becka McLean, or as she was more commonly known in the cosplay community as, ‘Princess Becka’ for her various Disney cosplays. Most notably she cosplayed Belle, Ariel, Jane and Elsa, all female characters from various Disney entities. However now that Marvel was bought out by the happiest company on earth, she decided to wear something more daring.

To say Becka was a commanding person was an understatement. She knew how to manipulate and rule geeks with an iron fist and voluptuous chest. She had managed to over take every other female cosplayer, even Jessica Nigri! Now she stood proudly on her ivory pedestal, and she wasn't going to let any other cosplayer take her place. She saw Grace trying to pull off her costume but struggling with nine babies inside her. But Grace had a little bit of a following behind her. Graces pregnant cosplays had gained her some fans that were more interested in her belly than anything else. This made Becka FURIOUS!

Joel saw the very seductive Becka and walked over in his Thor costume, swinging his hammer the same way he swung his penis, like a cricket bat. “Princess Becka, it's such a surprise to see you not as belle. Why is that?” Joel asked suavely.

“Because all the guys act like gaston” Becka snapped back, not being able to muster some fake politeness. Like a homing missile Becka directed herself at the large target that Grace was. She may have been short at 5’2 but she strode confidently like a Queen. “well if it isn't Miss Preggy, have you found your Kermit yet?” She smugly said miraculously talking down to her as she looked up at the pregnant superhero.

Geez… Brandon thought to himself, that was low but how could I embarrass her? He thought about making her pregnant, causing her to burst out of her dress, but reality would change.

“Shut up, you have no idea how hard this is to be pregnant, or how this affects my life!” Grace stammered back shaking her large belly as her angry face changed into one that was upset. Brandon's guilt for the pregnant cosplayer was really piling on. He caused so much chaos in this world and was enjoying it, he never realised someone may have a bad affect on it.

That's when he saw Joel. Joel used to love pregnant women until they scared the shit out of him. His friend was now feeling lonely. Maybe he could do something about it. That's when the announcer spoke up. “HELLO CON GOERS! I HOPE YOU’RE READY TO MEET THE TALENTED HAYLEY HEWITT FROM EZRA: AMAZONIAN QUEEN AND THE VERY BEAUTIFUL ASHLEE BYRON, WHOM YOU MAY REMEMBER FROM TITAN HUNTERS: THE BOUNTY OF ANDROMEDA. THEY WILL BE GIVING THEIR TALK ON WOMEN PROTAGONISTS AT STAGE THREE IN FIVE MINUTES”

“Oh shit, I forgot about that” Joel said as he ran over to Brandon.

“DON’T FORGET AT 1PM WE WILL HAVE OUR COSPLAY COMPETITION, JUDGED BY THOSE LOVELY LADIES! WHO KNOWS, MAYBE YOU AND YOUR FRIENDS WILL WIN AN EVENING WITH THEM PLUS THE MANY OTHER STARS HERE AT GALACTI-CON” the announcer echoed through the con before ending his announcements.

“Don't think about joining the cosplay Comp, your belly couldn't handle the competition” Becka said laughing as she walked away, boobs and arse jiggling as she strode forth. Brendan was furious, he wanted to pregnate her so badly but she kept her cool. In order for him to humiliate her, he was going to need to reveal the secret of the amulet.

Grace slumped in her costume, depressed with what just happened. “Hey, don't look so sad, I think you look beautiful” Brandon said patting her on the shoulder.

“You don’t understand” Grace said “Becka is the most famous cosplayer here. If I do anything like claim she was harassing me, her Vulture like friends would attack me!”

“What if I told you I could take your pregnancy away and give it to Becka?” Brandon said smiling. That's when he saw Joel come by. Brandon realised he couldn't let Joel know about his amulet so he quick turned to him and said “Joel, could you give us one second?”

“SsuuUUURREE!!!” Joel said as he saw who he was talking to. He saw Graces very pregnant belly, turn tailed and bee lined away from them.

“What do you mean?” Grace asked, not noticing Joel. “What, do you have your own tesseract?”

“Somewhat” Brandon said as he revealed his amulet. Grace was mesmerised by the beauty the amulet held. It had been a while that he actually looked at it.

“Hey, I remember this, from that time in the mall. shouldn't we be doing this behind closed doors?” Grace whispered to Brandon, trying to be secretive.

“Nah it's cool, this thing rewrites reality for all those who don't know what it does.” Brandon said, “now look.”

Grace looked down to see her belly add an extra five babies inside, almost tearing the costume.

PING!

“Hey! Whoa, what are you doing?” She almost yelled, huffing with all the newly found weight.

“Whoops, sorry force of habit, here” Brandon said as he reduced her belly to the point where she wasn't pregnant at all. Her pregnancy, all 15 foetuses sucked into the Amulets many gems.

PING!

Grace looked down and saw her body was back to normal. She was almost at the point of tears. “Thank you! Thank you so much Brandon!” She said hugging the star spangled man. “Here, I have an idea.” She said as she wrapped up the amulet and put it in an opaque box with a blue light inside. “Now it's apart of your costume!”

Joel stopped running for time had been rewritten. He walked back to Grace and Brandon, with a memory of having sex with Grace, but without her pregnant. “So what happens to the pregnancies?” Grace whispered to Brandon as she saw Joel heading back towards them

“It stores them, ready to be transferred to someone else. I have a plan for them But for now, I think you and Joel should chat.” Brandon said as he walked off to Ashlee and Hayley’s talk on women protagonists.

“Hey” Joel said suavely to a cute petite Grace. “I didn't know you liked geeky stuff”

“Well, Let's say I'm like the doc from back to the future. My love for all geeky things is larger than 1.21 Jigawatts.” Grace answered with a sly grin.

The two cosplayers had fun talking about their passions, meanwhile…

Ashley and Kim go behind stage for the next two inventions
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
Erin ran out of the costume shop with a costume and a determined look on her face. Squeezing back into the back seat of the limo she adjusted herself inside as Dana zoomed off onto the highway. “You’re okay for me to get dressed in the back of the car right?” Erin asked as she unbuttoned the pantsuit she was wearing.

“Yeah sure” Her driver answered delightfully. The barrier went up and Erin got started. Dana happily listened to some tunes enjoying the drive to Charlesberg. All that changed when they pulled out onto the highway. “Oh no…” She said as she pulled on the breaks. “We had a problem” Dana said winding down the window to see Erin with a breast free and taking everything off.

“WIND UP! WIND UP!” Erin called out as she dropped pieces of her costume. The barrier went back up and the comm came on. “Sorry about that” Dana said over the intercom. “Bad news, the radio says there was a car crash outside of Charlesberg… I'm checking the GPS and it looks like we won't get there for another 2 hours.”

“Great, we may as well turn back and I can cover the rest of the presentation” Erin said as she slumped in her chair, looking at her brunette wig and red dress. She remembered how much Brandon liked Peggy Carter from Captain America. Sure she wasn't in a slave Leia costume, but she remembered what Brandon liked.

As the car was about to turn around they both saw the traffic was equally bad both ways. “Forget it, let's just go to Galacti-con. stupid Antonio, not investing in any help-freaking-copters”

Erin slumped back into her seat defeated as her large breasts bounced on her plump juicy belly. Placing her juicy breasts back into their confined bra she flipped a switch and down came a TV with the coverage of Preggomalls latest “inventions”


“First up we have the Lazylady” Wendy said as she pressed somewhere on her high tech tablet. Curtains revealed a very Kim comfortably sitting in a perfectly shaped couch, curved to her every shape. “ this one was developed by some of our scientists” Wendy said as she turned to the sexy model “Kim, could you press the purple button?”. The Kim did as she was told and pressed the button whilst she groaned, her babies were once again kicking. A small bit of calming spray came from behind the chair. Almost instantly the babies calmed down and Kim started to fall asleep.

“Is she okay?” One of the reporters asked, concerned with the model.

“Oh she is perfectly fine, the scent is a combination of Aloe Vera, cinnamon and several calming fragrances imported from China and Africa” Wendy said with a big smile “100 percent o natural, no chemicals just what you and your baby need. Up next we have A Mudams Best Friend.”

A curtain came up to reveal Ashley soaking in a perfectly modelled mud bath. “If you are a woman who wants to keep looking like a sexy goddess whilst your pregnancy is causing break outs and other unpleasant skin irregularities then this is right for you.” Wendy confidently described to everyone “ It doesn't matter if you are here for 20 or 50, this bath will make you look like a Emma stone or Jennifer Lawrence, whilst pregnant of course.”

“Can normal people use this mud device?” An obnoxious reporter asked, annoyed that he had to cover this event.

“Sir, you are at the Preggomall, you shouldn't remind you to have an idiom of respect.” Wendy sternly said with a glare at the now shocked reporter. “ But I am afraid this is, just like every device here today, pregnancy focused, because WE CARE FOR THE MATERNAL WOMAN.”

The audience erupted in a thunderous applause. “We love your products!” A pregnant woman called out.

“Oh please, they aren't my products, I'm just the one that runs the business side of things, Now Erin, she came up with these great ideas. Let's get on with the show” Wendy declared with a little bit of fake bravado. She knew by saying that she was setting herself up for any problems that these items may have. If one product failed, she could say It was Erin's fault. That one line secured her spot for any situation.

“Let's move onto the next item, we are only one third of the way through, but I assure you, we are doing much more than those guys at pregtech.” Wendy laughed.


Sarah's sat in her chair, trying to be calm but it wasn't working. She was happy to see her mother accomplishing something, but she hated the fact that the Preggomall was doing so well. She was supposed to get a visit from Dr Schultz, but she still heard nothing from him… The strain was starting to take its tole on the sexy inventor.

“LET ME AT HER!” Janice said as she leapt for the TV. Katie grabbed Janice's leg but the force was too great. They barrelled over each other like a sack of potatoes.

“Oi! Get back here” Sarah ordered as she reclined in her chair. “If you are going to be here, you are going to learn some self restraint. AND THAT GOES FOR THE BOTH OF YOU!”

Sarah was angry, so far Wendy had announced nothing that Pregtech had been producing, she wanted to launch the virus there and then, but she knew she couldn't. A virus that would short circuit every one of Pregomalls stolen items at once can't be used until everyone has purchased the new products. That way the virus affects EVERYONE. No one will escape the city wide shutdown. Everyone will have faulty new products and who will they blame?

The Preggomall. With that much hatred on the streets Preggomalls stock will plummet and it will go bankrupt. There will be chaos… once there is complete disarray Pregtech will come in, rescue the city and make a new order. Sarah knew Both companies couldn't work together, there would always be one side trying to one up the other. But her goal was something wonderful.

It will be one where pregnant women, oh let's face it, women and men can feel safe together, where the only piece of disorder is not knowing what to have for dinner. A paradise for pregnant women and men in unison, and she will be the one who made it happen. Her greatest invention, ‘Peace’ on a dynamic scale. She would have made the biggest impact to the city and she would be envious no more.

The problem is, she needed her spokesperson to help her with Pregtechs rescue plan, so…

Where was Catalina?
Where was Dr Schultz?
Where would Pregtech be by the end of the day?

Brandon moves through the convention
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
Katie was hard at work at her desk in the PregTech headquarters, her nose buried in the numbers. With Sarah's rousing pep talk, as well as a smattering of implied threats from both Sarah and the especially-vicious Janice, combined with Katie's libido presently satiated after a night with the wrathful fitness instructor, Katie was back on track as PregTech's key financial whiz, helped on by her own "greed" amulet. Between PregTech and PreggoMall, her side had more sin-promoting amulets but so far it wasn't slowing them down any. And that wasn't counting Brandon's but no one, not even Sarah who first cracked the way to manipulate the amulets' energy, knew what his was capable of.

"Uh, Sarah?" Katie said at one point. The broadcast of the PreggoMall showcase had been moved far away from Katie's desk, lest the parade of bellies and babes distract her anymore. She lifted her head and called out louder. "Sarah?"

"What?" Sarah yelled back from her viewing room, with Janice and their lawyer Maritza by her side.

"Stop shouting," Janice growled.

"There there," Maritza said, giving Janice's belly a light rub. "We can all be calm, okay?" Janice huffed in response, not wanting to show just how relaxing a belly rub was to her.

Sarah tapped the PregTech logo lapel, which she had redone as a short-wave communicator between employees inside the bustling PregTech office and factory. "What's up, Katie?"

"I've just been going over the figures for next quarter and...there's a problem," Katie said.

"A problem? What sort of problem?" Sarah said, turning her eyes back to the television screen, just in time to see her mother Ashley strut out in some new maternity clothing that she had to admit was very alluring, even if it was coming from a competitor. "Now's a bad time to have problems."

"It's our investment capital. It's gone," Katie said, tapping her laptop to refresh. "Yeah, whatever money that Schultz guy promised us to start the year with is no longer in our coffers." She heard Sarah start to breath heavily on the other end. "I mean, we still have his initial investment so it's not like the doors are going to have to shutter soon but we don't have enough to sustain the kind of growth we've planned for."

"What about if sales go through the roof?" Sarah said, the envy in her amulet burning as she watched how well PreggoMall's showcase was going. "Once I crash the mall's party, every big-bellied woman in the city is going to be banging on our doors begging to buy from us."

"Not with the inventory we have now," Katie sighed, her fingers moving a mile-a-minute as she typed out calculation after calculation. "We'd have to show some sort of whole new company service to open up a new lane of patronage, or even attract new customers."

Sarah fell back into her seat, letting her mind go clear. She shut her eyes to the events going on at PreggoMall and focused her genius mind on the problem at hand. And at the end of her mental firestorm, she came to the only answer. "I was hoping to wait longer for this," Sarah said, "but looks like I have no choice. Dr. Schultz either got wet feet or PreggoMall intimidated him somehow."

"So you do have a plan?" Katie said.

"Yes, I've had this plan for a while now," Sarah replied. "I'll send you the figures now for you to crunch and get back to me."

"Beautiful and smart," Katie purred.

"Don't get distracted now," Sarah said, standing up proudly. "This is PregTech's most crucial moment."

"Sit down. Your big belly's blocking the screen," Janice grumbled. But Sarah paid her no mind as she stomped to her office and pulled out the massive external hard drive she'd kept locked away under several layers of security. Even Rebecca couldn't break into this. With her pregnancy-supporting robo-spine, Sarah made her way through headquarters to Katie's desk and dropped off the multi-terrabyte hard drive.

"Think you can handle it?" Sarah said.

Katie plugged it in and gasped when she saw how much data was waiting for her to sort through. "This will be...a challenge."

"I know you can do it," Sarah purred, leaning down to whisper in Katie's ear. "Do a good job and I'll reward you. After all, you and I still haven't...you know." Sarah let her tongue slip out just slightly to tickle Katie's earlobe. The young businesswoman's eyes opened wide and her amulet heated up, adding more than a few fetuses to her already sizable litter.

"I-I'm on it!" Katie said, slamming her fingers against her computer's keyboard as she worked as quickly as she could. Sarah chuckled and strode to her own lab, letting her belly and ass swing with each step. Inside was her "secret weapon" against PreggoMall. It was something she'd kept so secure, she hadn't been in for days, which was why PreggoMall could never even install spy cameras inside.

It was the culmination of all her research into pregnancy energy and the power of the amulets. A massive antennae that would send out the same signal of both the amulet and the pregnancy energy converter. Once activated, every woman – not just every pregnant woman – would be affected by its powers. They would become comparable with the other devices Sarah created to control pregnancies. With just the touch of a button, a woman could make herself as pregnant as she wanted to be. Want to be six months pregnant with one fetus? Done. Want to be full term with 50? Done? Want to have unprotected sex without any risk of impregnation? Done.

What's more, the antennae would also make it possible for women to convert their pregnancy into energy. Not only would this allow pregnant women to power the city, with just one woman with triplets containing enough power for an entire year's worth of power for all of Freyjaton, but it would make them healthier, stronger, and allow them to carry their pregnancy indefinitely before turning the energy in their wombs back into fetuses and giving birth.

It was possibly the biggest discovery in the history of mankind and it would make PregTech more than just a company. It would make them a historical force. Sarah knew it would be a game-changing announcement but also knew PreggoMall was likely working on similar kinds of technology. She had to pick the right time to release it but it seemed like her hand was being forced by Schultz' withdrawal.

Still, this was a big project and just because her time table was being changed didn't mean Sarah could be easy-going with it. She needed the rollout to work. And that meant a PR campaign. Which, in turn, meant she needed Catalina.

"Maritza," Sarah said as she walked back into the viewing room. "I need you to find Catalina."

"Me?" Maritza said with shock. "You're sure? You already sent out Janice and Katie and they couldn't find anything. Besides, I'm not as important to the company as you all. Why me?"

"Frankly, Janice and I need to stay here and monitor the situation at PreggoMall and...you have a clearer head than those two at the moment," Sarah said. Katie was obsessed with sex and Janice was fuming with rage, after all. "And as an outsider, you may be able to think about these things better than any of us."

"I'll do my best," Maritza nodded as she heaved herself up. In her time with PregTech, she'd had her pregnancy increased and her 20-fetus belly now protruded far out of her usual conservative corporate dress in a massive brown bump. As she left the headquarters, she thought to herself. "Maybe the Catalina Corazon fan network can help..."

Before joining the PregTech team, Martiza had already been a big fangirl for Catalina, feeling inspired by the pregnant movie star. In her past career as a lawyer, Maritza found herself discriminated against for being a woman, a Latina, and pregnant: all things Catalina embraced with pride. And, like almost everyone in the city, Maritza had a bit of a crush on Catalina as well.

To Maritza's surprise, as she went through the internet history of Catalina fandom, there were too many dead-ends. Some of Catalina's most devoted fans hadn't even posted a Tweet since last night, which was not normal. She stroked her chin with curiosity and saw that many of their last Tweets were from the same location: a hotel in the city.

"I think I know where to start," Maritza said to herself, stroking her belly as she hailed a taxi.
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.title: Where is Catalina?

choices: Grace enters the contest
Grace stays out of the contest
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
Brandon's heart was beating more steadily now. Ironically, it was his bumping-into Grace that calmed him down when normally meeting the extremely pregnant young woman would have put him into a nervous fit. And of course, calling Grace "extremely pregnant" was going off of any kind of standard that fit into medical propriety. Sarah and Ashley made a woman pregnant carrying 20 fetuses look like a walk in the park.

But by meeting Grace, Brandon assuaged his fear that the "pregnancy epidemic" he had set into motion was confined only to Smallton, or as his actions caused it to be known, Freyjaton. At least, that's what he hoped. A small itch of doubt remained in Brandon's heart as he walked through the convention floor, pushing past other enthusiasts in their own elaborate costumes. Thankfully, his was a little more compact.

"Wow that's a nice accessory," Brandon heard someone say from his right side. He turned to see a young woman in a full Harley Quinn costume bending over to inspect his "tesseract."

"O-oh, thanks," Brandon said, worried about what was actually inside it causing it to glow. "But the, um, lightbulb inside is pretty hot so you should probably not touch-"

PING!

It was too late. The curious woman touched Brandon's cube and reacted with the amulet inside. Her latex suit groaned to stretch and fit the triplet-sized belly that pushed out from her body. There were a few rips and tears along her waist but she otherwise stayed covered.

"Sorry, I'll be careful," she said with a little giggle and a pat of her belly. "Gotta watch out for other cosplayers with spikes and swords too, after all."

"R-right," Brandon said with a gulp. "Y-your costume is good too."

"Thanks," she said with a smile as both hands held her belly. "I'd already bought the costume before I found out I was pregnant but it works just as well. It's canon that Harley had a baby anyway...though it probably wasn't this many."

Brandon nodded quickly and hurried along as he tried to keep himself distract. The amulet was getting more dangerous as time went on, it seemed, and putting it away inside the model tesseract was not doing much good in keeping it out of harm's way. Brandon tucked it under his arm a bit more tightly but only ended up activating it once again. Across from him, two bikini-clad women dressed as Yoko Littner and Starfire respectively suddenly became very out-of-character as their tight stomachs changed in large, round pregnant middles.

“Uh oh,” Brandon mumbled to himself, still snatching a few errant peaks at the attractive pregnant geeks as he hurried along. Brandon made his way into a less crowded room where he was immediately shushed for his loud steps. He hurried to an empty seat in the back as he focused on the stage. It was a small table set up with a moderator and two others sitting next to each other, speaking into microphones. Brandon instantly recognized the two of them: Hayley Hewitt and Ashlee Byron, two celebrated actresses in the world of sci-fi and fantasy.

In front of the table was a banner for their panel: 'Women in Geek Culture'

"What we've been fighting to promote is the fact that women have been a part of writing and movies since the beginning," Hayley said, looking out into the crowd. "This is not a recent phenomena. All we're asking for is the chance to prove ourselves and have our own stories be valued."

"But unfortunately, the way the market has been segregated, a lot of people will hear or see that a woman is involved and lose interest," Ashlee said. "And you have a virulent anti-feminist movement going on now that furthers that. I think the low attendance here is proof."

Brandon heard what they were saying loud and clear. But at the same time...he had planet-sized crushes on both actresses for as long as he could remember and he felt his hands get closer and closer to his amulet until!

PING!

"The discrimination really kicks in when pregnant actresses are ignored for roles they can still do," Hayley said as her growing belly pushed the table forward. From where he was, Brandon couldn't even tell how pregnant he'd made them but he felt like he'd added more than usual. "Just look at the rising star Catalina Corazon. Clearly there is a market for pregnant actresses even in action roles."

"Just a reminder that Hayley and Ashlee will also be meeting with the winner of today's costume contest," the moderator said as a hand touched Brandon on his shoulder.

"Couldn't help yourself, huh?" Grace asked him in a laughing whisper.

"W-wha?" Brandon stammered. In the flurry of pregnant women he'd had sex with since the amulet came into his life, she was one of the few close pregnant friends he hadn't gotten intimate with, though if he had to admit it, he wished he and Grace could have slept together. Even without her belly now, Grace was an absolutely gorgeous young woman.

"Their bellies. I notice these things now, remember?" Grace chuckled. "Hey, wanna get out of here and head for the costume contest? There's someone I really want to see."

Brandon hoped he'd have another chance to see Hayley and Ashlee's pregnant bodies but he was curious about the contest too. In the main theater, it was packed as pop culture fans were seated and ready for the costume contest that always came to Galacticon. Brandon edged his way in, with only standing room available, as he prepared to watch the show himself. It would be a good distraction from the recent craziness surrounding himself and the amulet. And besides, it would be fun.

The costume contest was divided into men and women as the men started walking across the stage, each in detailed renditions of their favorite characters, whether it be a complex piece of armor for a character from a fantasy game or a full sized X-Wing for someone to stand in or a mostly-functional Iron Man suit.

"A lot better than your friend's," Grace said to Brandon.

"Hi again," Brandon said. "I thought you were walking around with Joel."

"Eh, Joel wanted to check out some booths and he wasn't that interested in the costume competition," Grace said with a shrug. "Besides, I wouldn't want him to see this side of me."

"What side do you mean?" Brandon asked.

Grace turned to him with a nasty grin. "The side of me that'll jump for joy when Princess Becka gets humiliated on stage when that giant belly of hers explodes out of her costume!"

"Technically it's your belly," Brandon said with a chuckle.

Grace leaned into Brandon. "And technically, you and that amulet of yours gave it to me from someone else so I wouldn't bring that kind of attention on yourself, pal."

"Fair enough," Brandon said with a gulp. He didn't even know if he had caused Grace's pregnancy or if it was one of the other seven amulets in the city. Hell, it could even have been due to Sarah's experimentation with the amulet's powers. "You really hate Becka, don't you?"

"Ugh, every year she would single me out to mock my costume," Grace sighed, fluttering her costume's skirt. "I mean, this doesn't look that bad, does it?"

"N-no," Brandon said, getting permission to look Grace up and down. "You look very nice." He felt himself getting more flustered and lost his internal filter. "S-so...do you feel better now that you're not pregnant?"

Grace sighed and touched one hand to her flat stomach. "Sure, now I know I won't be raising nine babies at once. It's a big relief."

"R-right," Brandon said, feeling embarrassed about the situation his amulet set into motion. Then again, no one seemed to be close to giving birth either so maybe she would have been fine.

"Hey, you know that weird company back in town, PregTech?" Grace whispered, leaning in close to Brandon with a big smile. "I hear rumors they've developed some way to let women carry their pregnancy indefinitely. Now that would be interesting."

Brandon felt himself start to shake more and more as the crowd cheered at the crowning of the men’s contest winner. Grace clapped along, her mind not focused on her conversation with Brandon.

“Now we can begin our women’s costume competition,” the announcer, a host of a well-known video podcast on “geek culture,” said as the line of participating women formed. From their spot in the back, Brandon and Grace couldn’t make out Becka in her Jane costume.

“Ooh!” Grace suddenly said, grabbing Brandon’s forearm and squeezing it tightly. “I just thought of something!”

“W-what?” Brandon said in surprise.

“I know how we can REALLY embarrass Becka! Why don’t you make all the women competing pregnant?”

Brandon was totally nonplussed by her suggestion. “W...why would I do that?” he finally managed to get out.

“Because if she’s embarrassed about competing with a big belly ripping out of her costume, imagine how much more embarrassing it would be to her if she lost to another pregnant woman!” Grace cackled. “Aw c’mon dude, please?”

“T-that just doesn’t seem like a g-good idea,” Brandon said, looking around quickly in hopes no one was overhearing their conversation.

“You can just reverse it afterwards, can’t you? You did that to me, after all,” Grace said, rolling up her shirt to show off her detailed abs on her noticeably not-pregnant midsection. At that, Brandon’s face went totally pale and he gripped the cube containing his amulet. He could see all the women in line start to swell up as his heart raced.

“T-there,” Brandon said. “And I think I can turn it all back after.”

“You better,” Grace said with a grumble.

“What do you mean?” Brandon asked, turning to see Grace holding a new pregnant belly, this one even larger than her last. “Oops.”

“Oops indeed,” Grace said with a sigh.

1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
Grace sat there as the first contestant walked up on stage. She remembered the first time she cosplayed. As she rubbed her swollen middle she thought how funny it was to dress up as Misty from Pokemon, in a sea of people cosplaying the very same costume. She was friends with Becka back then, but as Galacti-con reached its second and third year, Becka got more enthralled with being the idolised cosplayer. She was absent minded as the first cosplayer waddled off stage.

Two years ago Becka really started to hammer in the insults. There were five cons around Smallton and Charlesberg and whether it was the events dedicated to gaming, movies, anime or board games, Becka was there to put her down in some way. But Grace could never make a come back. Every time she saw the buxom beauty, grace was filled with nostalgic moments of how they would stay up late marathoning Sailor Moon with bowls of twinkies and m&ms.

A lot had changed since then, and she no longer needed Beckas approval, she had a thin body with long luscious legs… looking down she remembered she was reunited with a very large belly. 18 big ones kicked and shuffled around in there. But she could get those babies removed, she could enter the competition and STILL beat Becka! But that would be through cheating. So many cosplayers were up there that put time and effort into their costumes. She couldn't take victory from them because they were now pregnant. Even if she did win, would winning fuelled her satisfaction or just her hatred for Becka?

“Hey, You alright?” Brandon said turning to the gorgeous nurse/cosplayer.
“Yeah, just thinking” Grace grumbled back at Brandon, looking at the tesseract.

“So why aren't you in the competition? I thought you would like to have met Ashlee and Hayley. “Brandon said as he placed his shield down in front of him.

“Well, I was lucky enough to get the Supernova pass, which means I get to cut all lines, priority seating, which I would have taken if it weren't for this huge belly in my way, and I get to go to the actors dinner tonight too!” She said with a squeal at the end. Her tone soured when she looked down to see her dominant belly, rubbing up against several other con goers. “Hey, why don't you just take care of this back pain generating ball of flesh now?”

“I guess that's a good Ide- HEY, WATCH IT!” Brandon said as an overweight man barged into him. The force caused Brandon to accidently drop his tesseract armoured amulet, which bounced off his shield and flew into the crowd. Panicking Brandon dived for it, but it was too late. A cute geek accidentally kicked it closer to the stage, her belly expanding from underneath her Star Wars themed t shirt.

Putting his shield on his back and looking like a blue turtle he scurried for the bright blue box. He ended up right near the stage when he saw the amulet be picked up by a woman in a police outfit and red hair. As she stood up, her belly started to accelerate out massively. Arching her back up the Amy pond cosplayer was pregnant with quintuplets. “Ooohh, look at this marvellous prop” she said, rubbing her belly.

“Sorry miss pond, but this is one blue box you don't want to have.” Brandon said as he snatched the amulet back. A security guard came up and placed his hand on Brandon's back. “Can you come with me please?” The guard quietly said in his mono tone voice. Brandon's face went pale as he was brought behind the stage as everyone else welcomed the next pregnant cosplayer.


Erin sat impatiently in the limo as she watched the TV. Unfortunately for her, she had eaten all the complimentary snacks that was in the back. “Dani, I need an ETA!” She shouted as she lowered the barrier.

“We are getting there, but it looks like it'll take another two hours.” Dani replied, looking out to the road.

“WHAT? You said it'll be two hours ages ago!” Erin shouted, frustrated with her situation. She slumped onto her back, tired with everything. Luckily for her, she adapted the robo spine to Sarah's battery blue prints, and she had a spare head massager in her car, hooking up the spine to the massager she managed to power both items with the one device. She fell asleep as she left the TV on.


“Now we're up to round two of our presentation!” Wendy said as everyone came back from the first break. Now, who here has problems when travelling around with such a massive belly?” Wendy asked her audience. Several hands went up, including Marita. “Well I have great news for you! We call it the Belly Ring!”

Kim came out, wiping lipstick off her face and quickly adjusting herself as she walked out in a bikini wearing a tiny belly ring in her popped navel. “ now as you can see here with Kim's belly ring we have one of our Tiniest inventions. Our biomedical and engineering teams have come together to build a device that acts as a sonar device, helping pregnant women navigate without having their bellies bump into anything.”

“How are you able to make such a device that small work?” one reporter asked, fixated on the swaying belly.

“Well, the belly ring is implanted on the belly button. Due to the bellies reaction to the device it retracts into an innie. From here Ring can detect how close your belly is to objects through the subtlest of vibrations.” Wendy said as she picked up one of the items from her podium. “ Kim here can't even feel her belly ring can you?”

“Nope, but I will admit It was a little incredible as my belly button got pierced” Kim answered with a wink. The wink was lost on everyone.

“How so?” Marita asked trying understand her.

Kim realised how vanilla the crowd was. “Well, when the ring was attached, it's vibrations were so intense I cam-

“Come on!” Wendy blurted out, trying to stop Kim's sexual deviancy. “ I mean, why don't you come up here and we can test this on you. Surely a beautiful reporter like yourself can understand how important this can be to have”

Marita threw down her microphone and climbed the stage. A couple of assistants helped Marita up and started to apply the belly ring. One of the lovely dressed assistants switched the item on as another applied rubbing cream to her almond skinned belly. “Now you're going to feel a slight prick but afterwords you the vibration will be so incredible it will feel like the best sex you've ever had.” Said the male assistant.

“Oh please, you professional types are always so cautious” Marita said with a little laugh. “Now attach this little gem to me!”

The assistant did what they were told and attached it to her belly button. The Belly Ring began to vibrate almost incredibly, sending vibrations down to the reporters clitorus. “Whoa… Okay, that's… Ohhhhh” Marita barely breathed out as she clutched her belly. Standing up she tried to remain professional but it was not working well. “IIII-I-I am fine, I can understand, fuck…. I can understand, oh God…. What Kim was talking ab- excuse me one second.” Her legs wobbled as She quickly moved behind stage and just dropped to the floor. She panted and panted as she came over the backstage floor, her legs now spasming as she quivered with delight.

Wendy knew she would have to continue presenting or she would lose supporters. “Whilst Marita collects herself, I'll present you with our next great invention! “ Wendy said as Ashley came up holding a curve shaped phone.

“Its hard keeping track of everything when you're pregnant. You have to know what to eat, what appointments to keep, where the nearest bathrooms are and all this silly stuff meaning you have no time for you.” Wendy said as she carried on, making the life of someone who is pregnant sound daunting. “ But now with the malls new smart phone you can keep track of all this stuff and have more time for relaxation. This phone run by our own OS, and using our very best in battery technology (thank you Sarah…) we are making this a Pregnant friendly world.”

The audience erupted in applause as they saw the new device. Marita composed herself and waddled back on stage to cover the new invention. “This is truly astounding news. Move over apple and android, the new phones coming for two!” She announced in front of the camera.

Wendy came over wearing a microphone and asked Marita “how does the belly ringfeel?”

“You know, I can't feel it, is it still there?” Marita asked, trying to look over her huge bump.

“It is, haha. Just come by the podium for a second.” Wendy said as she guided e news reporter over. “Now with our new phone, you can let it speak with your belly ring, change its vibration level or how close you have to be to something in order for it to vibrate.”
Marita stopped a couple of inches from the podium as she felt a pleasant vibration come from her belly. “Oh you're right. And it's so subtle too!”

1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
Sarah was trying to keep her composure as she watched what unfolded. Her preg phone was being developed along side her “belly-bot”. Not to matter she reclined back and tried to calm her envious state. She looked over to Janice and Katie and saw that they were staring at her like a couple of worried puppies. “What are you looking at? Don't you have something better to do?” Sarah barked.

“Sarah, you have to relax, it's okay for you to be jealous of them” Janice said trying to be the voice of reason for once “remember we wait until Frejyaton is under Preggomalls spell and BOOM!”

Sarah calmly stood up, waddled over to Janice, smiled her and pulled Janice up by her pony tail. “Don't, EVER, call me jealous Janice. You don't know what true envy is. Now, you and Katie go find Catalina and DON’T COME BACK UNTIL YOU HAVE HER.” She let go of Janice who had a look of shock in her eyes. She grabbed Katie and they left.

Sarah left the boardroom and entered her office. She looked at her past three years of work on the walls. Inventions she took so much time to construct. She rubbed her belly as she picked up her prototype of the “belly-bot” or “belly ring” as Preggomall called it. As she looked at the cute little design her eyes began to water.

She would be known as a knockoff for what she had invented. What the Preggomall was too much for her to handle. She yearned for a hug, if only she had Brandon to hold her…

----

Brandon was guided behind stage where Princess Becka and several pregnant cosplayers were ready to take the stage. It was dark and the ‘tesseract’ slipped between Brandon's fingers and fell to the ground. It slid across the floor and over to one of the pregnant contestants. As the pregnant Yoko Litner picked up the tesseract, her belly surged forward a little more. Becka saw the very pregnant cosplayer hand over the tesseract to Brandon before waddling on stage.

“Hey, whats that?” Becka said as she bent over looking at the amulet.

Brandon was starting to get smug. He looked at the busty cosplayer and said “it's a device that makes women pregnant”

“ha, don't bull shit me.” Becka retorted “I know that's the Tesseract. I just want to know how you made it”. Brandon had no idea what to say, Grace was the one who made it.

“Like I would tell the ‘great Becka’” Brandon answered, trying his best not to pregnate Becka.

Before Becka could come back she was called on stage. Grumbling she buried her anger deep down and put on her fake smile. Getting on stage she wowed the audience by giving them a little wave. She made it to the centre of the stage and gave her little umbrella a twirl.

“And here we have Princess Becka dressed up as Jane from Tarzan!” The spokeswoman from Pop Culture announced to the crowd. Grace was excited, Yet restrained herself. The announcer continued, “so, Becka, how did you make this lovely costume?”

“Well Jennifer, I- oohhh” Becka started but was cut off. Peering from a slight viewing area Brandon focused on making Becka big! Becka was in shock as she watched her midsection inflate like a balloon filling with water. Her breasts followed in suite. Her already large breasts were now over flowing her bra whilst her expanding belly was starting to break the seams on her dress.

“Is everything okay Becka?” Jennifer asked, as if nothing was wrong.

“Oh god, you can't see what's going on?” Becka almost squealed to the host of Pop Culture. She touched her triplet filled belly as it continued to expand. “Oh god it's huge…”

“Yes we know it's a huge crowd but for someone carrying ten babies, I'm sure your fans are supporting you every step of the way!” Jennifer confidently reassured her.

“I’M PREGNANT WITH TEN BABIES?!” Becka screamed as her breasts burst through her top, jiggling in front of the amazed crowd. Becka tried to cover her growing breasts but they flopped over her arms. Her belly was continuing to grow beneath her pillowy cleavage. She could feel her arse expand underneath her large dress. Slowly her expanding body ripped her costume to shreds until she was wearing nothing but tatters. Becka was horrified. “I, I, it was captain America…” Was all that could escape her mouth.

“Oh please, we all know Tarzan caused that belly” a random man Called out in the crowd followed by laughter. Embarrassed and overwhelmed Becka was escorted off the stage by some security guards that put a blanket over her.

“We are sorry about that, we understand that our pregnant cosplayers should be reasonable with their costumes when expecting, Becka will be alright don't you worry, once she is properly clothed she will be back for us to declare a winner!” Jennifer said trying to throw what just happened under the table. “But now we have a special gift for all of you.

Brendan walked around, thinking about what just happened. Sure he just stopped a bitch from being on the pedestal again. But at what cost. That's when a group of pin up girls in red white and blue outfits came up to him. “Are you ready for this or do we have to go on without you?” One of the sexy buxom dancers asked

“what?” Was all Brandon could ask.". Oh one second” Brandon said as he focused on making everyone pregnant. There was a sound like a a balloon blowing up to bursting point, and a few of the pin up girls let out a gentle “Ooohhh”.

PING!

“You gals still okay to do this?” Brandon said as he readjusted his helmet.

“Hey, this may be Captain America’s song, but don't forget we are doing this for two of the best female actresses on tv.” One woman proudly said

“They're in the same boat we're in, so don't sink this performance, okay?” One red headed performer ordered.

One of the stage hands grabbed Brandon as the pregnant pin ups went to their stations. “You ready?” The stage hand asked Brandon

“I guess?” Brandon answered… He'd seen captain America thousands of times, he should know ‘Star Spangled Man’ off by heart by now…

5..

The light for the stage switched off… All except some distinct ones.

4..

The trumpets and other instruments started to play.

3..

The women took the stage, ready to perform

2..

Brandon was pushed on stage

1..

And the spotlight shun on him

“Who's strong and brave, here to save the American way!” The ladies sung

“Not all of us can carry a gun or fight against the enemy” Brandon confidently quoted his second favourite hero.

“Who vows to fight like a man for what's right night and day?” They continued.

Brandon walked about doing his best manly impressions as he continued to quote Captain America.

“Who will campaign door to door for America, Carry the flag shore to shore for America…” The women said as they danced in unison. “ From Hoboken to Spokane, The star spangled man with a plan!”

The women danced on in red, white and blue outfits as Brandon took a look around the stage. He could see Jennifer from Pop Culture standing there. With a simple thought Jennifer's belly started to expand. Her unbuttoned flannelette shirt drifted out ways as the bottom of her tank top rose, revealing a triplet laden belly.

PING!

As the song went on, he couldn't help but make more women pregnant.

One

PING!

By one

PING!


“Stalwart and steady and true”

“see how this guy can shoot, we tell ya, there’s no substitute!” the girls sang as they began the can can.

Brandon saw his opportunity and increased the pregnancies of each of the busty sensational pin up models. Their outfits strained as their bellies blew up larger and larger. Time was being rewritten so quickly ant robospines appeared on their backs.

Three pregnant women got on top of a motorcycle and Brandon realised what had to be done. He saluted the audience and walked over knowing he would break his back. As he got behind the bike, he saw that the bike was strongly secured with tones of invisible wires.

“THE STAR SPANGLED MAN” the women sang gracefully.

The motorcycle started to lift and brandon quickly grabbed underneath.

“WITH, A, PLAN!” Everyone sang out loud. Brandon was amazed by what he had seen as he pretended to lift the motorcycle. He had stumbled into one of the best performances of his life! The audience erupted in applause. Words couldn't describe what Brandon was thinking when he walked up to Jennifer.

“That was quite a show Cap, do you have anything you would like to say to the people?”

“Yes I do…” Brandon said as he removed the helmet from his head. “I'm afraid I'm not the person that was meant to be performing here tonight, but I will say this. Geeks are the way of the future!”

The people could not get enough of Brandon! He went in to give Jennifer a hug whilst the judges (mainly Ashlee Byron and Hayley Hewitt) looked on with glee. As he let go of Jennifer Brandon noticed his amulet and shield was missing! Where did it go?

1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
In the scuffle caused by the production of the Captain America recreation and the ensuing pregnancies that were created over the course of the cosplay contest, Brandon's small model Tesseract that contained his master amulet was lost in the fray, sliding and bouncing around throughout the vast backstage of the convention's main theater. It was kicked around with the help of numerous newly pregnant women who could no longer see their legs and feet to know what they were hitting and moving. All problems that could be avoided with the help of PreggoMall's belly-ring, of course, but that's neither here nor there.

But when the glowing box came to a stop, a very pregnant woman groaned and slowly bent down, clutching the sides of her belly as she worked her way down to inspect and clutch the small, strange object. As soon as she picked it up, she felt her belly expand and quiver with a new and unexpected flurry of kicking and movement inside her womb. The difference was, she was well aware of the change and did not have her perception of reality altered.

"What is this? It looks familiar..." The woman said. And it makes sense that she found it familiar. The one who took Brandon's amulet in the prop was none other than Catalina Corazon. How was Catalina at the convention? To answer that, one has to go back in time a bit.

In the morning, Catalina awoke in her nest of adoring pregnant fans, cooing and drinking in the celebrity worship. One hand caressed her enormous brown belly, colored with the lipstick of all the women gathered around her. She was literally off the ground with so many big-bellied women around her, all of who were still asleep, big smiles on their smeared lips as they held close to her.

"Easy ladies," Catalina giggled, struggling to reach one foot down to the floor. With each movement, no matter how small, she could feel the hands and bellies of her adoring throngs against her warm skin. Catalina was totally naked, save for her amulet safely nestled between her colossal breasts. As she made her way to a closet and put on an unbuttoned shirt to give herself a bit of coverage, the dogpile of women began to stir awake, feeling Catalina's absence.

"Catalina!" one of them squealed, stretching out as she watched her idol pace around. "Come back! We miss you!"

"I appreciate it but a star needs to burn brightly," Catalina chuckled, stroking her enormous round middle. "And that means working."

"But I gave up my trip to this year's Galacti-con to hang out with you!" another girl pouted, both hands mimicking Catalina's movements on her own belly. "I even had front row tickets to the costume contest."

Catalina stopped, her ears perking up. "Costume contest?"

"Sure, you know, cos-play. Men and women dress up as characters from pop culture. Most people just do it for fun but there's an award for whoever has the best too."

Catalina's amulet began to burn as her chest swelled with pride. "That's the kind of thing I should be at. I'm a movie star, aren't I? Catalina Corazon defines pop culture and it would be wrong of me not to attend and show that I am the best. Otherwise, my fans will lose confidence and I do everything for my fans."

The other girls began to gyrate with excitement. "That's a great idea!" they all cried in unison. "Can you get us exclusive passes too?"

"Too little time, ladies," Catalina snickered as she buttoned up the shirt as best she could, only getting her breasts sufficiently covered. And even then, without a bra, her dark nipples completely showed through. "I'll have to stop by my home for a costume but I'll be able to get there shortly."

As Catalina opened the hotel door, she was stopped by another belly, though not one anywhere near as large as her own. "Hello there, Catalina," Barbara cooed.

"Another fan?" Catalina sighed, looking around. "Fine, where's a marker? I'll autograph your tummy, dear."

"I'm not here for that. I'm with PreggoMall and you're a valued client of ours, Ms. Corazon," Barbara said, putting her hands on the small of her back and pushing it out in an attempt to make her belly look larger than it actually was. "We still have more service for you."

"You can hold onto that. My public needs me," Catalina said, attempting to waddle away when Barbara stopped her again. With her mud wrestling toning her body and her use of a functional robo-spine, Barbara sufficiently outclassed Catalina in strength. "Seems there's a miscommunication."

"Somewhat. I'm afraid it's our boss's insistence that you wait here," Barbara said, smirking back at Catalina.

"Look, tell Erin that I don't have any real interactions with that Brandon boy. She can settle this with his sister, my boss," Catalina said, rolling her eyes.

"Erin's not the one pulling the strings anymore," Barbara replied, giving Catalina a shove with her belly.

I'll have to remember that, Catalina thought to herself. Sarah would reward me handsomely for that sort of information. "Look...what's your name, beautiful?"

Barbara blushed as Catalina pet her cheek. She was married to an older and less attractive man with money so she hadn't been pampered by a good-looking man or woman for a while. "B-Barbara."

"Barbara...why aren't you the one modeling for PreggoMall? You certainly have the looks for it," Catalina said, accentuating her lips as she spoke.

"That's just the way it is, I suppose," Barbara said, looking down at her belly. It was currently covered with a very tight pink sweater but Catalina's hand undid that quickly.

"No, that can't be. Look at that lovely belly skin," Catalina said, petting Barbara's maternal curves. "Say...I'm still looking for a co-star in my next big picture. Interested?"

"M-me?" Barbara stammered. "I mean...I don't know how to act."

"Pshh, ever see a Russ Meyer movie? You don't need to know how to act, gorgeous. All that matters is the look," Catalina said with a smile.

"So you can't act?" Barbara said.

Catalina's smile vanished for a moment. "I never said that."

Barbara gulped. "I-I'd love to be in a movie. I've always wanted to be a big star."

"And you will be," Catalina said, patting Barbara's belly. "But if I'm going to contact my agent..."

"Oh! Of course!" Barbara said, waddling to the side so Catalina could leave. "You're free to go."

"Thank you~" Catalina said, blowing Barbara a kiss as she waddled away, letting her plump rear wiggle in Barbara's clear view as she left.


Back in the present, Catalina continued to inspect the cube as her stomach swelled. As a security guard passed, she ignored her obvious pregnancy issues and waved him over. "Excuse me, how do I enter into the contest?"

"Contest is done, ma'am," he said, looking her over in surprise. "Are you...you look familiar somehow."

"I'm sure I do," Catalina chuckled, striking a pose. She was wearing an unbuttoned khaki shirt lined with pockets and a wide dark brown skirt to be in character as her starring role as an adventuring archeologist in "Fertile Treasures." "I'm Catalina Corazon."

"Huh. You look smaller in the movies," he said, making Catalina's cheeks burn some. "And you dressed up as...yourself? That seems like cheating."

"We'll let the fans decide," Catalina scoffed.

"Well the contest is over and they're about to pick a winner," he said as Catalina rolled her eyes again and pushed him out of the way. With stunned looks, the whole backstage crew watched as Catalina strutted out and made it to the main stage. The audience was frozen with shock as she picked up the nearest microphone. "Look, do I win this dumb contest or not?"

The entire auditorium erupted with applause as Jennifer cautiously walked toward Catalina. "I-I guess we have our winner," she said, looking at the other staff with a perplexed look.

"God damn it!" Becka screamed, her voice rivaling that of the microphone's.

"Thank you, thank you," Catalina said, bowing. As she bowed, her amulet slipped out and touched Brandon's tesseract in her hands. The power of both were magnified and the already expanding bellies in the room doubled in size rapidly. Brandon, still confused as to what was going on, watched in dismay as Grace's belly reached levels he hadn't seen since his adoptive mother and sister.

"Oh no," Brandon murmured to himself.

"Thank you again!" Catalina said, waving to the audience as she waddled away with a belly now approaching an excess of 60 babies. "I should have done this years ago. It's so easy!"
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.title: Who has the amulet?

choices: Catalina and Brandon meet up at the convention
Back at the PreggoMall expo
1112112121212111211221111221112112111121.content:
"Move!"

"You move!"

"We can't both move! That's the whole problem!"

Katie was an absolute Janice-worshipper, just like she was with essentially every pregnant woman, but even she was annoyed with Janice's constant state of extreme aggression and, more specifically, wrath. Janice had no issue with being furious at Katie as the two of them struggled to get through the hotel door at the same time, with bellies that were big enough to fit a few pregnant women inside. With a mix of a compromise on Katie's part and a burst of impatient energy from the muscular and powerful Janice, both stumbled forward and smoothed out their clothes as they waddled forward, trying to look unassuming as they did so. "Fine, we're here," Janice growled, looking at her wrist-mounted phone for texts from Maritza that alerted them to Catalina's likely location at this hotel. "Now where is our nosy lawyer?"

"Nosy? Since when?" Maritza said, waddling over and stroking the exposed curves of her big brown belly, a playfully offended smile on her plump lips. Katie's irritated look vanished into a bright smile when she saw Maritza, one of the few pregnant women in the upper echelon of the PregTech company that she had yet to have sex with, which was something she desperately hoped would change. Maritza had it all: the full butt and thighs, the heaving breasts, the smooth, warm skin, the gorgeous face, the kind eyes, and of course, the big belly. As someone who was not an amulet carrier and a relative latecomer to PregTech, Maritza's swollen womb was nowhere near Katie or Janice's pregnant size, but something told Katie that was not going to be the case for long.

"Nonsense, you're a wonderful, bright young woman," Katie smiled, putting one arm around Maritza's shoulders and pulling her in closely so their bellies touched. From this angle, Katie also got a look down Maritza's canyon-like cleavage from under her shirt, which made her heart flutter, which in turn made her fetuses begin to kick inside her belly. "Now then, did our brilliant company lawyer find what room the prodigal actress is staying in?"

"I asked around and, after pressuring the hotel staff with a lawsuit for not having a pregnancy-friendly facility, I have the exact room number. And a key to boot," Maritza said with a grin, reaching into her cleavage and pulling out a plastic key card. The action of removing it almost made Katie faint but she kept the courage to stay upright and patted the bottom of her belly to keep herself stimulated enough to stay conscious. "Follow me."

"Gladly," Katie purred, walking behind Maritza with her eyes on her swinging butt. Janice swatted Katie on the forearm and glared at her.

"Could you be a little more subtle about wanting to fuck our lawyer?" Janice sneered quietly at Katie. "Especially when I'm right in front of you."

"Hey, you already had sex with another guy while I was in the apartment. Remember, Brandon? Squirrely little nerd, brother of goddess-on-Earth Sarah Page?" Katie said, stroking her belly with glee. "I was under the impression we had an 'open relationship.'"

"We have no relationship, it's just...gauche is all," Janice fumed. "And you can't blame me for having sex with Brandon. He has this...magnetism about him that makes my belly tingle. You must feel it too."

Katie shrugged. "Eh, he's not the most handsome guy but sure, if I was into men, I could see myself giving him a belly ride." She leaned back to Janice to whisper more quietly as Maritza stopped at one of the hotel doors and fiddled with the keycard, struggling with her belly in the way. "But what I'm getting from you is that Maritza and I..."

"You want her? You can have her. Go wild," Janice said, rolling her eyes and stroking her belly as Maritza finally got the door open. "Finally. I can't wait to give Catalina a piece of my mind."

The fitness instructor burst into the room, only to stop and look around shocked. Katie followed her in and froze, gripping Janice's forearm. "Oh my god, Janice...it's heaven."

Inside was the pile of pregnant fans that Catalina had left, all still naked and gyrating against one another sleepily. "Hiya~" one of the cooed, looking up at Katie. "Wow, you've got such a big belly! Can I feel it?"

"Absolutely," Katie said in a dreamy voice, waddling over before Janice grabbed her wrist. "What?"

"We aren't here for that," Janice growled as Maritza stepped forward.

"We're looking for Catalina Corazon," Maritza explained. At the mention of her name, the girls all squealed and began to rub against one another more. "You've...heard of her."

"We're her biggest fans!" another girl purred, laughing as two other women kissed her on the nipples.

"I think I'm the biggest, actually," Katie said, patting her belly as she assessed her own pregnant size.

"Was she here?" Maritza asked, still prying for answers.

"She was but she had to leave," they all said with a pout. "Said she was going to Galacti-con to win the costume contest."

"Figures. Wherever there's a chance to win and appeal to a big crowd of merchandise-obsessed geeks, you'll find Catalina," Janice sighed, rubbing her belly. "Well this was a waste of time."

"Nnnnnot quite," Katie said, stepping closer to the soft pile of pregnancy.

"Jesus Katie, I thought I said to quit it!" Janice barked but Katie held up one hand to silence her.

"You," Katie said, pointing at Barbara in the midst of the pile. "You're on the PreggoMall board of directors."

"I-I am," she said, removing one pregnant girl who seemed to be trying to suck Barbara's cheek right off her face. "You're all from PregTech, aren't you?"

"Sure are. What...what are you doing here?" Katie said, placing her hands on her rounded hips and drinking in Barbara's beauty.

"Catalina promised me a role in her movies if I let her go without alerting my boss," Barbara grinned. Janice, Maritza, and Katie all laughed and looked at one another. "What?"

"She uses that excuse all the time around the office," Maritza said with a chuckle. "'Maritza, if you clean out the break room's dishwasher, I'll give you a role in my next movie! Maritza, if you throw away this trash for me, I'll let you meet The Rock!'"

"It's a bunch of nonsense," Janice snickered. "We're all too clever to fall for it but you..."

Barbara's face was red and coursing with bulging veins. "That...big bellied...fat...overly pregnant...cow! How dare she fool me like that! Oh, I am going to get her so badly..."

"Easy, easy," Katie said, waddling over to stroke Barbara's belly and getting a multitude of kisses on her own round tummy from the fangirls. "Sarah will be sure to punish her for skipping out on the company for the day so we've got you covered."

"Guess we'd better head back to the office too. No point driving all the way to some convention for Catalina," Maritza sighed.

As Maritza and Janice waddled out, a hand grabbed Katie and stopped her from leaving. "Hey...how about you stay and spend a little time with us?" one of the fangirls purred. "We'd love to hear what it's like to work with the real Catalina~"

Katie sighed and turned back to watch Maritza waddle out. "Sorry girls, maybe some other time. But for now...I have another task ahead of me."
