1112122.title: Yourself

choices: Leave it up to fate and let Dad make his presentation tomorrow
Find some way to make Dad stay home.
11123.content:
As decisions went, it wasn't the most obvious. But what the hell. Seeing his father pregnant would be good for a laugh if nothing else. And even if this amulet were to be trusted, he could always take it out later with no one being the wiser! To top it all off, his poor parents were so hard at work to secure a good retirement: it was about time they stopped to claim their reward. And, well, a new baby would be just the ticket! Not to mention his mother had already carried two...why burden her further?

Eh, it was all a joke, anyway. Brandon decided to complete the ruse for completion's sake. The gentle hum through his bones stilled at the decision flowing to his index finger. Just one digit under the table pointing at his old man, imagine the deed being done...the amulet glowed under his shirt, he could tell.

PING!

...Huh? What happened? Everything seemed fine. His father seemed the same as before, eating spaghetti at the...ah. At the rather tall table.

And suddenly, Ashley stood up to get a second bowl of spaghetti, setting it down in front of Tanner. His eyes following the bowl, she set it down next to the first, which was being steadily and vigorously emptied by his old man.

"You and those three are really after my sauce!", exclaimed Ashley. "I've never had such a satisfied diner since you got pregnant, hon, this is uncharted territory!"

Those...three?! Perhaps he was a bit too enthusiastic...but his father finished the bowl with spaghetti sauce clinging to his beard here and there, set it down, and beamed like he had just closed a million dollar deal.

"It's world-class pasta, hon!" He slapped his stomach. "Of course these boys would want every little strand they could get, haha! It'll make them big and strong."

"...It'll mostly just make you big, though." Brandon found himself commenting.

Tanner chuckled, and Brandon could hear his father's hands rubbing his stomach through his shirt. He motioned for Brandon to lean in. "Well, don't say this to the girls...", the pregnant man whispered, "But I hope so. This has been a revelation for me. Hell, I might even do it again, if I can close that deal!"

His dad seemed to...like being pregnant? His mood certainly improved from before, even if just a little. Brandon reached under his shirt and palmed the amulet. If he really did seem to enjoy this...then taking it away would just deprive him of joy. And Brandon had to admit that having some little brothers started to appeal to him. Well, then. If Dad wanted to be pregnant, then pregnant he would be! Merry Early Christmas!

He stretched his arms above him and pulled back in his chair, pulling up his skin-tight shirt to unveil a massive, round, and slightly hairy tummy. He must have been just a hair away from bumping into the table with that thing! His father was huge! As if reading Brandon's thoughts, Tanner scooted back from the table just a bit before going to devour the second bowl. He did it with just his right hand this time, keeping his left on his very big belly, kinda like how his high school chemistry teacher did sometimes when she was expecting.

"Dad, could you please wear a bigger shirt?", complained Sarah. "It's jarring to see your gut every time you move."

Their mother tutted at her and replied: "And wait for that shirt to get ruined as well? He's only six months pregnant; he's only going to get bigger. He might as well burst through his old shirts and clear out some closet space."

Tanner nodded as he slurped down another massive forkful of noodles.

Something his dad just said came into focus: if I can close that deal. So it was like he thought: Tanner was still working at the office, six months pregnant with triplets, as a 50 year old man. Damned if he wasn't the hardest working man Brandon ever knew! Still...that couldn't be good for him. Something had to be done.
11123.title: His father Tanner?!

choices: Don't fight the tide - ask to go with him to work and help him if he needs it.
Go with him to buy a suit and tire him out.
111231.content:
...But what could he do, anyway? He couldn't dissuade his dad from working if he wanted to work, not ever. Granted, he had never tried before, but it was always clear to see how serious of a work ethic Tanner had. Hell, his mother and sister weren't even trying to dissuade him, he was that dedicated! If he tried to talk him out of it, Brandon would just make a fool of himself and waste everyone's time. No, his dad was going to work whether he liked it or not.

But something still had to be done. Anything. This was his fault, so he had to take responsibility somehow.

Hmm...

...Come to think of it, what was his old man going to wear tomorrow? Nothing in his closet would fit anymore! Even the roomiest of his suits wouldn't cut it, not with how big he was now! Brandon cringed at the guilt of what he did, realizing that even its weight upon his conscience was dwarfed by the weight of three unborn children squirming inside his father's stomach. Womb. Whatever, it was weird and it was real and he needed to speak up before it was too late.

"Hey Dad?"

Tanner swallowed the last of the spaghetti, reached around his belly to get the knapkin, wiped his lips clean of the sauce, and shot up his eyebrows at Brandon to show he was listening. He kept eye contact with Brandon as he went for the bread basket.

How to phrase this? Perhaps...he had to put on some pressure without sounding condescending. "You're going to get a new suit before heading off to work tomorrow, right?"

Tanner stalled in the middle of chewing a piece of toasted French bread and went bug-eyed. His mom did the same, looking ready to kick herself. But his dad made to finish the bread and swallow, still focused on feeding the babies in his swollen and growing belly. He had to be careful, though, or his pregnancy-fattened backside would fatten even more and keep him from getting out of the average-sized chair!

"Y-Yes, of course. I'll stop by the, ah..." Tanner looked as if he were trying not to smell something nasty, he was grimacing so intently. "...to the Big and Tall shop after I'm done here. They should have something ready for me tomorrow morning."

"...Really?", asked Sarah and Ashley in unison. They all knew how he felt about establishments that singled out clothing based on size. Well, when men were singled out: he didn't say anything for plus-sized companies whenever the subject came up. Not that he had an opinion, but that he neglected to form one. Brandon was distracting himself while his dad was finding his words. It seemed like he was rubbing near his bellybutton for inspiration. Like Buddha, but heavily pregnant and without a fraction of the wisdom. Probably older than Buddha, too, but that was neither here nor there.

"I don't really have a choice, do I? Nope! Not a one!" He hastily shoved another piece of toast in his mouth and chewed with unnecessary vigor. His mom saw his reaction and went to get him another bowl of spaghetti to calm him down, which he would doubtlessly inhale with the rest. The man was not happy. Well, that was what he got for being stubborn!

Brandon finally went back to his dinner before he started getting looks. It was done! Phew! This wasn't much, but it did open some new possibilities. More time spent pondering if going to work was a good decision, for one. But Brandon's hard-working dad was true to his reputation, struggling to make it work even with this "new" time constraint. Perhaps some persuasion was in order...but then again, Tanner wasn't stupid and would see sense after enough thought. But would he even think about staying home instead of squeezing that hill of a baby belly into a suit and lugging it into a room of judgmental stockholders and suppliers? Or whoever it was went to these big, important meetings of his?

What to do, Brandon, you turkey?
111231.title: Big Belly and Tied Hands

choices: Remove the pregnancy from Tanner and move on.
...Wait. There is ONE thing that could be done.
111232.content:
Tanner couldn't go to work like this. He seemed out of breath just shoving food in his face! As happy as he seemed, this pregnancy - Brandon took a moment to let that realization grab him, regretting it soon after - was clearly taking its toll on his health as it was. Working in that office would be horrible stress. He couldn't make that presentation in front of so many important people! Hell, Brandon got sweaty just discussing project ideas with his professors casually! If he dared imagine the stress of making a presentation of consequence in front of people who decided whether or not he would get paid...eugh, and all that for a pregnancy, a male pregnancy at that! Brandon had to...he had to...?! What was he going to do?!

Oh, this was fantastic. Here his greying old man was, bursting out of his old college T-shirt with...with what looked like growing breasts, oh my, and a belly full of three babies, and the one responsible couldn't keep him safe. Great! Never better! No, no, he was letting himself get discouraged: no engineer worth their salt gave up at a roadblock. He had to think carefully...

...Perhaps his dad could postpone the meeting until later? He was heavily pregnant, after all. He could say he overestimated his stamina and request to do it later, when he...is bigger, and slower, and more easily tired; dammit. And they would not wait until Tanner gave birth, even if...shit, could that even work?! W-Well, if it couldn't, then he would just take them out, clean and simple. No need to dwell on that!

...Although Brandon did shudder a bit.

"Are you cold, hon?", asked his mother.

"J-Just a chill, you know how it is."

Sarah shook her head with a wry smile. "You've been hovering over that pasta for a while now and staring into space. You know, I call you a dork to tease you, but if the shoe fits...!"

Brandon stuck out his tongue at her absent-mindedly and swirled a forkful of spaghetti to chew. Strike postponing out, that couldn't work.

...Perhaps they could cancel the meeting altogether? No, even on the surface, that was ridiculous. His dad went on about millions of dollars being at stake, and no businessperson was going to give that up. Strike two.

...He could just...take the pregnancy out and leave things as they were...

"Ah haha!" Tanner thumped his turgid belly and grinned. "Filling as always, but it keeps me wanting more! Eh, Ash? Huh...Baby, you look exhausted! Go take a nap after that bite, don't wear yourself out!"

Ashley tried to wave it off: "Oh, it's nothing, you need your strength. You're eating for four! I'm happy to help you for somthing as simple as--"

Tanner literally waved it off: "Go get some rest, hon. You work as hard as I do. And I've got a son here that's barely touched your prize-winning pasta: his punishment is to get me anything I need!"

Brandon made to quickly shove some pasta in his mouth, but the jig was up. Was it his fault he lost his appetite when he was panicking?! Oh good grief...

"...Alright." Sarah took one last bite, dabbed at her face with the knapkin, and stood up from the table. "Brandon, go get your dad another bowl. Believe me, he wants one."

"Yessum..." Brandon obeyed and endured his father's smug expression, as he took one of the empty bowls and refilled it with the pasta. On the way to the table, Brandon got a startling profile view of the pregnant man. He didn't measure much in inches anymore, but he knew his father wore size 36 waist pants, and they were down around his knees. His shirt was a few X's large in anticipation of pigging out at dinner, and that was full to bursting. If Brandon had to guess, Tanner's belly was around 65 inches now, and he wasn't even full term!

Taking it out seemed like a better idea now. That couldn't be comfortable.

But as he set down the bowl, he saw his dad's face was suddenly serious.

"Well, I'm busy as hell tonight. Tell Mom thanks for me!" Sarah put the empty bowl in Brandon's now-empty hand and excused herself.

"Watch your language, missy. But I'll tell her." Tanner motioned for Brandon to sit down and tried to lean in, but he clearly thought better of it as his belly bumped into the table. "OOF! This gut of mine sometimes, I swear...Anyway. Well, I wanted to say this to her, too, but it can wait. You should know that I'm thrilled to bits to be pregnant, boy. I mean, besides feeling pregnant: that's a queer joy in itself, but there's a more important reason. Your mom...bless her heart, we wanted more kids, but she was so exhausted with you and your sister. It was awful, watching her struggle. We just couldn't have any more with how it drained her back then. Nowadays, I'm not so sure..." Brandon felt weird at the leading sentence, but he decided to dismiss it. "But we weren't having kids all the same."

"Now?" He pulled Brandon's hand to his swollen stomach, making him feel the pair of feet pressing against the sphere of flesh and the tight T-shirt. "Now we're going to have the family we always wanted. It'll be pricey, but this account I'm busting my pregnant hump for will make it just fine!" Tanner released Brandon's now-trembling hand. "So, here's the thing: maybe show a little more enthusiasm for it, both you and your sister. Your mom would appreciate it. I would too, but you know her, she doesn't complain..."

Brandon had nothing to say. Everything his dad said had to be true, and the conclusion was clear.

"Okay." Brandon worked past his panicking nerves and rubbed his father's stomach as a show of good faith. Good Lord, it felt weird.

"Good. Now, I shouldn't let this get cold! You shouldn't either, eat up, beanpole!"

Brandon rolled his eyes and made to eat his dinner. As he ate, the situation returned to him with a new revelation: those babies inside his father were wanted. He couldn't take them out. But...was it worth the trouble if the stress from working made him miscarry, or something equally terrible?

All doors seemed closed. The amulet changed memories upon changing pregnancies...maybe this could all just be chalked up as an experimental failure.

What a mess...

Alicia stuck her tongue out then smiled"Thanks. It's so great to have a pregnant person around who isn't one of your parents. You know, someone your own age." she said "I was thinking we could have a sleep over. You know like we used to have. I haven't seen you since we were well you know, not pregnant."

"That sounds great." said Brandon
1133311.title: He heads to Alicia's room.

choices: back to the office, she had tell Laura about this!
to test the amulet out. cause why not!
12.content:
Emily just got promoted, and she couldn't contain her excitement.

After years of laboring in IntraTech, someone finally noticed that she was more than a pretty girl. She had mind so sharp it would put most medieval weaponry to shame. Someone finally saw that she had the guts and was just as capable as any man to thrive in this kill or be killed world. Someone finally saw past her features on the outside and looked deeper.

That's not to say that her outside features were anything to laugh at. Standing at about six foot three, Emily is usually quite an imposing figure to her fellow businessmen in those all important board meetings. And that's when she isn't wearing her heels. Now if only being so tall didn't make so her imposing when she was searching for love.

When one got past her height, you could see it was mostly made up of her long, toned, smooth legs that meet up with some very curvy, tantalizing thighs. Beyond those assets was a shapely and cute little ass. Higher up on her body rested two nice double D's that were struggling to break free of the power suit that adorned her body. She wanted to be taken seriously, after all.

When Emily wasn't busy fighting off the corporate sharks, she liked to hang out with her friends and exercise. And it showed. Muscles rippled across her arms and legs, but not enough to seem crazy, but she was definitely toned. Her abs were proof enough of that.

If you looked up further, you would notice a face like an angel, but her sapphire blue eyes showed you the devilish fires of determination and resolve within her. Her smile parted two luscious rose petals of lips to show teeth so white they could shine, revealing her cute dimples and slight spattering of freckles. She had a cute little nose and waves of golden blonde hair that reached her shoulders. All of these beautiful features were covered in flawless, albeit extremely pale, skin. When in the eat or be eaten world of industry, one didn't really have much time for the outdoors.

But she was most definitely outdoors now. The second she got the news from her boss, she couldn't stop smiling. She quickly took a lunch break ( a rare occurrence for Emily, who was so focused on the job at hand she rarely had time for a lunch.) hurried out of the office.

Just as she left, she made sure to hi to her friend Laura. "Hi Laura!" She said, bubbling over with excitement and joy. "Hey!" Laura replied, "the boss just informed me about you. congratulations! You've earn..oof!"

Laura abruptly cut off her statement and replaced it with a small grunt of discomfort. Emily giggled. "Little one giving you trouble again?" She asked.

"Only a little" Laura said as she rubbed her full term pregnant belly in the spot her unborn was kicking. "I just wish instead of kicking, you can help me with these calls." She cooed to her womb.
"I still don't understand why you don't just take the maternity leave they have been offering you. That you wouldn't have to work while with child."
"I told you, I can't afford maternity leave." Laura said. "You realize they pay you right?" Emily said.
"But they pay me more for when I'm working. Being a secretary for IntraTech
Doesn't exactly bring in the big bucks. And you know what rent is like in this city."

"Not anymore. I just got my bonus check with my promotion!" Emily said barely containing her excitement.

"Well isn't today just getting better and better for you!" Laura said. "That settles it. Tonight, we are celebrating! We'll get everybody and hit the town!"
"Whoa, slow down. Are you sure you wanna go party in your condition?" Emily asked.

"Hell yeah!" Laura. "I haven't been to a party since this little guy was made" this last part she pointed to her belly for emphasis. "Besides, all the movement, may kick start labor and I can finally see my beautiful baby."

"Alright" Emily said, still not sold on the idea, but knowing it would be impossible to change her friends mind. "I gotta go, I'm taking a lunch break and going for a jog. I can barely contain my excitement and still remain professional." She said, glaring at some first years who just walked by.

She heard their whispers as they walked swiftly away. "Dude, you do not want to piss off the Amazon. Just walk and don't look back."

Amazon, that was the nickname she had. And with her height, beautiful features, and viciousness in the boardroom, it was a fitting and well deserved nickname.

"Goodbye Laura." Emily said, trying to remain professional.
"Rock on Amazon." Laura replied, ruining said professionalism.
Emily gave her a look of mock anger and headed out her car, got her jogging outfit she kept there for her rare lunch breaks, changed in the car, and proceeded to jog to..well...Wherever. She didn't care, she just got promoted.

It was when she was quite a ways from the office and alone that Emily Woodward started acting very unprofessional. Clad in running shoes, yoga pants, a sports bra, a ponytail, and nothing else, Emily couldn't contain her excitement any longer. She started jumping, running, screaming and squealing like a teenage girl.

"I GOT PROMOTED!!" Emily screamed to the heavens. "YOU HEAR THAT? EMILY WOODWARD IS NOT JUST A PRETTY FACE! SHE IS AN AMAZON!!!!"

Her preaching to the heavens was abruptly cut off when she ran into a stop sign.

Pulling herself up from the ground and glad nobody was around to watch her stupidity, Emily noticed a sign underneath the stop sign.

GARAGE SALE, THE STRANGE AND MYSTERIOUS! TURN RIGHT.

Emily usually didn't fall for magic mumbo jumbo, but as explained before, Emily just got promoted.
"What the hell" she thought. "Today is already a great day, why not go laugh at people who believe in the strange and mysterious." And with that, she turned down the road and headed for the garage sale.

It took her a bit, but Emily reached the front of a house that wouldn't have looked out of during the civil war. Cars were parked all along the driveway, and people roamed the isles of wooden tables, scanning for who knows what in all those piles of junk.

Emily started to roam around as well and immediately found what she was looking for, a good laugh.

Emily giggled uncontrollably every time she saw a "mystical Spell book" or a "magic insert object name here". "How do people buy in to this stuff?" She wondered to herself. She saw several people seeming to take this stuff as the gospel truth, and that cracked Emily up more than the junk she found. She saw one kid, old enough to just be back from college, holding some coin in is hand and staring at as if it was alive."Jeez, you'd think the coin was talking to him." She muttered to herself.

And then she saw it.

Sitting on a table in front of her was a beautiful amulet.

It was simple, yet elegant at the same time. Six opals surrounded and ruby all layered with gold. The opals seemed to change color depending on where Emily stood, blue one way, pink another way, and Emily swore she could she an X carved into the ruby.

"Very beautiful, is it not?" Emily jumped, unaware of the man as tall as hers approach. Emily inspected the man, the man had black everything on, from his trench coat to his fedora atop his head.

"Hello. I am Yaral and I live here. Would you like to buy amulet?"
His accent and grammar was strange, as if this was the first time he spoke English.
"Uhh, I'm just looking" she said.

"Don't fool yourself." Yaral pitched. "You want this amulet. You want it because it is special. You see, this amulet transfers pregnancies."
Now he had completely lost Emily. "Really?" She asked incredulously. "I t transfers a woman's pregnancy?"
"Not just a woman, but men as well. Anyone to anyone." Yaral said with a smile which made Emily uneasy. "You know you want it."

Emily didn't believe for a second any of this pregnancy crap. But it was a pretty amulet.

And she did just get promoted.

"You know what? I'll take it. Not because of that pregnancy nonsense, but because it's pretty and it would be a good memory for today."

"Wonderful!" Yaral exclaimed. " all you must do to use it is point it at who you want the children to go or from, and the children will go into the stones" he pointed to the Opals around the ruby. "Then they can go into whoever the user chooses. Once they within their chosen womb, the children become their own in blood and spirit, and everyone will believe they had been that way the whole time. If you ever want to undo it all, just touch the ruby, and all will return to normal."

If it hadn't been for her years in business, Emily would never have kept a straight face, but she did and only said "sure" as she paid him the five dollars he asked for payment.

With her new Amulet around her neck, the Amazon quickly jogged back on to the main street and continued on, completely unaware that the pathway to the house in the woods vanished, as if it had never been there at all.

Emily jogged...
12.title: Meet Emily

choices: Hey, that's a lovely Amulet you're wearing!
Time to party with the girls!
121.content:
Stopping to quickly change back into her suit and untie her ponytail, Emily walked back into the IntraTech headquarters just as professional as before, albeit with her new amulet.

She quickly noticed Laura, with her pregnant womb and giggled to herself. "Watch out Laura, my amulet can steal your babies. OooOOOOoooh!" She mumbled to herself, making fake ghost noises as well.

Just for laughs she decided to "try" the amulet, just to amuse herself. She knew nothing was going to happen. But the thought of her holding the amulet in front of her and waving her arms like a magician tickled the crap out of her.

Grabbing the amulet, Emily pointed it at her friend, imagining her baby going into her own womb. The light hitting the amulet almost made look like it was glowing when...

PING!

Absolutely nothing happened, just like Emily knew it would.

I mean, really. Even if it did work, why would she make her baby go into Laura's womb? It was Emily's baby after all, she would never give it up.

Emily giggled to herself again, finding that whole situation just hilarious. She quickly waddled over to her friend, hand rubbing wherever her child kicked.
"I'm back." Emily said. "And as you can see, the walk did not help kick start labor."
"Good" Laura replied. "That means we are still on for tonight. I don't care if that baby is bulging out of your pants, we are celebrating your promotion!"

"I still don't know if I should go out bar hopping while in this condition." Emily said, still not sold on the idea, but knowing it would be impossible to change her friend's mind.
"You will be fine, you haven't enjoyed yourself since this little guy came." Laura said, placing a hand on Emily's stomach. "Besides, more walking may start labor." "I guess you're right. Tonight, let's hit the tooof!" Emily said, grunt as here unborn kicked especially hard.

"Little one giving you trouble?" Laura asked.
"A little" Emily replied. "Now if only instead of kicking, you can help with paperwork."
Emily was kicked from within as a response. "Ooh! I guess not." She said.

Laura giggled. "Man, you are lucky Emily, I wish I was pregnant."
"Maybe someday" Emily said. "I have to go settle in to my new office, see you tonight Laura." "See you tonight, rock on Amazon!" Laura replied as Emily steppes into the elevator.

Emily was so excited to finally press the button for the top floor. This is where the hotshots and bigwigs of IntraTech resided. And she was one of them. Emily was with the elites now, and the ride to the top felt like she was ascending to be crowned on her throne.

Emily took this time to examine herself. She quickly fluffed up her shoulder length hair and caressed her belly. She chuckled at the fact that she once had abs. Now when she looked down, a great ball of flesh greeted her.

And she loved it.

While business was her true passion, it was a cutthroat industry. Amelia couldn't play it pretty face and had to be tough and ruthless just like the other men in the office. She couldn't show weakness. But with her pregnancy, Emily was always reminded of how great it was to be a woman. This feeling of being full of life was second to none. While she did want meet her child, she also wanted to stay pregnant as long as she could. It was one of the best feelings of her life.

But she had to push all those thoughts aside as she reached her destination. Now was not the time for motherly pride. Now was time to get serious and ruthless. Now was the time to act like an Amazon.

When the elevator doors opened, Emily waddled into the heart of IntraTech. But she waddled with purpose.

One unlucky man thought be wise to try and lend a helping hand. He walked over to Emily with a smile on his face. "Hello Emily, would you like me to get you a seat so you can rest?"
Emily never even broke her stride. "What I NEED you to do is get me the reports on the shareholder prices, send messages to the board regarding our new public policies, and call up our new client to the meeting room to discuss our new partnership." She said without even so much as glancing at him. And just to tease and shame him a little bit more, she added. "And MS. WOODWARD would like for you to go get some peaches and tacos, I've got a craving."

Thoroughly put in his place, the young man only responded with a quick "yes Ms. Woodward." Before scurrying off to do her bidding. Emily only smirked as she waddled to her new office. "Like an Amazon." She said under breath as she Began to work.

And boy did she. They say you never work a day in you life if you love your job, but Emily loved to work, so it was pure joy to conduct business. To Emily, it was all a game. And she new how to play. She filed reports, she made calls, she held meetings, after one day of her promotion, she did so much that her boss considered promoting her again. She was a business fiend, and not even a full term pregnant belly could slow her down.

Emily sat down in her new chair and looked out into the skyline of the city, admiring the view and her office in general. It was a full room, not just some cubicle. One wall was entirely made of glass, perfect for staring at the city. While the rest was solid walls, giving her privacy. Just her and her desk and computer.

She was eating her peach filled tacos when that same man came into the office. "The client is in meeting room B, Ms. Woodward." He said.
"Thank you, you may go." She said. He was a good kid, she thought. She liked him and was thinking about hiring him as her secretary. Oh, the irony.

Emily walked into the meeting room knowing already this partnership was going to be a success. She was picked personally to handle the terms of this partnership. She knew the material, she knew all about her client, and she knew they were on equal ground and had much in common.

"Welcome, Margaret Quaine, to IntraTech." Emily said to her client.
"Emily Woodward, I have heard much about the rising star at IntraTech. Or do you prefer to be called, the Amazon?" "Whichever one gets us on better terms, Ms.Quaine." Emily said. "Please, call me Margaret, we may be from different companies, but we are most certainly equals." Margaret said raising her pregnant frame from the chair to shake Emily's hand.

"I have heard and read a lot about you too Margaret. Did you know we are the exact same length into our pregnancies?" Emily said.

"I wouldn't be doing my job if I didn't know that." Margaret said and smiled. "Look at us, in the prime of motherhood, the most wonderful time to be a woman, and we are showing those men that we can still be just as cunning and ruthless."
"Yes, well, at least you already did this once before. But even pregnant with your second child, you're still doing this."

"My my, you did read up on me. You most certainly earned your nickname."
"Well part of it was earned." Emily said, staring down at her E cup breasts, full of milk for her baby. She remembered when they were just Double D's.

"Oh please, height beauty, strength, and a mind sharper than a tack? You are an Amazon through an through." Margaret complimented.
"Thank you" Emily said. "Now let's talk terms about IntraTech and MegaCorp."

And so they discussed, quite longer than it should have really. They both kept getting side tracked into other subjects or pause whenever their babies kicked. They were a little forgetful. Emily really liked Margaret and saw her as someone she could relate to, even on pregnancy of course.

They finally closed the discussion on good terms. "I think IntraTech's need have been sufficiently filled." Emily said.
"And MegaCorp will be satisfied with those terms." Margaret replied."Congratulations. You just sealed the biggest deal in both of our companies histories." Margaret continued. "That will sure please the boss." Emily replied. Margaret laughed. "I think this is the beginning of a beautiful partnership."
121.title: Yaral Wasn't Lying.

we have to shop for our three babies!
1211.content:
"I must say, that amulet is stunning on you." Margaret said, not aware of its true potential.
"What, this?" Emily said, taking the amulet in her hand. "I just got it today at a yard when I was on my lunch break. Heh, there is a funny story involved with it too."
"Do tell." Margaret said intriguingly. "According to the salesman, this is a magic amulet." Emily waving the medallion for effect.
Margaret chuckled. "Anything to make a sale, what is its so called "magical properties"" she said, putting air quotes on the last part.
"I'll have you know that this medallion can transfer pregnancies!" Emily said with mock amazement. "All I have to do is point it at whoever I want to receive or take a pregnancy from" Emily said, pointing it at Margaret for dramatic affect. "And then imagine that child being transferred into another womb and..."

PING!

"Absolutely nothing happens!" Emily said, resulting in a fit of laughter from both women.

"Well" Margaret said, regaining her composure. "Since I'm still without child and you still have twins in your womb, I don't quite think it works."

Emily chuckled as she rubbed her twins' rapid kicks. "What a shame, and the salesman seemed like such a trustworthy guy."

Margaret chuckled and then sighed. "Look at you, in the prime of motherhood, the most wonderful time to be a woman, and you are showing these men that you can still be just as cunning and ruthless."
Emily blushed. "Yes, well, you did this once before, as I recall reading, with your own child."
"My my, you did read up on me. You most certainly earned your nickname." Margaret said.
"Well, part of it was earned." Emily said, staring down at her EE cup breasts, full of milk for her two babies. She remembered when they were just double D's.

"Oh please, height, beauty, strength, and a mind sharper than a tack? You are an Amazon through and through. Even when your pregnant with twins!" Margaret said.
Emily couldn't help but blush. "Thank you" she said. "That means a lot."

Emily quickly regained her composure and said in a dignified manner. "Now let's talk terms about IntraTech and MegaCorp."

And so the the discussions commenced, taking significantly longer than should have. Emily was more than a little forgetful thanks to the hormones raging within her. She would often get sidetracked on to other subjects, or pause whenever her babies kicked, only to have Margaret bring her back on topic. Emily liked Margaret and thought they would make good friends.

"I think IntraTech's needs have been sufficiently filled." Emily said, closing the discussion on good terms.
"And I'm sure MegaCorp will be satisfied with this agreement." Margaret said. She stood up and so did Emily, (a harder task for her.) So they could shake hands.
"Congratulations, you just sealed the biggest deal in both our companies histories."
Margaret exclaimed. Emily blushed at the accomplishment. "That will sure please the boss." Was all she could think to say, but it made Margaret laugh all the same.
"I think this is the beginning of a beautiful partnership." She said.

As she turned to eave the meeting room, Margaret stopped her.
"Might I give you some advice? From one working mother to another?"
Emily only smiled, "well your certainly have the experience, and I need all the help I can get." Margaret chuckled. "Well, I know you pride yourself on professionalism, and that's why you wear the suit yes?"
Emily nodded. "I want be known for my work, not my looks." She said.
"As you should, I know I get judged just like you. You may be the Amazon, but they are known for their brutality just as much as their beauty." Margaret said. "You wear the suit to look like the other men, but when your pregnant with two children, it makes you look rather....let's say "suggestive"."

Emily looked down at herself and noticed that Margaret was right. The blazer wouldn't even button close and her blouse was struggling to stay buttoned up as well. One could see many little gaps of her pale flesh between the buttons. Her breasts weren't exactly helping either. Her blouse couldn't reach the top buttons over breasts, so Emily was showing a lot of cleavage. More than she would ever show if she wasn't pregnant. She couldn't see it, but she could feel that her business slack were unzipped by the size of her belly. Emily realized what Margaret meant, she looked really "suggestive".

"My advice is this." Margaret said. "I would go out and get some maternity work wear if you are determined to continue your job while expecting. You will look feminine, professional, and if you act right, no one will treat you differently."

What Margaret said made a lot of sense. She didn't have any maternity work clothes. Come to think of it, she didn't have any maternity clothes at all. In fact, she hadn't bought anything her babies might need! Cribs, high chairs, car seats, baby food, nothing. She was always so focused on working and not letting on not letting her babies slow her down, she forgot to prepare for the babies period! She would have to go shopping soon. With a quick "Thank you and pleasure doing business with you." Emily turned and headed out the meeting room to go hone for the day.

Just as she was about to leave, her boss called for her. "WOODWARD!" He shouted. "GET IN HERE!" He pointed to his office and Emily waddled her way over. "Yes Mr. Wazowski."

She sat down in front of his desk while he sat behind it. Mr. Wazowski was a senior partner on the board of directors, and no nonsense man with a big gut and an even bigger temper. His balding head and bushy eyebrows made him like he had come from a cartoon. But never tell him that.

Emily was worried. People rarely came to Mr. Wazowski's office unless they were in trouble. Emily couldn't imagine what she had done. She worked her hardest to show she could make in the big leagues. She just signed on MegaCorp, for Pete's sake! She was terrified she didn't actually seal the deal and that she was being demoted.

"Do you know why you are here?" Mr.Wazowski saidin his gravely voice. "Not really sir." Emily said, her sweet melodic voice paling in comparison his. "You are here because your performance today." Mr. Wazowski said. "Oh god, what did I do wrong! I swear I can improve! Did MegaCorp not sign on?" Emily frantically blurted out, rubbing her belly for comfort. "Slow down there! I don't want your water breaking all over my new carpet!" He said, showing where his priorities lay. "You did nothing wrong! In fact, just from today, shares are up three percent, and one of the biggest deals ever made by us was made by you." Mr.Wazowski continued. "You see, we've been watching you Woodward, the board and I. This promotion was a test to see if you were serious about this company, and after one day I can already see that. We would like to offer a position on the board of directors. What do you say?"

Emily was taken completely by surprise, and barely managed to mumble out "yes" before it fully hit her "yes Yes OH MY GOD YES! Thank you so much! You won't ever regret this."
Mr. Wazowski smiled. "I'm sure I won't. Congrats kid, we'll see you when you came back." "What?" Emily asked, confused. "Your maternity leave, we will see you when you get back from maternity leave." Mr. Wazowski said. Emily only smiled. "Sir, I can tell I will be here exactly at ten tomorrow for the daily meeting." Mr. Wazowski was taken aback "Woodward, you could pop any minute we can't be interrupted in our meeting by you having children. Unacceptable!" Emily remained persistent. "You asked if a I was serious about IntraTech, and I am. Nothing will stop me. Not even these two." She said patting her stomach.

Mr. Wazowski, seeing the fire in her eyes, relented. "Alright" he conceded. "The meeting for directors is at ten sharp tomorrow. Now go out and celebrate, you crazy kid." With a quick "thank you." Emily walked out of the office and headed to her car.


Emily was ecstatic, she got promoted today, she got her own office, she couldn't believe how much she had gotten done today, she sealed the biggest deal of her life and now this? This was the best day of her life! She screamed and squealed uncontrollably, and acting all together quite unprofessionally. Just earlier today, she was a mid level manager, now she has a part in deciding how the entire company will go forward. A small part, she was just a junior partner, but a part nonetheless.
She stood in the parking lot , wondering what had changed to give her this meteoric rise within IntraTech, then realized it was hanging around her neck.

"This must be like a good luck charm!" She said as she broke into another fit of teenage squeals. Some unfortunate woman walking up the street was just wadding her way up the road when this was happening. Emily quickly walked up to said woman and, for no reason, kissed her firmly on her lips.

"I got a position on the board thanks to my magic amulet!" Emily screeched. Not sure why in the world she would do such a thing but was way to excited to control herself. The woman, understandably shocked, only stared on awed silence.

Emily promptly grabbed the amulet and shoved in the woman's face. "All I have to is point it at who i want and imagine and concentrate real hard.."

PING!

and nothing happens! But its lucky!" Emily breaking into a fit of giggles so excited she was almost hysterical. "Good for you." Was all the woman could say as she broke free of Emily's grip and quickly walked off. She feared for the babies within that girl's belly. "I'm glad I'm not pregnant." She mumbled to herself. Even though she just was.

After calming down, Emily glanced at the amulet. "You can't transfer pregnancies, but you sure are lucky." She said to it. "Or maybe its just you three." She cooed to her stomach. And with that, Emily waddled over to her car, struggled to fit her triplet filled belly in said car and drove away.
1211.title: Another Day, Another Baby. Or More.

choices: she saw the time. the stores for maternity wear are about to close!
a heavily pregnant woman walks in!
12111.content:
Emily had to pull the seat back as far as it would go to fit in her car, and yet she could feel the steering wheel brush against her stomach. She knew she probably should have stopped driving awhile ago, but she didn't care, she had places to be.

Emily arrived at her place and squirmed her way out of the car. It was a nice home, a two story house out in the suburbs of the city. She waddled her way inside, and saw how truly dire her situation was.

Not only did she have nothing for her children, her home was completely unsuited for family life. Exercise equipment littered the home, the only parts of it she uses now are the exercise ball and the treadmill for kick starting labor. Pictures of her and her friends at parties, heavily intoxicated, were all around. She even saw a picture of herself in her bikini before she was pregnant, and she laughed at how different she looked compared to then. Well, there was really one major difference.
Magazines, very unfitting for children to read, littered the furniture as well. What's more, there were no signs that a pregnant woman lived here. There were no pictures of her belly at different stages, no ultrasound results. Emily didn't even remember going to see a doctor before. If you looked at her house, it looked as if she became pregnant this morning!

It hit Emily pretty hard how much she ignored her children for the sake of work. This brought a troubling line of thought. "My god, if I can't even take care of my children before theft are born, what kind of mother will I be?" That was a bad thought. Being a single mother is tough, but a single mother of three? Terrifying.

"This place is going to get remodeled. Big time." She exclaimed as she rubbed her belly. "But first..." She smirked and headed to her closet.

Upon opening said closet, Emily was slightly disappointed. There were a lot more suits and formal wear than regular clothes in her closet. Emily frowned at the suits and dresses she could no longer wear and looked down at the suit she was wearing.

Her blazer didn't even come close around her, and almost every button had popped off. A few straggling buttons held on in crucial places on her belly at least, but one could see huge gaps of pale flesh several button lengths apart. A singular button kept the blouse from revealing her bra she now noticed was incredibly tight. That is what happens when you try to fit F cup breasts in a double D bra. She could feel her pants were lower, unable to fit around her girth, and when she felt back there, Emily could feel her panties poking out from the pants. Margaret was putting it nicely, she looked like the office slut.

"Yeah, maternity clothes are a must now." She said as she now searched for a rare normal outfit. She finally settled on what fit her best instead of what looked good. She had a pair of sweat pants on that were straining to stay on followed with a black T-shirt that only reached about halfway down her stomach, showing a lot of her triplet filled womb.
After long consideration, Emily decided to go without a bra, knowing it would be just to uncomfortable for the night. Letting the girls hang free, Emily waddled back to the car and drove to where Laura said she and her friends would be.

Why in the world Laura decided to have a party for a pregnant woman in a busy bar, Emily will never know. But it was, and that was where Emily found herself now. Emily Immediately saw her friends by the corner booth and waddled her way over.
"Why did you have to pick a booth?" Emily asked Laura. "You realize how hard it is to get into tight spaces while carrying three children in my stomach?"
"Oh quit whining. You need the exercise anyway, fatty." Laura joked.
"At least I exercise Laura." Emily retorted, finally managing to wriggle in to the booth. "You guys are never going to guess what happened today!"
"Honey, we know what today, that's why we are celebrating!" Laura said gesturing to all her friends in the booth.
"No something else happened today." Emily said, as she related to her friends the events that had taken place that day.

That news was met with lots of screams of delight and congratulations. "I can't believe it" Laura squealed. "Two promotions in one day? You are one lucky girl!"
"Your right." Emily said. "You know what, the next round of drinks are on me. Let me go tell the bartender."

After another battle of wriggling, Emily managed to get out of the booth and head for the bar. Waddling her way to the bar, Emily placed her groups order.

"I need four whiskies and one sooOOH MY GOD! YOU!" Emily exclaimed.

Standing behind the bar, preparing her drinks, was the woman Emily had kissed earlier that day.

The woman seemed to recognize her too. "You!" She said. "You were the crazy woman earlier today! You were the one that kissed me!"

Emily wanted nothing more than to disappear. "I'm so sorry about that! I didn't know what I was doing! I don't even know why I kissed you! I'm so sorry!" She said in rapid succession. Her face would put most lobsters to shame.

Then the woman did something completely unexpected, she started to laugh.
"Haha, slow down! It was worth it to see that reaction right there! Can I at least get a name for my secret admirer?" The woman joked. "I'm Emily." She said, her face still beet red.
